parameter.name: TRIGINEN
parameter.desc: Enables a cross trigger event to the corresponding channel when an CTITRIGIN is activated. 1 = enables the CTITRIGIN signal to generate an event on the respective channel of the CTM. There is one bit of the register for each of the four channels. For example in register CTIINEN0, TRIGINEN[0] set to 1 enables CTITRIGIN onto channel 0. 0 = disables the CTITRIGIN signal from generating an event on the respective channel of the CTM.

parameter.name: TRIGOUTEN
parameter.desc: Changing the value of this bit from a 0 to a 1 enables a channel event for the corresponding channel to generate an CTITRIGOUT output: 0 = the channel input (CTICHIN) from the CTM is not routed to the CTITRIGOUT output 1 = the channel input (CTICHIN) from the CTM is routed to the CTITRIGOUT output. There is one bit for each of the four channels. For example in register CTIOUTEN0, enabling bit 0 enables CTICHIN[0] to cause a trigger event on the CTITRIGOUT[0] output.

parameter.name: TRIGOUTEN
parameter.desc: Changing the value of this bit from a 0 to a 1 enables a channel event for the corresponding channel to generate an CTITRIGOUT output: 0 = the channel input (CTICHIN) from the CTM is not routed to the CTITRIGOUT output 1 = the channel input (CTICHIN) from the CTM is routed to the CTITRIGOUT output. parameter.name: TRIGINSTATUS
parameter.desc: Shows the status of the CTITRIGIN inputs: 1 = CTITRIGIN is active 0 = CTITRIGIN is inactive. Because the register provides a view of the raw CTITRIGIN inputs, the reset value is unknown. There is one bit of the register for each trigger input.

parameter.name: TRIGOUTSTATUS
parameter.desc: Shows the status of the CTITRIGOUT outputs. 1 = CTITRIGOUT is active 0 = CTITRIGOUT is inactive (reset). There is one bit of the register for each trigger output.

parameter.name: CTCHINSTATUS
parameter.desc: Shows the status of the CTICHIN inputs: 1 = CTICHIN is active 0 = CTICHIN is inactive. Because the register provides a view of the raw CTICHIN inputs from the CTM, the reset value is unknown. There is one bit of the register for each channel input.

parameter.name: CTCHOUTSTATUS
parameter.desc: Shows the status of the CTICHOUT outputs. 1 = CTICHOUT is active 0 = CTICHOUT is inactive (reset). There is one bit of the register for each channel output.

parameter.desc: Enable CTICHOUT1.

parameter.desc: Enable CTICHOUT0.

parameter.desc: Implementation defined ASIC control, value written to the register is output on ASICCTL[7:0].

parameter.desc: Set the value of the CTTRIGOUT outputs

parameter.desc: Read the values of the CTCHOUTACK inputs

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Enable IT Registers

parameter.name: SET
parameter.desc: The claim tag register is used for any interrogating tools to determine if the device is being programmed or has been programmed. Read: 1= Claim tag is implemented, 0 = Claim tag is not implemented Write: 1= Set claim tag bit, 0= No effect

parameter.name: CLEAR
parameter.desc: The claim tag register is used for any interrogating tools to determine if the device is being programmed or has been programmed. Read: Current value of claim tag. Write: 1= Clear claim tag bit, 0= No effect

parameter.name: KEY
parameter.desc: Write Access Code. Write behavior depends on PADDRDBG31 pin: - PADDRDBG31=0 (lower 2GB): After reset (via PRESETDBGn), CTI is locked, i.e., writes to all other registers using lower 2GB addresses are ignored. To unlock, 0xC5ACCE55 must be written this register. After the required registers are written, to lock again, write a value other than 0xC5ACCE55 to this register. - PADDRDBG31=1 (upper 2GB): CTI is unlocked when upper 2GB addresses are used to write to all the registers. However, write to this register is ignored using a upper 2GB address! Note: read from this register always returns 0, regardless of PADDRDBG31.

parameter.name: n8BIT
parameter.desc: Set to 0 since CTI implements a 32-bit lock access register

parameter.name: STATUS
parameter.desc: Read behavior depends on PADDRDBG31 pin: - PADDRDBG31=0 (lower 2GB): When a lower 2GB address is used to read this register, this bit indicates whether CTI is in locked state (1= locked, 0= unlocked). - PADDRDBG31=1 (upper 2GB): always returns 0.

parameter.name: IMP
parameter.desc: Read behavior depends on PADDRDBG31 pin: - PADDRDBG31=0 (lower 2GB): always returns 1, meaning lock mechanism are implemented. - PADDRDBG31=1 (upper 2GB): always returns 0, meaning lock mechanism is NOT implemented.

parameter.name: GLBEN
parameter.desc: Enables or disables the ECT. When disabled, all cross triggering mapping logic functionality is disabled for this processor.

parameter.name: INTACK
parameter.desc: Acknowledges the corresponding CTITRIGOUT output: 1 = CTITRIGOUT is acknowledged and is cleared when MAPTRIGOUT is LOW. 0 = no effect There is one bit of the register for each CTITRIGOUT output.

parameter.name: APPSET
parameter.desc: Setting a bit HIGH generates a channel event for the selected channel. Read: 0 = application trigger inactive (reset) 1 = application trigger active. Write: 0 = no effect 1 = generate channel event. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

parameter.name: APPCLEAR
parameter.desc: Clears corresponding bits in the CTIAPPSET register. 1 = application trigger disabled in the CTIAPPSET register 0 = no effect. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

parameter.name: APPULSE
parameter.desc: Setting a bit HIGH generates a channel event pulse for the selected channel. Write: 1 = channel event pulse generated for one CTICLK period 0 = no effect. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

parameter.name: TRIGINEN
parameter.desc: Enables a cross trigger event to the corresponding channel when an CTITRIGIN is activated. 1 = enables the CTITRIGIN signal to generate an event on the respective channel of the CTM. There is one bit of the register for each of the four channels. For example in register CTIINEN0, TRIGINEN[0] set to 1 enables CTITRIGIN onto channel 0. 0 = disables the CTITRIGIN signal from generating an event on the respective channel of the CTM.

parameter.desc: Enables a cross trigger event to the corresponding channel when an CTITRIGIN is activated. 1 = enables the CTITRIGIN signal to generate an event on the respective channel of the CTM. There is one bit of the register for each of the four channels. For example in register CTIINEN0, TRIGINEN[0] set to 1 enables CTITRIGIN onto channel 0. 0 = disables the CTITRIGIN signal from generating an event on the respective channel of the CTM.

parameter.name: TRIGOUTEN
parameter.desc: Changing the value of this bit from a 0 to a 1 enables a channel event for the corresponding channel to generate an CTITRIGOUT output: 0 = the channel input (CTICHIN) from the CTM is not routed to the CTITRIGOUT output 1 = the channel input (CTICHIN) from the CTM is routed to the CTITRIGOUT output. parameter.name: TRIGINSTATUS
parameter.desc: Shows the status of the CTITRIGIN inputs: 1 = CTITRIGIN is active 0 = CTITRIGIN is inactive. Because the register provides a view of the raw CTITRIGIN inputs, the reset value is unknown. There is one bit of the register for each trigger input.

parameter.name: TRIGOUTSTATUS
parameter.desc: Shows the status of the CTITRIGOUT outputs. 1 = CTITRIGOUT is active 0 = CTITRIGOUT is inactive (reset). There is one bit of the register for each trigger output.

parameter.name: CTCHINSTATUS
parameter.desc: Shows the status of the CTICHIN inputs: 1 = CTICHIN is active 0 = CTICHIN is inactive. Because the register provides a view of the raw CTICHIN inputs from the CTM, the reset value is unknown. There is one bit of the register for each channel input.

parameter.name: CTCHOUTSTATUS
parameter.desc: Shows the status of the CTICHOUT outputs. 1 = CTICHOUT is active 0 = CTICHOUT is inactive (reset). There is one bit of the register for each channel output.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Enable IT Registers

parameter.name: SET
parameter.desc: The claim tag register is used for any interrogating tools to determine if the device is being programmed or has been programmed. Read: 1= Claim tag is implemented, 0 = Claim tag is not implemented Write: 1= Set claim tag bit, 0= No effect

parameter.name: CLEAR
parameter.desc: The claim tag register is used for any interrogating tools to determine if the device is being programmed or has been programmed. Read: Current value of claim tag. Write: 1= Clear claim tag bit, 0= No effect

parameter.name: KEY
parameter.desc: Write Access Code. Write behavior depends on PADDRDBG31 pin: - PADDRDBG31=0 (lower 2GB): After reset (via PRESETDBGn), CTI is locked, i.e., writes to all other registers using lower 2GB addresses are ignored. To unlock, 0xC5ACCE55 must be written this register. After the required registers are written, to lock again, write a value other than 0xC5ACCE55 to this register. - PADDRDBG31=1 (upper 2GB): CTI is unlocked when upper 2GB addresses are used to write to all the registers. However, write to this register is ignored using a upper 2GB address! Note: read from this register always returns 0, regardless of PADDRDBG31.

parameter.name: n8BIT
parameter.desc: Set to 0 since CTI implements a 32-bit lock access register

parameter.name: STATUS
parameter.desc: Read behavior depends on PADDRDBG31 pin: - PADDRDBG31=0 (lower 2GB): When a lower 2GB address is used to read this register, this bit indicates whether CTI is in locked state (1= locked, 0= unlocked). - PADDRDBG31=1 (upper 2GB): always returns 0.

parameter.name: IMP
parameter.desc: Read behavior depends on PADDRDBG31 pin: - PADDRDBG31=0 (lower 2GB): always returns 1, meaning lock mechanism are implemented. - PADDRDBG31=1 (upper 2GB): always returns 0, meaning lock mechanism is NOT implemented.

parameter.name: GLBEN
parameter.desc: Enables or disables the ECT. When disabled, all cross triggering mapping logic functionality is disabled for this processor.

parameter.name: INTACK
parameter.desc: Acknowledges the corresponding CTITRIGOUT output: 1 = CTITRIGOUT is acknowledged and is cleared when MAPTRIGOUT is LOW. 0 = no effect There is one bit of the register for each CTITRIGOUT output.

parameter.name: APPSET
parameter.desc: Setting a bit HIGH generates a channel event for the selected channel. Read: 0 = application trigger inactive (reset) 1 = application trigger active. Write: 0 = no effect 1 = generate channel event. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

parameter.name: APPCLEAR
parameter.desc: Clears corresponding bits in the CTIAPPSET register. 1 = application trigger disabled in the CTIAPPSET register 0 = no effect. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

parameter.name: APPULSE
parameter.desc: Setting a bit HIGH generates a channel event pulse for the selected channel. Write: 1 = channel event pulse generated for one CTICLK period 0 = no effect. There is one bit of the register for each channel.

parameter.name: STPBRK
parameter.desc: Stop transmitter break. 1 = stop transmission of the break.

parameter.name: STTBRK
parameter.desc: Start transmitter break 1 = start to transmit a break. Can only be set if STPBRK (Stop transmitter break) is not high.

parameter.name: RSTTO
parameter.desc: Restart receiver timeout counter 1 = receiver timeout counter is restarted

parameter.name: TXDIS
parameter.desc: Transmit disable. 1, the transmitter is disabled

parameter.name: TXEN
parameter.desc: Transmit enable. 1, the transmitter is enabled, provided the TXDIS field is set to 0.

parameter.name: RXDIS
parameter.desc: Receive disable. 1= receiver is enabled

parameter.name: RXEN
parameter.desc: Receive enable. 1=the receiver logic is enabled, provided RXDIS field is set to 0

parameter.name: TXRES
parameter.desc: Software reset for TX data path. 1=the transmitter logic is reset and all pending transmitter data is discarded self clear

parameter.name: RXRES
parameter.desc: Software reset for RX data path 1=receiver logic is reset and all pending receiver data is discarded self clear

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: IRMODE
parameter.desc: Enable IrDA mode 0 : Default UART mode 1 : Enable IrDA mode

parameter.name: UCLKEN
parameter.desc: External uart_clk source select 0 : APB clock, pclk 1 : a user-defined clock

parameter.name: STPBRK
parameter.desc: Stop transmitter break. 1 = stop transmission of the break.

parameter.name: STTBRK
parameter.desc: Start transmitter break 1 = start to transmit a break. Can only be set if STPBRK (Stop transmitter break) is not high.

parameter.name: RSTTO
parameter.desc: Restart receiver timeout counter 1 = receiver timeout counter is restarted

parameter.name: TXDIS
parameter.desc: Transmit disable. 1, the transmitter is disabled

parameter.name: TXEN
parameter.desc: Transmit enable. 1, the transmitter is enabled, provided the TXDIS field is set to 0.

parameter.name: RXDIS
parameter.desc: Receive disable. 1= receiver is enabled

parameter.name: RXEN
parameter.desc: Receive enable. 1=the receiver logic is enabled, provided RXDIS field is set to 0

parameter.name: TXRES
parameter.desc: Software reset for TX data path. 1=the transmitter logic is reset and all pending transmitter data is discarded self clear

parameter.name: RXRES
parameter.desc: Software reset for RX data path 1=receiver logic is reset and all pending receiver data is discarded self clear

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: flush_next_rx_dpram_pkt
parameter.desc: Flush the next packet from the external RX DPRAM. Writing one to this bit will only have an effect if the DMA is not currently writing a packet already stored in the DPRAM to memory.

parameter.name: tx_pfc_pri_pri_pause_frame
parameter.desc: Transmit PFC Priority Based Pause Frame. Takes the values stored in the Transmit PFC Pause Register

parameter.name: en_pfc_pri_pause_rx
parameter.desc: Enable PFC Priority Based Pause Reception capabilities. Setting this bit will enable PFC negotiation and recognition of priority based pause frames.

parameter.name: str_rx_timestamp
parameter.desc: Store receive time stamp to memory. Setting this bit to one will cause the CRC of every received frame to be replaced with the value of the nanoseconds field of the 1588 timer that was captured as the receive frame passed the message time stamp point. Set to zero for normal operation.

parameter.name: reserved_rd_snapshot
parameter.desc: Reserved. Do not modify.

parameter.name: reserved_take_snapshot
parameter.desc: Reserved. Do not modify.

parameter.name: tx_zeroq_pause_frame
parameter.desc: Transmit zero quantum pause frame - writing one to this bit causes a pause frame with zero quantum to be transmitted.

parameter.name: tx_pause_frame
parameter.desc: Transmit pause frame - writing one to this bit causes a pause frame to be transmitted.

parameter.name: tx_halt
parameter.desc: Transmit halt - writing one to this bit halts transmission as soon as any ongoing frame transmission ends.

parameter.name: start_tx
parameter.desc: Start transmission - writing one to this bit starts transmission.

parameter.name: back_pressure
parameter.desc: Back pressure - if set in 10M or 100M half duplex mode will force collisions on all received frames. Ignored in gigabit half duplex mode.

parameter.name: wren_stat_regs
parameter.desc: Write enable for statistics registers - setting this bit to one means the statistics registers can be written for functional test purposes.

parameter.name: incr_stat_regs
parameter.desc: Incremental statistics registers - this bit is write only. Writing a one increments all the statistics registers by one for test purposes.

parameter.name: clear_stat_regs
parameter.desc: Clear statistics registers - this bit is write only. Writing a one clears the statistics registers.

parameter.name: mgmt_port_en
parameter.desc: Management port enable - set to one to enable the management port. When zero forces mdio to high impedance state and mdc low.

parameter.name: tx_en
parameter.desc: Transmit enable - when set, it enables the GEM transmitter to send data. When reset transmission will stop immediately, the transmit pipeline and control registers will be cleared and the transmit queue pointer register will reset to point to the start of the transmit descriptor list.

parameter.name: rx_en
parameter.desc: Receive enable - when set, it enables the GEM to receive data. When reset frame reception will stop immediately and the receive pipeline will be cleared. The receive queue pointer register is unaffected.

parameter.name: loopback_local
parameter.desc: Loop back local - asserts the loopback_local signal to the system clock generator. Also connects txd to rxd, tx_en to rx_dv and forces full duplex mode. Bit 11 of the network configuration register must be set low to disable TBI mode when in internal loopback. rx_clk and tx_clk may malfunction as the GEM is switched into and out of internal loop back. It is important that receive and transmit circuits have already been disabled when making the switch into and out of internal loop back. Local loopback functionality isn't available in the EP107 Pele Emulation Platform, because the clocking doesn't map well into an FPGA.

parameter.name: reserved_loopback
parameter.desc: Reserved. Do not modify.

parameter.name: unidir_en
parameter.desc: Uni-direction-enable. When low the PCS will transmit idle symbols if the link goes down. When high the PCS can transmit frame data when the link is down.

parameter.name: ignore_ipg_rx_er
parameter.desc: Ignore IPG rx_er. When set rx_er has no effect on the GEM's operation when rx_dv is low. Set this when using the RGMII wrapper in half-duplex mode.

parameter.name: rx_bad_preamble
parameter.desc: Receive bad preamble. When set frames with non-standard preamble are not rejected.

parameter.name: ipg_stretch_en
parameter.desc: IPG stretch enable - when set the transmit IPG can be increased above 96 bit times depending on the previous frame length using the IPG stretch register.

parameter.name: sgmii_en
parameter.desc: SGMII mode enable - changes behaviour of the auto-negotiation advertisement and link partner ability registers to meet the requirements of SGMII and reduces the duration of the link timer from 10 ms to 1.6 ms

parameter.name: ignore_rx_fcs
parameter.desc: Ignore RX FCS - when set frames with FCS/CRC errors will not be rejected. FCS error statistics will still be collected for frames with bad FCS and FCS status will be recorded in frame's DMA descriptor. For normal operation this bit must be set to zero.

parameter.name: rx_hd_while_tx
parameter.desc: Enable frames to be received in half-duplex mode while transmitting.

parameter.name: rx_chksum_offld_en
parameter.desc: Receive checksum offload enable - when set, the receive checksum engine is enabled. Frames with bad IP, TCP or UDP checksums are discarded.

parameter.name: dis_cp_pause_frame
parameter.desc: Disable copy of pause frames - set to one to prevent valid pause frames being copied to memory. When set, pause frames are not copied to memory regardless of the state of the copy all frames bit; whether a hash match is found or whether a type ID match is identified. If a destination address match is found the pause frame will be copied to memory. Note that valid pause frames received will still increment pause statistics and pause the transmission of frames as required.

parameter.name: dbus_width
parameter.desc: Data bus width - set according to AMBA AHB or external FIFO data bus width. The reset value for this can be changed by defining a new value for gem_dma_bus_width_def in gem_defs.v Only valid bus widths may be written if the system is configured to a maximum width less than 128-bits. Pele defines gem_dma_bus_width_def as 2'b00. 00: 32 bit AMBA AHB data bus width 01: 64 bit AMBA AHB data bus width 10: 128 bit AMBA AHB data bus width 11: 128 bit AMBA AHB data bus width

parameter.name: mdc_clk_div
parameter.desc: MDC clock division - set according to pclk speed. These three bits determine the number pclk will be divided by to generate MDC. For conformance with the 802.3 specification, MDC must not exceed 2.5 MHz (MDC is only active during MDIO read and write operations). The reset value for this can be changed by defining a new value for gem_mdc_clock_div in gem_defs.v. Pele defines gem_mdc_clock_div as 3'b010. 000: divide pclk by 8 (pclk up to 20 MHz) 001: divide pclk by 16 (pclk up to 40 MHz) 010: divide pclk by 32 (pclk up to 80 MHz) 011: divide pclk by 48 (pclk up to 120MHz) 100: divide pclk by 64 (pclk up to 160 MHz) 101: divide pclk by 96 (pclk up to 240 MHz) 110: divide pclk by 128 (pclk up to 320 MHz) 111: divide pclk by 224 (pclk up to 540 MHz)

parameter.name: fcs_remove
parameter.desc: FCS remove - setting this bit will cause received frames to be written to memory without their frame check sequence (last 4 bytes). The frame length indicated will be reduced by four bytes in this mode.

parameter.name: len_err_frame_disc
parameter.desc: Length field error frame discard - setting this bit causes frames with a measured length shorter than the extracted length field (as indicated by bytes 13 and 14 in a non-VLAN tagged frame) to be discarded. This only applies to frames with a length field less than 0x0600.

parameter.name: rx_buf_offset
parameter.desc: Receive buffer offset - indicates the number of bytes by which the received data is offset from the start of the receive buffer.

parameter.name: pause_en
parameter.desc: Pause enable - when set, transmission will pause if a non zero 802.3 classic pause frame is received and PFC has not been negotiated.

parameter.name: retry_test
parameter.desc: Retry test - must be set to zero for normal operation. If set to one the backoff between collisions will always be one slot time. Setting this bit to one helps test the too many retries condition. Also used in the pause frame tests to reduce the pause counter's decrement time from 512 bit times, to every rx_clk cycle.

parameter.name: pcs_sel
parameter.desc: PCS select - selects between MII/GMII and TBI. Must be set for SGMII operation. 0: GMII/MII interface enabled, TBI disabled 1: TBI enabled, GMII/MII disabled

parameter.name: gige_en
parameter.desc: Gigabit mode enable - setting this bit configures the GEM for 1000 Mbps operation. 0: 10/100 operation using MII or TBI interface 1: Gigabit operation using GMII or TBI interface

parameter.name: ext_addr_match_en
parameter.desc: External address match enable - when set the external address match interface can be used to copy frames to memory.

parameter.name: reserved_rx_1536_byte_frames
parameter.desc: Reserved. Do not modify.

parameter.name: uni_hash_en
parameter.desc: Unicast hash enable - when set, unicast frames will be accepted when the 6 bit hash function of the destination address points to a bit that is set in the hash register.

parameter.name: multi_hash_en
parameter.desc: Multicast hash enable - when set, multicast frames will be accepted when the 6 bit hash function of the destination address points to a bit that is set in the hash register.

parameter.name: no_broadcast
parameter.desc: No broadcast - when set to logic one, frames addressed to the broadcast address of all ones will not be accepted.

parameter.name: copy_all
parameter.desc: Copy all frames - when set to logic one, all valid frames will be accepted.

parameter.name: reserved_jumbo_en
parameter.desc: Reserved. Do not modify.

parameter.name: disc_non_vlan
parameter.desc: Discard non-VLAN frames - when set only VLAN tagged frames will be passed to the address matching logic.

parameter.name: full_duplex
parameter.desc: Full duplex - if set to logic one, the transmit block ignores the state of collision and carrier sense and allows receive while transmitting. Also controls the half_duplex pin.

parameter.name: speed
parameter.desc: Speed - set to logic one to indicate 100Mbps operation, logic zero for 10Mbps. The value of this pin is reflected on the speed_mode[0] output pin.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write

parameter.name: pfc_pri_pause_neg
parameter.desc: Set when PFC Priority Based Pause has been negotiated.

parameter.name: pcs_autoneg_pause_tx_res
parameter.desc: PCS auto-negotiation pause transmit resolution.

parameter.name: pcs_autoneg_pause_rx_res
parameter.desc: PCS auto-negotiation pause receive resolution

parameter.name: pcs_autoneg_dup_res
parameter.desc: PCS auto-negotiation duplex resolution. Set to one if the resolution function determines that both devices are capable of full duplex operation. If zero half-duplex operation is possible as long as bit 0 (PCS link state) is also one.

parameter.name: phy_mgmt_idle
parameter.desc: The PHY management logic is idle (i.e. has completed).

parameter.name: mdio_in_pin_status
parameter.desc: Returns status of the mdio_in pin

parameter.name: pcs_link_state
parameter.desc: Returns status of PCS link state. If auto-negotiation is disabled this returns the synchronisation status. If auto-negotiation is enabled it is set in the LINK_OK state as long as a compatible duplex mode is resolved, it is always set in the LINK_OK state in SGMII mode.

parameter.name: user_in
parameter.desc: User programmable inputs - the upper 16 bits of this register are used to monitor the state of the user inputs. A logic one read from a bit in this range will correspond to the input being in a high state. A logic zero read from a bit in this range will correspond to the input being in a low state. Any unused bits will be read as zero. Writing to any bits in this range will have no functional effect.

parameter.name: user_out
parameter.desc: User programmable outputs - the lower 16 bits of this register are used to control the state of the user outputs. A logic one written to a bit in this range will cause the corresponding output to be set high. A logic zero written to a bit in this range shall cause the corresponding output to be forced low. Any unused bits will be read as logic zero. Writing to any unused bits in this range will have no functional effect.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: disc_when_no_ahb
parameter.desc: When set, the GEM DMA will automatically discard receive packets from the receiver packet buffer memory when no AHB resource is available. When low, then received packets will remain to be stored in the SRAM based packet buffer until AHB buffer resource next becomes available.

parameter.name: ahb_mem_rx_buf_size
parameter.desc: DMA receive buffer size in AHB system memory. The value defined by these bits determines the size of buffer to use in main AHB system memory when writing received data. The value is defined in multiples of 64 bytes such that a value of 0x01 corresponds to buffers of 64 bytes, 0x02 corresponds to 128 bytes etc. For example:- 0x02: 128 byte 0x18: 1536 byte (1*max length frame/buffer) 0xA0: 10240 byte (1*10K jumbo frame/buffer) Note that this value should never be written as zero.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: csum_gen_offload_en
parameter.desc: Transmitter IP, TCP and UDP checksum generation offload enable. When set, the transmitter checksum generation engine is enabled, to calculate and substitute checksums for transmit frames. When clear, frame data is unaffected. If the GEM is not configured to use the DMA packet buffer, this bit is not implemented and will be treated as reserved, read as zero, ignored on write. Pele uses packet buffer.

parameter.name: tx_pktbuf_memsz_sel
parameter.desc: Transmitter packet buffer memory size select - Having this bit at zero halves the amount of memory used for the transmit packet buffer. This reduces the amount of memory used by the GEM. It is important to set this bit to one if the full configured physical memory is available. The value in brackets below represents the size that would result for the default maximum configured memory size of 4 Kbytes. 1: Use full configured addressable space (4 Kb) 0: Do not use top address bit (2 Kb) If the GEM is not configured to use the DMA packet buffer, this bit is not implemented and will be treated as reserved, read as zero, ignored on write. Pele uses packet buffer

parameter.name: rx_pktbuf_memsz_sel
parameter.desc: Receiver packet buffer memory size select - Having these bits at less than 11 reduces the amount of memory used for the receive packet buffer. This reduces the amount of memory used by the GEM. It is important to set these bits both to one if the full configured physical memory is available. The value in brackets below represents the size that would result for the default maximum configured memory size of 8 Kbytes. 11: Use full configured addressable space (8 Kb) 10: Do not use top address bit (4 Kb) 01: Do not use top two address bits (2 Kb) 00: Do not use top three address bits (1 Kb) If the GEM is not configured to use the DMA packet buffer, these bits are not implemented and will be treated as reserved, read as zero, ignored on write. Pele uses packet buffer.

parameter.name: ahb_endian_swp_pkt_en
parameter.desc: AHB endian swap mode enable for packet data accesses - When set, selects swapped endianism for AHB transfers. When clear, selects little endian mode.

parameter.name: ahb_endian_swp_mgmt_en
parameter.desc: AHB endian swap mode enable for management descriptor accesses - When set, selects swapped endianism for AHB transfers. When clear, selects little endian mode.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write

parameter.name: ahb_fixed_burst_len
parameter.desc: AHB fixed burst length for DMA data operations - Selects the burst length to attempt to use on the AHB when transferring frame data. Not used for DMA management operations and only used where space and data size allow. Otherwise SINGLE type AHB transfers are used. Upper bits become non-writeable if the configured DMA TX and RX FIFO sizes are smaller than required to support the selected burst size. One-hot priority encoding enforced automatically on register writes as follows, where 'x' represents don't care:- 1xxxx: Attempt to use INCR16 AHB bursts 01xxx: Attempt to use INCR8 AHB bursts 001xx: Attempt to use INCR4 AHB bursts 0001x: Always use SINGLE AHB bursts 00001: Always use SINGLE AHB bursts default: Attempt to use INCR4 AHB bursts

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: hresp_not_ok
parameter.desc: Hresp not OK - set when the DMA block sees hresp not OK. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

parameter.name: late_collision
parameter.desc: Late collision occurred - only set if the condition occurs in gigabit mode, as retry is not attempted. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

parameter.name: tx_under_run
parameter.desc: Transmit under run - this bit is set if the transmitter was forced to terminate a frame that it had already began transmitting due to further data being unavailable. This bit is set if a transmitter status write back has not completed when another status write back is attempted. When using the DMA interface configured for internal FIFO mode, this bit is also set when the transmit DMA has written the SOP data into the FIFO and either the AHB bus was not granted in time for further data, or because an AHB not OK response was returned, or because a used bit was read. When using the DMA interface configured for packet buffer mode, this bit will never be set. When using the external FIFO interface, this bit is also set when the tx_r_underflow input is asserted during a frame transfer. Cleared by writing a 1.

parameter.name: tx_complete
parameter.desc: Transmit complete - set when a frame has been transmitted. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

parameter.name: tx_corr_ahb_err
parameter.desc: Transmit frame corruption due to AHB error - set if an error occurs whilst midway through reading transmit frame from the AHB, including HRESP errors and buffers exhausted mid frame (if the buffers run out during transmission of a frame then transmission stops, FCS shall be bad and tx_er asserted). Also set in DMA packet buffer mode if single frame is too large for configured packet buffer memory size. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

parameter.name: tx_go
parameter.desc: Transmit go - if high transmit is active. When using the exposed FIFO interface, this bit represents bit 3 of the network control register. When using the DMA interface this bit represents the tx_go variable as specified in the transmit buffer description.

parameter.name: retry_limit_exceeded
parameter.desc: Retry limit exceeded - cleared by writing a one to this bit.

parameter.name: collision
parameter.desc: Collision occurred - set by the assertion of collision. Cleared by writing a one to this bit. When operating in 10/100 mode, this status indicates either a collision or a late collision. In gigabit mode, this status is not set for a late collision.

parameter.name: used_bit_read
parameter.desc: Used bit read - set when a transmit buffer descriptor is read with its used bit set. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

parameter.name: rx_q_baseaddr
parameter.desc: Receive buffer queue base address - written with the address of the start of the receive queue.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: tx_q_base_addr
parameter.desc: Transmit buffer queue base address - written with the address of the start of the transmit queue.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: hresp_not_ok
parameter.desc: Hresp not OK - set when the DMA block sees hresp not OK. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

parameter.name: rx_overrun
parameter.desc: Receive overrun - this bit is set if either the gem_dma RX FIFO or external RX FIFO were unable to store the receive frame due to a FIFO overflow, or if the receive status, reported by the gem_rx module to the gem_dma was not taken at end of frame. This bit is also set in DMA packet buffer mode if the packet buffer overflows. For DMA operation the buffer will be recovered if an overrun occurs. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it.

parameter.name: frame_recd
parameter.desc: Frame received - one or more frames have been received and placed in memory. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

parameter.name: buffer_not_avail
parameter.desc: Buffer not available - an attempt was made to get a new buffer and the pointer indicated that it was owned by the processor. The DMA will reread the pointer each time an end of frame is received until a valid pointer is found. This bit is set following each descriptor read attempt that fails, even if consecutive pointers are unsuccessful and software has in the mean time cleared the status flag. Cleared by writing a one to this bit.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: tsu_sec_incr
parameter.desc: TSU seconds register increment - indicates the register has incremented.

parameter.name: pdelay_resp_tx
parameter.desc: PTP pdelay_resp frame transmitted - indicates a PTP pdelay_resp frame has been transmitted.

parameter.name: pdelay_req_tx
parameter.desc: PTP pdelay_req frame transmitted - indicates a PTP pdelay_req frame has been transmitted.

parameter.name: pdelay_resp_rx
parameter.desc: PTP pdelay_resp frame received - indicates a PTP pdelay_resp frame has been received.

parameter.name: pdelay_req_rx
parameter.desc: PTP pdelay_req frame received - indicates a PTP pdelay_req frame has been received.

parameter.name: sync_tx
parameter.desc: PTP sync frame transmitted - indicates a PTP sync frame has been transmitted.

parameter.name: delay_req_tx
parameter.desc: PTP delay_req frame transmitted - indicates a PTP delay_req frame has been transmitted.

parameter.name: sync_rx
parameter.desc: PTP sync frame received - indicates a PTP sync frame has been received.

parameter.name: delay_req_rx
parameter.desc: PTP delay_req frame received - indicates a PTP delay_req frame has been received.

parameter.name: partner_pg_rx
parameter.desc: PCS link partner page received - set when a new base page or next page is received from the link partner. The first time this interrupt is received, it will indicate base page received and subsequent reads will indicate next pages. The next page and base page registers should only be read when this interrupt is signalled. For next pages, the link partner next page register should be read first to avoid the register being over written. This interrupt also indicates when the host should write a new page into the next page register. If further next page exchange is only required by the link partner, this register should be written with a null message page (0x2001).

parameter.name: autoneg_complete
parameter.desc: PCS auto-negotiation complete - set once the internal PCS layer has completed auto-negotiation.

parameter.name: ext_intr
parameter.desc: External interrupt - set when a rising edge has been detected on the ext_interrupt_in input pin.

parameter.name: pause_tx
parameter.desc: Pause frame transmitted - indicates a pause frame has been successfully transmitted after being initiated from the network control register or from the tx_pause control pin.

parameter.name: pause_zero
parameter.desc: Pause time zero - set when either the pause time register at address 0x38 decrements to zero, or when a valid pause frame is received with a zero pause quantum field.

parameter.name: pause_nonzeroq_rx
parameter.desc: Pause frame with non-zero pause quantum received - indicates a valid pause has been received that has a non-zero pause quantum field.

parameter.name: hresp_not_ok
parameter.desc: Hresp not OK - set when the DMA block sees hresp not OK.

parameter.name: rx_overrun
parameter.desc: Receive overrun - set when the receive overrun status bit gets set.

parameter.name: link_chng
parameter.desc: Link change - set when the state of the link detected by the internal PCS changes state.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: tx_complete
parameter.desc: Transmit complete - set when a frame has been transmitted.

parameter.name: tx_corrupt_ahb_err
parameter.desc: Transmit frame corruption due to AHB error - set if an error occurs whilst midway through reading transmit frame from the AHB, including HRESP errors and buffers exhausted mid frame (if the buffers run out during transmission of a frame then transmission stops, FCS shall be bad and tx_er asserted). Also set in DMA packet buffer mode if single frame is too large for configured packet buffer memory size. Cleared on a read.

parameter.name: retry_ex_late_collisn
parameter.desc: Retry limit exceeded or late collision - transmit error. Late collision will only cause this status bit to be set in gigabit mode (as a retry is not attempted).

parameter.name: reserved_tx_underrun
parameter.desc: Reserved. Do not modify.

parameter.name: tx_used_read
parameter.desc: TX used bit read - set when a transmit buffer descriptor is read with its used bit set.

parameter.name: rx_used_read
parameter.desc: RX used bit read - set when a receive buffer descriptor is read with its used bit set.

parameter.name: rx_complete
parameter.desc: Receive complete - a frame has been stored in memory.

parameter.name: mgmt_sent
parameter.desc: Management frame sent - the PHY maintenance register has completed its operation.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: tsu_sec_incr
parameter.desc: Enable TSU seconds register increment interrupt

parameter.name: pdelay_resp_tx
parameter.desc: Enable PTP pdelay_resp frame transmitted interrupt

parameter.name: pdelay_req_tx
parameter.desc: Enable PTP pdelay_req frame transmitted interrupt

parameter.name: pdelay_resp_rx
parameter.desc: Enable PTP pdelay_resp frame received interrupt

parameter.name: pdelay_req_rx
parameter.desc: Enable PTP pdelay_req frame received interrupt

parameter.name: sync_tx
parameter.desc: Enable PTP sync frame transmitted interrupt

parameter.name: delay_req_tx
parameter.desc: Enable PTP delay_req frame transmitted interrupt

parameter.name: sync_rx
parameter.desc: Enable PTP sync frame received interrupt

parameter.name: delay_req_rx
parameter.desc: Enable PTP delay_req frame received interrupt

parameter.name: partner_pg_rx
parameter.desc: Enable PCS link partner page received interrupt

parameter.name: autoneg_complete
parameter.desc: Enable PCS auto-negotiation complete interrupt

parameter.name: ext_intr
parameter.desc: Enable external interrupt

parameter.name: pause_tx
parameter.desc: Enable pause frame transmitted interrupt

parameter.name: pause_zero
parameter.desc: Enable pause time zero interrupt

parameter.name: pause_nonzeroq
parameter.desc: Enable pause frame with non-zero pause quantum interrupt

parameter.name: hresp_not_ok
parameter.desc: Enable hresp not OK interrupt

parameter.name: rx_overrun
parameter.desc: Enable receive overrun interrupt

parameter.name: link_chng
parameter.desc: Enable link change interrupt

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Not used

parameter.name: tx_complete
parameter.desc: Enable transmit complete interrupt

parameter.name: tx_corrupt_ahb_err
parameter.desc: Enable transmit frame corruption due to AHB error interrupt

parameter.name: retry_ex_late_collisn
parameter.desc: Enable retry limit exceeded or late collision interrupt

parameter.name: tx_underrun
parameter.desc: Enable transmit buffer under run interrupt

parameter.name: tx_used_read
parameter.desc: Enable transmit used bit read interrupt

parameter.name: rx_used_read
parameter.desc: Enable receive used bit read interrupt

parameter.name: rx_complete
parameter.desc: Enable receive complete interrupt

parameter.name: mgmt_done
parameter.desc: Enable management done interrupt

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: tsu_sec_incr
parameter.desc: Disable TSU seconds register increment interrupt

parameter.name: pdelay_resp_tx
parameter.desc: Disable PTP pdelay_resp frame transmitted interrupt

parameter.name: pdelay_req_tx
parameter.desc: Disable PTP pdelay_req frame transmitted interrupt

parameter.name: pdelay_resp_rx
parameter.desc: Disable PTP pdelay_resp frame received interrupt

parameter.name: pdelay_req_rx
parameter.desc: Disable PTP pdelay_req frame received interrupt

parameter.name: sync_tx
parameter.desc: Disable PTP sync frame transmitted interrupt

parameter.name: delay_req_tx
parameter.desc: Disable PTP delay_req frame transmitted interrupt

parameter.name: sync_rx
parameter.desc: Disable PTP sync frame received interrupt

parameter.name: delay_req_rx
parameter.desc: Disable PTP delay_req frame received interrupt

parameter.name: partner_pg_rx
parameter.desc: Disable PCS link partner page received interrupt

parameter.name: autoneg_complete
parameter.desc: Disable PCS auto-negotiation complete interrupt

parameter.name: ext_intr
parameter.desc: Disable external interrupt

parameter.name: pause_tx
parameter.desc: Disable pause frame transmitted interrupt

parameter.name: pause_zero
parameter.desc: Disable pause time zero interrupt

parameter.name: pause_nonzeroq
parameter.desc: Disable pause frame with non-zero pause quantum interrupt

parameter.name: hresp_not_ok
parameter.desc: Disable hresp not OK interrupt

parameter.name: rx_overrun
parameter.desc: Disable receive overrun interrupt

parameter.name: link_chng
parameter.desc: Disable link change interrupt

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Not used

parameter.name: tx_complete
parameter.desc: Disable transmit complete interrupt

parameter.name: tx_corrupt_ahb_err
parameter.desc: Disable transmit frame corruption due to AHB error interrupt

parameter.name: retry_ex_late_collisn
parameter.desc: Disable retry limit exceeded or late collision interrupt

parameter.name: tx_underrun
parameter.desc: Disable transmit buffer under run interrupt

parameter.name: tx_used_read
parameter.desc: Disable transmit used bit read interrupt

parameter.name: rx_used_read
parameter.desc: Disable receive used bit read interrupt

parameter.name: rx_complete
parameter.desc: Disable receive complete interrupt

parameter.name: mgmt_done
parameter.desc: Disable management done interrupt

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: pdelay_resp_tx
parameter.desc: PTP pdelay_resp frame transmitted mask.

parameter.name: pdelay_req_tx
parameter.desc: PTP pdelay_req frame transmitted mask.

parameter.name: pdelay_resp_rx
parameter.desc: PTP pdelay_resp frame received mask.

parameter.name: pdelay_req_rx
parameter.desc: PTP pdelay_req frame received mask.

parameter.name: sync_tx
parameter.desc: PTP sync frame transmitted mask.

parameter.name: delay_req_tx
parameter.desc: PTP delay_req frame transmitted mask.

parameter.name: sync_rx
parameter.desc: PTP sync frame received mask.

parameter.name: delay_req_rx
parameter.desc: PTP delay_req frame received mask.

parameter.name: partner_pg_rx
parameter.desc: PCS link partner page mask.

parameter.name: autoneg_complete
parameter.desc: PCS auto-negotiation complete interrupt mask.

parameter.name: ext_intr
parameter.desc: External interrupt mask.

parameter.name: pause_tx
parameter.desc: Pause frame transmitted interrupt mask.

parameter.name: pause_zero
parameter.desc: Pause time zero interrupt mask.

parameter.name: pause_nonzeroq
parameter.desc: Pause frame with non-zero pause quantum interrupt mask.

parameter.name: hresp_not_ok
parameter.desc: Hresp not OK interrupt mask.

parameter.name: rx_overrun
parameter.desc: Receive overrun interrupt mask.

parameter.name: link_chng
parameter.desc: Link change interrupt mask.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Not used

parameter.name: tx_complete
parameter.desc: Transmit complete interrupt mask.

parameter.name: tx_corrupt_ahb_err
parameter.desc: Transmit frame corruption due to AHB error interrupt

parameter.name: retry_ex_late_collisn
parameter.desc: Retry limit exceeded or late collision (gigabit mode only)

parameter.name: tx_underrun
parameter.desc: Transmit buffer under run interrupt mask.

parameter.name: tx_used_read
parameter.desc: Transmit used bit read interrupt mask.

parameter.name: rx_used_read
parameter.desc: Receive used bit read interrupt mask.

parameter.name: rx_complete
parameter.desc: Receive complete interrupt mask.

parameter.name: mgmt_done
parameter.desc: Management done interrupt mask.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Must be written with 0.

parameter.name: clause_22
parameter.desc: Must be written to 1 for Clause 22 operation. Check you PHY's spec to see if it is clause 22 or clause 45 compliant.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.desc: Operation. 10 is read. 01 is write.

parameter.name: phy_addr
parameter.desc: PHY address.

parameter.name: reg_addr
parameter.desc: Register address - specifies the register in the PHY to access.

parameter.name: must_10
parameter.desc: Must be written to 10.

parameter.name: data
parameter.desc: For a write operation this is written with the data to be written to the PHY. After a read operation this contains the data read from the PHY.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: rx_pauseq
parameter.desc: Received pause quantum - stores the current value of the received pause quantum register which is decremented every 512 bit times.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: tx_pauseq
parameter.desc: Transmit pause quantum - written with the pause quantum value for pause frame transmission

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The first 32 bits of the hash address register.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The remaining 32 bits of the hash address register.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Least significant 32 bits of the destination address, that is bits 31:0. Bit zero indicates whether the address is multicast or unicast and corresponds to the least significant bit of the first byte received.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: addr_msbs
parameter.desc: Specific address 1. The most significant bits of the destination address, that is bits 47:32.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Least significant 32 bits of the destination address, that is bits 31:0. Bit zero indicates whether the address is multicast or unicast and corresponds to the least significant bit of the first byte received.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: addr_msbs
parameter.desc: Specific address 2. The most significant bits of the destination address, that is bits 47:32.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Least significant 32 bits of the destination address, that is bits 31:0. Bit zero indicates whether the address is multicast or unicast and corresponds to the least significant bit of the first byte received.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: addr_msbs
parameter.desc: Specific address 3. The most significant bits of the destination address, that is bits 47:32.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Least significant 32 bits of the destination address, that is bits 31:0. Bit zero indicates whether the address is multicast or unicast and corresponds to the least significant bit of the first byte received.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: addr_msbs
parameter.desc: Specific address 4. The most significant bits of the destination address, that is bits 47:32.

parameter.name: copy_en
parameter.desc: Enable copying of type ID match 1 matched frames

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: type_id_match1
parameter.desc: Type ID match 1. For use in comparisons with received frames type ID/length field.

parameter.name: copy_en
parameter.desc: Enable copying of type ID match 2 matched frames

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: type_id_match2
parameter.desc: Type ID match 2. For use in comparisons with received frames type ID/length field.

parameter.name: copy_en
parameter.desc: Enable copying of type ID match 3 matched frames

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: type_id_match3
parameter.desc: Type ID match 3. For use in comparisons with received frames type ID/length field.

parameter.name: copy_en
parameter.desc: Enable copying of type ID match 4 matched frames

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write

parameter.name: type_id_match4
parameter.desc: Type ID match 4. For use in comparisons with received frames type ID/length field.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved - read 0, ignored when written

parameter.name: multi_hash_en
parameter.desc: Wake on LAN multicast hash event enable. When set multicast hash events will cause the wol output to be asserted.

parameter.name: spec_addr_reg1_en
parameter.desc: Wake on LAN specific address register 1 event enable. When set specific address 1 events will cause the wol output to be asserted.

parameter.name: arp_req_en
parameter.desc: Wake on LAN ARP request event enable. When set ARP request events will cause the wol output to be asserted.

parameter.name: magic_pkt_en
parameter.desc: Wake on LAN magic packet event enable. When set magic packet events will cause the wol output to be asserted.

parameter.name: arp_req_ip_addr
parameter.desc: Wake on LAN ARP request IP address. Written to define the least significant 16 bits of the target IP address that is matched to generate a Wake on LAN event. A value of zero will not generate an event, even if this is matched by the received frame.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ipg_stretch
parameter.desc: Bits 7:0 are multiplied with the previously transmitted frame length (including preamble) bits 15:8 +1 divide the frame length. If the resulting number is greater than 96 and bit 28 is set in the network configuration register then the resulting number is used for the transmit inter-packet-gap. 1 is added to bits 15:8 to prevent a divide by zero.

parameter.name: stacked_vlan_en
parameter.desc: Enable Stacked VLAN processing mode

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: user_def_vlan_type
parameter.desc: User defined VLAN_TYPE field. When Stacked VLAN is enabled, the first VLAN tag in a received frame will only be accepted if the VLAN type field is equal to this user defined VLAN_TYPE OR equal to the standard VLAN type (0x8100). Note that the second VLAN tag of a Stacked VLAN packet will only be matched correctly if its VLAN_TYPE field equals 0x8100.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: pauseq_sel
parameter.desc: If bit 17 of the network control register is written with a one then for each entry equal to zero in the Transmit PFC Pause Register[15:8], the PFC pause frame's pause quantum field associated with that entry will be taken from the transmit pause quantum register. For each entry equal to one in the Transmit PFC Pause Register [15:8], the pause quantum associated with that entry will be zero.

parameter.name: pri_en_vec_val
parameter.desc: If bit 17 of the network control register is written with a one then the priority enable vector of the PFC priority based pause frame will be set equal to the value stored in this register [7:0].

parameter.name: mask_bits_bot
parameter.desc: Setting a bit to one masks the corresponding bit in the specific address 1 register

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: mask_bits_top
parameter.desc: Setting a bit to one masks the corresponding bit in the specific address 1 register

parameter.name: module_id
parameter.desc: Module identification number - for the GEM, this value is fixed at 0x0002.

parameter.name: module_rev
parameter.desc: Module revision - fixed byte value specific to the revision of the design which is incremented after each release of the IP. Corresponds to Pele having GEM p23.

parameter.name: octets_tx_bot
parameter.desc: Transmitted octets in frame without errors [31:0]. The number of octets transmitted in valid frames of any type. This counter is 48-bits, and is read through two registers. This count does not include octets from automatically generated pause frames.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: octets_tx_top
parameter.desc: Transmitted octets in frame without errors [47:32]. The number of octets transmitted in valid frames of any type. This counter is 48-bits, and is read through two registers. This count does not include octets from automatically generated pause frames.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of frames successfully transmitted, i.e. no under run and not too many retries. Excludes pause frames.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Broadcast frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of broadcast frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e. no under run and not too many retries. Excludes pause frames.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Multicast frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of multicast frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e. no under run and not too many retries. Excludes pause frames.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: pause_frames_tx
parameter.desc: Transmitted pause frames - a 16 bit register counting the number of pause frames transmitted. Only pause frames triggered by the register interface or through the external pause pins are counted as pause frames. Pause frames received through the external FIFO interface are counted in the frames transmitted counter.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 64 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 64 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e. no under run and not too many retries. Excludes pause frames.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 65 to127 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 65 to127 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e. no under run and not too many retries.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 128 to 255 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 128 to 255 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e. no under run and not too many retries.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 256 to 511 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 256 to 511 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e. no under run and not too many retries.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 512 to 1023 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 512 to 1023 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e. no under run and not too many retries.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 1024 to 1518 byte frames transmitted without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 1024 to 1518 byte frames successfully transmitted without error, i.e. no under run and not too many retries.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: tx_under_runs
parameter.desc: Transmit under runs - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames not transmitted due to a transmit under run. If this register is incremented then no other statistics register is incremented.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: single_collisn
parameter.desc: Single collision frames - an 18 bit register counting the number of frames experiencing a single collision before being successfully transmitted, i.e. no under run.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: multi_collisn
parameter.desc: Multiple collision frames - an 18 bit register counting the number of frames experiencing between two and fifteen collisions prior to being successfully transmitted, i.e. no under run and not too many retries.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: excessive_collisns
parameter.desc: Excessive collisions - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames that failed to be transmitted because they experienced 16 collisions.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: late_collisns
parameter.desc: Late collisions - a 10 bit register counting the number of late collision occurring after the slot time (512 bits) has expired. In 10/100 mode, late collisions are counted twice i.e. both as a collision and a late collision. In gigabit mode, a late collision causes the transmission to be aborted, thus the single and multi collision registers are not updated.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: deferred_tx
parameter.desc: Deferred transmission frames - an 18 bit register counting the number of frames experiencing deferral due to carrier sense being active on their first attempt at transmission. Frames involved in any collision are not counted nor are frames that experienced a transmit under run.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: carrier_sense_errs
parameter.desc: Carrier sense errors - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames transmitted where carrier sense was not seen during transmission or where carrier sense was deasserted after being asserted in a transmit frame without collision (no under run). Only incremented in half duplex mode. The only effect of a carrier sense error is to increment this register. The behaviour of the other statistics registers is unaffected by the detection of a carrier sense error.

parameter.name: octets_rx_bot
parameter.desc: Received octets in frame without errors [31:0]. The number of octets received in valid frames of any type. This counter is 48-bits and is read through two registers. This count does not include octets from pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: octets_rx_top
parameter.desc: Received octets in frame without errors [47:32]. The number of octets received in valid frames of any type. This counter is 48-bits and is read through two registers. This count does not include octets from pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of frames successfully received. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Broadcast frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of broadcast frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Multicast frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of multicast frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: pause_rx
parameter.desc: Received pause frames - a 16 bit register counting the number of pause frames received without error.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 64 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 64 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 65 to 127 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 65 to 127 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 128 to 255 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 128 to 255 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 256 to 511 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 256 to 511 byte frames successfully transmitted without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 512 to 1023 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 512 to 1023 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: 1024 to 1518 byte frames received without error. A 32 bit register counting the number of 1024 to 1518 byte frames successfully received without error. Excludes pause frames, and is only incremented if the frame is successfully filtered and copied to memory.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: undersz_rx
parameter.desc: Undersize frames received - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames received less than 64 bytes in length (10/100 mode or gigabit mode, full duplex) that do not have either a CRC error or an alignment error. In gigabit mode, half duplex, this register counts either frames not conforming to the minimum slot time of 512 bytes or frames not conforming to the minimum frame size once bursting is active.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: fcs_errors
parameter.desc: Frame check sequence errors - a 10 bit register counting frames that are an integral number of bytes, have bad CRC and are between 64 and 1518 bytes in length. This register is also incremented if a symbol error is detected and the frame is of valid length and has an integral number of bytes. This register is incremented for a frame with bad FCS, regardless of whether it is copied to memory due to ignore FCS mode being enabled in bit 26 of the network configuration register.H524

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: length_field_errors
parameter.desc: Length field frame errors - this 10-bit register counts the number of frames received that have a measured length shorter than that extracted from the length field (bytes 13 and 14). This condition is only counted if the value of the length field is less than 0x0600, the frame is not of excessive length and checking is enabled through bit 16 of the network configuration register.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: rx_symbol_errors
parameter.desc: Receive symbol errors - a 10-bit register counting the number of frames that had rx_er asserted during reception. For 10/100 mode symbol errors are counted regardless of frame length checks. For gigabit mode the frame must satisfy slot time requirements in order to count a symbol error. Additionally, in gigabit half duplex mode, carrier extension errors are also recorded. Receive symbol errors will also be counted as an FCS or alignment error if the frame is between 64 and 1518 bytes. If the frame is larger it will be recorded as a jabber error.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: align_errors
parameter.desc: Alignment errors - a 10 bit register counting frames that are not an integral number of bytes long and have bad CRC when their length is truncated to an integral number of bytes and are between 64 and 1518 bytes in length. This register is also incremented if a symbol error is detected and the frame is of valid length and does not have an integral number of bytes.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: rx_resource_errors
parameter.desc: Receive resource errors - an 18 bit register counting the number of frames that were successfully received by the MAC (correct address matched frame and adequate slot time) but could not be copied to memory because no receive buffer was available. This will be either because the AHB bus was not granted in time or because a hresp not OK was returned.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: rx_overrun_errors
parameter.desc: Receive overruns - a 10 bit register counting the number of frames that are address recognized but were not copied to memory due to a receive overrun.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ip_hdr_csum_errors
parameter.desc: 0 IP header checksum errors - an 8-bit register counting the number of frames discarded due to an incorrect IP header checksum, but are between 64 and 1518 bytes and do not have a CRC error, an alignment error, nor a symbol error.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: tcp_csum_errors
parameter.desc: TCP checksum errors - an 8-bit register counting the number of frames discarded due to an incorrect TCP checksum, but are between 64 and 1518 bytes and do not have a CRC error, an alignment error, nor a symbol error.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: udp_csum_errors
parameter.desc: UDP checksum errors - an 8-bit register counting the number of frames discarded due to an incorrect UDP checksum, but are between 64 and 1518 bytes and do not have a CRC error, an alignment error, nor a symbol error.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The value of the Timer Seconds register captured when gem_tsu_ms and gem_tsu_inc_ctrl are zero

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ns_reg_val
parameter.desc: The value of the Timer Nanoseconds register captured when gem_tsu_ms and gem_tsu_inc_ctrl are zero.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Timer count in seconds. This register is writeable. It increments by one when the 1588 nanoseconds counter counts to one second. It may also be incremented when the timer adjust register is written.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: timer_ct_ns
parameter.desc: Timer count in nanoseconds. This register is writeable. It can also be adjusted by writes to the 1588 timer adjust register. It increments by the value of the 1588 timer increment register each clock cycle.

parameter.name: add_subn
parameter.desc: Write as one to subtract from the 1588 timer. Write as zero to add to it.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ns_delta
parameter.desc: The number of nanoseconds to increment or decrement the 1588 timer nanoseconds register. If necessary the 1588 seconds register will be incremented or decremented.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: incr_b4_alt
parameter.desc: The number of increments after which the alternative increment is used

parameter.name: alt_ct_ns_delta
parameter.desc: Alternative count of nanoseconds by which the 1588 timer nanoseconds register will be incremented each clock cycle.

parameter.name: ns_delta
parameter.desc: A count of nanoseconds by which the 1588 timer nanoseconds register will be incremented each clock cycle.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer seconds register held when the SFD of a PTP transmit primary event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP sync or delay_req frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ns_reg_val
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer nanoseconds register held when the SFD of a PTP transmit primary event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP sync or delay_req frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer seconds register held when the SFD of a PTP receive primary event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP sync or delay_req frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ns_reg_val
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer nanoseconds register held when the SFD of a PTP receive primary event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP sync or delay_req frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer seconds register held when the SFD of a PTP transmit peer event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP pdealy_req or pdelay_resp frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ns_reg_val
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer nanoseconds register held when the SFD of a PTP transmit peer event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP pdelay_req or pdelay_resp frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer seconds register held when the SFD of a PTP receive peer event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP pdelay_req or pdelay_resp frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as 0, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ns_reg_val
parameter.desc: The register is updated with the value that the 1588 timer nanoseconds register held when the SFD of a PTP receive peer event crosses the MII interface. The actual update occurs when the GEM recognizes the frame as a PTP pdelay_req or pdelay_resp frame. An interrupt is issued when the register is updated.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Set to 0

parameter.name: gem_dma_bus_width
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_dma_bus_width DEFINE 3'b001 : 32-bit 3'b010 : 64-bit 3'b100 : 128-bit

parameter.name: extra_spec_add
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `extra_spec_add DEFINE. Undefined in Pele

parameter.name: gem_irq_read_clear
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_irq_read_clear DEFINE. Undefined in Pele. Keeping undefined means interrupt status registers are write-one-to-clear rather than clearing when read.

parameter.name: gem_no_snapshot
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_no_snapshot DEFINE. Defined for Pele. Remove statistics snapshot (not supported by driver)

parameter.name: gem_no_stats
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_no_stats DEFINE. Undefined for Pele. Include statistics registers.

parameter.name: gem_no_scan_pins
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_no_scan_pins DEFINE. Defined for Pele. Remove placeholder scan pins from module.

parameter.name: gem_user_in_width
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_user_in_width DEFINE. Undefined for Pele. No requirement for user I/O.

parameter.name: gem_user_out_width
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_user_out_width DEFINE. Undefined for Pele. No requirement for user I/O.

parameter.name: gem_user_io
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_user_io DEFINE. Undefined for Pele. No requirement for user I/O.

parameter.name: gem_apb_rev2
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_apb_rev2 DEFINE. Defined for Pele. Use AMBA 2.0 APB.

parameter.name: gem_apb_rev1
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_apb_rev1 DEFINE. Undefined for Pele. Use AMBA 2.0 APB.

parameter.name: gem_ext_fifo_interface
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_ext_fifo_interface. Undefined for Pele. Use AHB DMA; External FIFO interface not implemented.

parameter.name: gem_no_int_loopback
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_no_int_loopback DEFINE. Undefined for Pele. Include loopback test mode

parameter.name: gem_int_loopback
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_int_loopback DEFINE. Defined for Pele. Include loopback test mode.

parameter.name: TDC_50
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `TDC_50 DEFINE. Undefined for Pele. Only used with PCS.

parameter.name: RDC_50
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `RDC_50 DEFINE. Undefined for Pele. Only used with PCS.

parameter.name: gem_serdes
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_serdes DEFINE. Undefined for Pele. Only used with PCS.

parameter.name: gem_no_pcs
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_no_pcs DEFINE. Defined for Pele. Use GEM without 1000-BASE-X PCS sublayer and Ten Bit Interface

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Set to zero.

parameter.name: gem_tx_pbuf_addr
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_pbuf_addr DEFINE. Max address bits for Tx packet buffer (10-bits for maximum 4 kB buffer) Buffer size for Tx packet buffer mode will be 4kB. This will allow one standard packet to be received while another is transferred to system memory by the DMA interface.

parameter.name: gem_rx_pbuf_addr
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_pbuf_addr DEFINE. Max address bits for Rx packet buffer (10-bits for maximum 4 kB buffer) Buffer size for Rx packet buffer mode will be 4kB. This will allow one standard packet to be received while another is transferred to system memory by the DMA interface.

parameter.name: gem_tx_pkt_buffer
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_pkt_buffer DEFINE. Defined for Pele. Includes the transmitter packet buffer

parameter.name: gem_rx_pkt_buffer
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_pkt_buffer DEFINE. Defined for Pele. Includes the receiver packet buffer

parameter.name: gem_hprot_value
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_hprot_value DEFINE. For Pele set the fixed AHB HPROT value used during transfers

parameter.name: gem_jumbo_max_length
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_jumbo_max_length DEFINE. Maximum length of jumbo frames accepted by receiver. This is set to the size of the smallest of the two packet buffer, minus a margin for packet headers. However, Pele will not support jumbo frames.

parameter.name: gem_rx_base2_fifo_size
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_base2_fifo_size DEFINE. Base-2 equivalent of `gem_rx_fifo_size

parameter.name: gem_rx_fifo_size
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_fifo_size DEFINE. Set the size of the small Rx FIFO for grant latency. Extended to 16 deep to allow buffering of 64 byte maximum AHB burst size in Pele.

parameter.name: gem_tx_base2_fifo_size
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_base2_fifo_size DEFINE. Base-2 equivalent of `gem_tx_fifo_size

parameter.name: gem_tx_fifo_size
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_fifo_size DEFINE. Set the size of the small TX FIFO for grant latency

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Set to zero.

parameter.name: gem_tsu_clk
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tsu_clk DEFINE. Undefined in Pele. 1588 Time Stamp Unit clock sourced from pclk rather than independent tsu_clk.

parameter.name: gem_rx_buffer_length_def
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_buffer_length_def DEFINE. Set the default buffer length used by Rx DMA to 128 bytes in Pele

parameter.name: gem_tx_pbuf_size_def
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_tx_pbuf_size_def DEFINE. Full 4 kB Tx packet buffer size - dedicated memory resource in Pele.

parameter.name: gem_rx_pbuf_size_def
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_rx_pbuf_size_def DEFINE. Full 4 kB Rx packet buffer size - dedicated memory resource in Pele.

parameter.name: gem_endian_swap_def
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_endian_swap_def DEFINE. Set to big endian data, little endian management descriptors in Pele.

parameter.name: gem_mdc_clock_div
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_mdc_clock_div DEFINE. Set default MDC clock divisor (can still be programmed) in Pele.

parameter.name: gem_dma_bus_width
parameter.desc: Takes the value of the `gem_dma_bus_width_def DEFINE. Limit to 32-bit AHB bus in Pele
