parameter.name: leg_flsh
parameter.desc: Flash memory interface mode control: 0 = legacy SPI mode 1 = Flash memory interface mode This control is required to enable or disable automatic recognition of instruction bytes in the first byte of a transfer. If this mode is disabled, the core will operate in standard SPI mode, with no dual- or quad-bit input or output capability; the extended bits will be configured as inputs to prevent any driver contention on these pins. If enabled, flash memory interface instructions are automatically recognized and the I/O configured accordingly.

parameter.name: reserved_4
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: endian
parameter.desc: 0 for little endian format when writing to the transmit data register 0x1C or reading from the receive data register 0x20. 1 for big endian format when writing to the transmit data register 0x1C or reading from the receive data register 0x20.

parameter.name: reserved_4
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: Holdb_dr
parameter.desc: Holdb and WPn pins are driven in normal/fast read or dual output/io read by the controller, if set, else external pull-high is required. Both pins are always driven by the controller in quad mode.

parameter.name: reserved_3
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: Reserved, do not modify

parameter.name: Man_start_com
parameter.desc: Manual Start Command 1 = start transmission of data 0 = don't care

parameter.name: Man_start_en
parameter.desc: Manual Start Enable 1 = enables maual start 0 = auto mode

parameter.name: Manual_CS
parameter.desc: Manual CS 1 = manual CS mode 0 = auto mode

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: PCS
parameter.desc: Peripheral chip select line, directly drive n_ss_out if Manual_C is set

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: REF_CLK
parameter.desc: Master reference clock select 1 = use ext_clk 0 = use SPI REFERENCE CLOCK

parameter.name: FIFO_WIDTH
parameter.desc: FIFO width 00 = 8bits 01 = 16bits 10 = 24bits 11 = 32bits

parameter.name: BAUD_RATE_DIV
parameter.desc: Master mode baud rate divisor 000 = divide by 2 001 = divide by 4 010 = divide by 8 011 = divide by 16 100 = divide by 32 101 = divide by 64 110 = divide by 128 111 = divide by 256

parameter.name: CLK_PH
parameter.desc: Clock phase 1 = the SPI clock is inactive outside the word 0 = the SPI clock is active outside the word

parameter.name: CLK_POL
parameter.desc: Clock polarity outside SPI word 1 = the SPI clock is quiescent high 0 = the SPI clock is quiescent low

parameter.name: MODE_SEL
parameter.desc: Mode select 1 = the SPI is in master mode 0 = the SPI is in slave mode

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow 1 = underflow is detected 0 = no underflow has been detected

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full 1 = FIFO is full 0 = FIFO is not full

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty 1 = FIFO has more than or equal to THRESHOLD entries 0 = FIFO has less than RX THRESHOLD entries

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full 1 = FIFO is full 0 = FIFO is not full

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full 1 = FIFO has less than THRESHOLD entries 0 = FIFO has more than or equal toTHRESHOLD entries

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt 1 = overflow occured 0 = no overflow occurred

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow enable 1 = disables the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full enable 1 = disables the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty enable 1 = disables the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full enable 1 = disables the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full enable 1 = disables the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt enable 1 = disables the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow enable 1 = interrupt is disabled 0 = interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full enable 1 = interrupt is disabled 0 = interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty enable 1 = interrupt is disabled 0 = interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full enable 1 = interrupt is disabled 0 = interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full enable 1 = interrupt is disabled 0 = interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt enable 1 = interrupt is disabled 0 = interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: SPI_EN
parameter.desc: SPI_Enable 1 = enable the SPI 0 = disable the SPI

parameter.name: d_nss
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles for the length that the master mode chip select outputs are de-asserted between words when cpha=0.

parameter.name: d_btwn
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between one chip select being de-activated and the activation of another

parameter.name: d_after
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between last bit of current word and the first bit of the next word.

parameter.name: d_int
parameter.desc: Added delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between setting n_ss_out low and first bit transfer.

parameter.name: TXD
parameter.desc: Data to TX FIFO, for 4-byte instruction for normal read/write data transfer.

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_data
parameter.desc: Data from TX FIFO

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: Slave_Idle_coun
parameter.desc: SPI in slave mode detects a start only when the external SPI master serial clock (sclk_in) is stable (quiescent state) for SPI REFERENCE CLOCK cycles specified by slave idle count register or when the SPI is deselected.

parameter.name: DEPTH_of_TX_FIFO
parameter.desc: Defines the level at which the TX FIFO not full interrupt is generated

parameter.name: DEPTH_of_RX_FIFO
parameter.desc: Defines the level at which the RX FIFO not empty interrupt is generated

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved for future GPIO.

parameter.name: WP_N
parameter.desc: Write Protect. Write Protect output for flash devices supporting this function. Active low (may be inverted externally to the core if required for flash devices requiring active high write protect signal.)

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved.

parameter.name: LPBK_SEL
parameter.desc: Loopback clock select: 0 - loopback at pad 1 - loopback through external connections

parameter.name: LPBK_PH
parameter.desc: Loopback clock phase selection. 0 - normal, 1 - inverted

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved, do not modify

parameter.name: USE_LPBK
parameter.desc: Use external loopback master clock for read data capturing when baud rate divisor (reg 0x00) is 2.

parameter.name: DLY1
parameter.desc: Delay adjustment (00, 01, 10, 11) for 0, 0.4, 0.8 or 1.2 ns, this is added to DLY0 to form the overall delay.

parameter.name: DLY0
parameter.desc: Delay adjustment step, 0 to 7, each step is around 0.2 ns.

parameter.name: TXD
parameter.desc: Data to TX FIFO, for 1-byte instruction, not for normal data transfer. In little endian mode (default), only bits 7:0 are valid, bits 31:8 are ignored. In big endian mode, only the 8 MS bits are valid.

parameter.name: TXD
parameter.desc: Data to TX FIFO, for 2-byte instruction, not for normal data transfer. In little endian mode (default), only bits 15:0 are valid, bits 31:16 are ignored. In big endian mode, only the 16 MS bits are valid.

parameter.name: TXD
parameter.desc: Data to TX FIFO, for 3-byte instruction, not for normal data transfer. In little endian mode (default), only bits 23:0 are valid, bits 31:24 are ignored. In big endian mode, only the 24 MS bits are valid.

parameter.name: LQ_MODE
parameter.desc: Linear quad SPI mode, if set, else quad SPI mode

parameter.name: TWO_MEM
parameter.desc: Both upper and lower memories are active, if set

parameter.name: SEP_BUS
parameter.desc: Separate memory bus, if set. Only has meaning if bit 30 is set

parameter.name: U_PAGE
parameter.desc: Upper memory page, if set. Only has meaning if bit 30 is set AND bit 29 is clear AND bit 31 is clear. In LQSPI mode, address bit 25 will indicate lower (0) or upper (1) page. In IO mode, this bit is used to select the lower or upper memory for configuration or read/write operations.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved. Write to this location may lead to unpredictable behavior.

parameter.name: MODE_EN
parameter.desc: Enable MODE_BITS[23:16] to be sent, if set. This bit MUST BE SET for dual I/O or quad I/O read (specified through [7:0]). This bit MUST BE CLEAR for all other read modes as they do not have mode bits. If this bit is 0, bits 24, and [23:16] are ignored. Here is a summary of how bits 25, 24 and 23:16 are related. Bit 25 bit 24 bits 23:16 0 x x 1 0 not 8'bxx10xxxx 1 1 8'bxx10xxxx

parameter.name: MODE_ON
parameter.desc: This bit is only relevant if bit 25 is set, else it is ignored. If this bit is set, instruction code is only sent for the very first read transfer. If this bit is clear, instruction code will be sent for all read transfers. This bit is configured in association with the MODE_BITS. For Winbond devices, this bit MUST BE SET if the MODE_BITS are 8'bxx10xxxx, else this bit MUST BE CLEAR.

parameter.name: MODE_BITS
parameter.desc: These bits are only relevant if bit 25 is set, else it is ignored. If bit 25 is set, this value is required for both dual I/O read and quad I/O read. See vendor's datasheet for more information. For Winbond's device, the continuous read mode value is 8'bxx10xxxx to skip the instruction code for the next read transfer, else instruction code is sent for all read transfers. Bit 24 has to be configured accordingly with this value.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: Reserved, value is undefined when read.

parameter.name: DUMMY_BYTE
parameter.desc: Number of dummy bytes between address and return read data

parameter.name: INST_CODE
parameter.desc: Read instruction code. The known read instruction codes are: 8'h03 - Read 8'h0B - Fast read 8'h3B - Fast read dual output 8'h6B - Fast read quad output 8'hBB - Fast read dual I/O 8'hEB - Fast read quad I/O

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: D_FSM_ERR
parameter.desc: Data FSM error, if set

parameter.name: WR_RECVD
parameter.desc: AXI write command received, if set

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Module ID value.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved.

parameter.name: CEN
parameter.desc: Can Enable The Enable bit for the CAN controller. 1 = The CAN controller is in Loop Back, Sleep or Normal mode depending on the LBACK and SLEEP bits in the MSR. 0 = The CAN controller is in the Configuration mode. If the CEN bit is changed during core operation, it is recommended to reset the core so that operations start afresh.

parameter.name: SRST
parameter.desc: Reset The Software reset bit for the CAN controller. 1 = CAN controller is reset. If a 1 is written to this bit, all the CAN controller configuration registers (including the SRR) are reset. Reads to this bit always return a 0.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved.

parameter.name: SNOOP
parameter.desc: Snoop Mode Select The Snoop Mode Select bit. 1 = CAN controller is in Snoop mode. 0 = CAN controller is in Normal, Loop Back, Configuration, or Sleep mode. This bit can be written to only when CEN bit in SRR is 0.

parameter.name: LBACK
parameter.desc: Loop Back Mode Select The Loop Back Mode Select bit. 1 = CAN controller is in Loop Back mode. 0 = CAN controller is in Normal, Snoop, Configuration, or Sleep mode. This bit can be written to only when CEN bit in SRR is 0.

parameter.name: SLEEP
parameter.desc: Sleep Mode Select The Sleep Mode select bit. 1 = CAN controller is in Sleep mode. 0 = CAN controller is in Normal, Snoop, Configuration or Loop Back mode. This bit is cleared when the CAN controller wakes up from the Sleep mode.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: BRP
parameter.desc: Baud Rate Prescaler These bits indicate the prescaler value. The actual value ranges from 1 to 256.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: SJW
parameter.desc: Synchronization Jump Width Indicates the Synchronization Jump Width as specified in the CAN 2.0A and CAN 2.0B standard. The actual value is one more than the value written to the register.

parameter.name: TS2
parameter.desc: Time Segment 2 Indicates Phase Segment 2 as specified in the CAN 2.0A and CAN 2.0B standard. The actual value is one more than the value written to the register.

parameter.name: TS1
parameter.desc: Time Segment 1 Indicates the Sum of Propagation Segment and Phase Segment 1 as specified in the CAN 2.0A and CAN 2.0B standard. The actual value is one more than the value written to the register.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: REC
parameter.desc: Receive Error Counter Indicates the Value of the Receive Error Counter.

parameter.name: TEC
parameter.desc: Transmit Error Counter Indicates the Value of the Transmit Error Counter.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: ACKER
parameter.desc: ACK Error Indicates an acknowledgement error. 1 = Indicates an acknowledgement error has occurred. 0 = Indicates an acknowledgement error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it.

parameter.name: BERR
parameter.desc: Bit Error Indicates the received bit is not the same as the transmitted bit during bus communication. 1 = Indicates a bit error has occurred. 0 = Indicates a bit error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it.

parameter.name: STER
parameter.desc: Stuff Error Indicates an error if there is a stuffing violation. 1 = Indicates a stuff error has occurred. 0 = Indicates a stuff error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it.

parameter.name: FMER
parameter.desc: Form Error Indicates an error in one of the fixed form fields in the message frame. 1 = Indicates a form error has occurred. 0 = Indicates a form error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it.

parameter.name: CRCER
parameter.desc: CRC Error Indicates a CRC error has occurred. 1 = Indicates a CRC error has occurred. 0 = Indicates a CRC error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it. In case of a CRC Error and a CRC delimiter corruption, only the FMER bit is set.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: SNOOP
parameter.desc: Snoop Mode Indicates the CAN controller is in Snoop Mode. 1 = Indicates the CAN controller is in Snoop Mode. 0 = Indicates the CAN controller is not in Snoop mode.

parameter.name: ACFBSY
parameter.desc: Acceptance Filter Busy This bit indicates that the Acceptance Filter Mask Registers and the Acceptance Filter ID Registers cannot be written to. 1 = Acceptance Filter Mask Registers and Acceptance Filter ID Registers cannot be written to. 0 = Acceptance Filter Mask Registers and the Acceptance Filter ID Registers can be written to. This bit exists only when the number of acceptance filters is not 0 This bit is set when a 0 is written to any of the valid UAF bits in the Acceptance Filter Register.

parameter.name: TXFLL
parameter.desc: Transmit FIFO Full Indicates that the TX FIFO is full. 1 = Indicates the TX FIFO is full. 0 = Indicates the TX FIFO is not full.

parameter.name: TXBFLL
parameter.desc: High Priority Transmit Buffer Full Indicates the High Priority Transmit Buffer is full. 1 = Indicates the High Priority Transmit Buffer is full. 0 = Indicates the High Priority Transmit Buffer is not full.

parameter.name: ESTAT
parameter.desc: Error Status Indicates the error status of the CAN controller. 00 = Indicates Configuration Mode (CONFIG = 1). Error State is undefined. 01 = Indicates Error Active State. 11 = Indicates Error Passive State. 10 = Indicates Bus Off State.

parameter.name: ERRWRN
parameter.desc: Error Warning Indicates that either the Transmit Error counter or the Receive Error counter has exceeded a value of 96. 1 = One or more error counters have a value greater than or equal to 96. 0 = Neither of the error counters has a value greater than or equal to 96.

parameter.name: BBSY
parameter.desc: Bus Busy Indicates the CAN bus status. 1 = Indicates that the CAN controller is either receiving a message or transmitting a message. 0 = Indicates that the CAN controller is either in Configuration mode or the bus is idle.

parameter.name: BIDLE
parameter.desc: Bus Idle Indicates the CAN bus status. 1 = Indicates no bus communication is taking place. 0 = Indicates the CAN controller is either in Configuration mode or the bus is busy.

parameter.name: NORMAL
parameter.desc: Normal Mode Indicates the CAN controller is in Normal Mode. 1 = Indicates the CAN controller is in Normal Mode. 0 = Indicates the CAN controller is not in Normal mode.

parameter.name: SLEEP
parameter.desc: Sleep Mode Indicates the CAN controller is in Sleep mode. 1 = Indicates the CAN controller is in Sleep mode. 0 = Indicates the CAN controller is not in Sleep mode.

parameter.name: LBACK
parameter.desc: Loop Back Mode Indicates the CAN controller is in Loop Back mode. 1 = Indicates the CAN controller is in Loop Back mode. 0 = Indicates the CAN controller is not in Loop Back mode.

parameter.name: CONFIG
parameter.desc: Configuration Mode Indicator Indicates the CAN controller is in Configuration mode. 1 = Indicates the CAN controller is in Configuration mode. 0 = Indicates the CAN controller is not in Configuration mode.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: TXFEMP
parameter.desc: Transmit FIFO EmptyInterrupt A 1 indicates that the Transmit FIFO is empty. The interrupt continues to assert as long as the TX FIFO is empty. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the ICR.

parameter.name: TXFWMEMP
parameter.desc: Transmit FIFO Watermark Empty Interrupt A 1 indicates that the TX FIFO is empty based on watermark programming. The interrupt continues to assert as long as the number of empty spaces in the TX FIFO is greater than TX FIFO empty watermark. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the Interrupt Clear Register.

parameter.name: RXFWMFLL
parameter.desc: Receive FIFO Watermark Full Interrupt A 1 indicates that the RX FIFO is full based on watermark programming. The interrupt continues to assert as long as the RX FIFO count is above RX FIFO Full watermark. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the Interrupt Clear Register.

parameter.name: WKUP
parameter.desc: Wake up Interrupt A 1 indicates that the CAN controller entered Normal mode from Sleep Mode. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: SLP
parameter.desc: Sleep Interrupt A 1 indicates that the CAN controller entered Sleep mode. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: BSOFF
parameter.desc: Bus Off Interrupt A 1 indicates that the CAN controller entered the Bus Off state. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: ERROR
parameter.desc: Error Interrupt A 1 indicates that an error occurred during message transmission or reception. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: RXNEMP
parameter.desc: Receive FIFO Not Empty Interrupt A 1 indicates that the Receive FIFO is not empty. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the ICR.

parameter.name: RXOFLW
parameter.desc: RX FIFO Overflow Interrupt A 1 indicates that a message has been lost. This condition occurs when a new message is being received and the Receive FIFO is Full. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: RXUFLW
parameter.desc: RX FIFO Underflow Interrupt A 1 indicates that a read operation was attempted on an empty RX FIFO. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the ICR.

parameter.name: RXOK
parameter.desc: New Message Received Interrupt A 1 indicates that a message was received successfully and stored into the RX FIFO. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: TXBFLL
parameter.desc: High Priority Transmit Buffer Full Interrupt A 1 indicates that the High Priority Transmit Buffer is full. The status of the bit is unaffected if write transactions occur on the High Priority Transmit Buffer when it is already full. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the ICR.

parameter.name: TXFLL
parameter.desc: Transmit FIFO Full Interrupt A 1 indicates that the TX FIFO is full. The status of the bit is unaffected if write transactions occur on the Transmit FIFO when it is already full. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the Interrupt Clear Register.

parameter.name: TXOK
parameter.desc: Transmission Successful Interrupt A 1 indicates that a message was transmitted successfully. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR. In Loop Back mode, both TXOK and RXOK bits are set. The RXOK bit is set before the TXOK bit.

parameter.name: ARBLST
parameter.desc: Arbitration Lost Interrupt A 1 indicates that arbitration was lost during message transmission. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: ETXFEMP
parameter.desc: Enable TXFIFO Empty Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the TXFEMP bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if TXFEMP bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if TXFEMP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ETXFWMEMP
parameter.desc: Enable TXFIFO watermark Empty Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the TXFWMEMP bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if TXFWMEMP bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if TXFWMEMP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXFWMFLL
parameter.desc: Enable RXFIFO watermark Full Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXFLL bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if RXFWMFLL bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if RXFWMFLL bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: EWKUP
parameter.desc: Enable Wake up Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the WKUP bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if WKUP bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if WKUP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ESLP
parameter.desc: Enable Sleep Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the SLP bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if SLP bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if SLP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: EBSOFF
parameter.desc: Enable Bus OFF Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the BSOFF bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if BSOFF bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if BSOFF bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: EERROR
parameter.desc: Enable Error Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the ERROR bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if ERROR bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if ERROR bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXNEMP
parameter.desc: Enable Receive FIFO Not Empty Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXNEMP bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if RXNEMP bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if RXNEMP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXOFLW
parameter.desc: Enable RX FIFO Overflow Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXOFLW bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if RXOFLW bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if RXOFLW bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXUFLW
parameter.desc: Enable RX FIFO Underflow Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXUFLW bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if RXUFLW bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if RXUFLW bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXOK
parameter.desc: Enable New Message Received Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXOK bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if RXOK bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if RXOK bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ETXBFLL
parameter.desc: Enable High Priority Transmit Buffer Full Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the TXBFLL bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if TXBFLL bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if TXBFLL bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ETXFLL
parameter.desc: Enable Transmit FIFO Full Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when TXFLL bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if TXFLL bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if TXFLL bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ETXOK
parameter.desc: Enable Transmission Successful Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the TXOK bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if TXOK bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if TXOK bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: EARBLST
parameter.desc: Enable Arbitration Lost Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the ARBLST bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if ARBLST bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if ARBLST bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: CTXFEMP
parameter.desc: Clear TXFIFO Empty Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the TXFEMP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CTXFWMEMP
parameter.desc: Clear TXFIFO Watermark Empty Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the TXFWMEMP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXFWMFLL
parameter.desc: Clear RXFIFO Watermark Full Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXFWMFLL bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CWKUP
parameter.desc: Clear Wake up Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the WKUP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CSLP
parameter.desc: Clear Sleep Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the SLP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CBSOFF
parameter.desc: Clear Bus Off Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the BSOFF bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CERROR
parameter.desc: Clear Error Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the ERROR bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXNEMP
parameter.desc: Clear Receive FIFO Not Empty Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXNEMP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXOFLW
parameter.desc: Clear RX FIFO Overflow Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXOFLW bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXUFLW
parameter.desc: Clear RX FIFO Underflow Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXUFLW bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXOK
parameter.desc: Clear New Message Received Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXOK bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CTXBFLL
parameter.desc: Clear High Priority Transmit Buffer Full Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the TXBFLL bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CTXFLL
parameter.desc: Clear Transmit FIFO Full Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the TXFLL bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CTXOK
parameter.desc: Clear Arbitration Lost Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the ARBLST bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CARBLST
parameter.desc: Clear Arbitration Lost Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the ARBLST bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: CTS
parameter.desc: Clear Timestamp Internal free running counter is cleared to 0 when CTS=1. This bit only needs to be written once with a 1 to clear the counter. The bit will automatically return to 0.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: EW
parameter.desc: TXFIFO Empty watermark TXFIFO generates an EMPTY interrupt based on the value programmed in this field. The valid range is (1-63). Only bits 18-23 are writable. No protection is given for illegal programming in this field. This field can be written to only when CEN bit in SRR is 0.

parameter.name: FW
parameter.desc: RXFIFO Full watermark RXFIFO generates FULL interrupt based on the value programmed in this field. The valid range is (1-63). Only bits 26-31 are writable. No protection is given for illegal programming in this field. This field can be written to only when CEN bit in SRR is 0.

parameter.name: IDH
parameter.desc: Standard Message ID The Identifier portion for a Standard Frame is 11 bits. These bits indicate the Standard Frame ID. This field is valid for both Standard and Extended Frames.

parameter.name: SRRRTR
parameter.desc: Substitute Remote Transmission Request This bit differentiates between data frames and remote frames. Valid only for Standard Frames. For Extended frames this bit is 1. 1 = Indicates that the message frame is a Remote Frame. 0 = Indicates that the message frame is a Data Frame.

parameter.name: IDE
parameter.desc: Identifier Extension This bit differentiates between frames using the Standard Identifier and those using the Extended Identifier. Valid for both Standard and Extended Frames. 1 = Indicates the use of an Extended Message Identifier. 0= Indicates the use of a Standard Message Identifier.

parameter.name: IDL
parameter.desc: Extended Message ID This field indicates the Extended Identifier. Valid only for Extended Frames. For Standard Frames, reads from this field return 0s For Standard Frames, writes to this field should be 0s

parameter.name: RTR
parameter.desc: Remote Transmission Request This bit differentiates between data frames and remote frames. Valid only for Extended Frames. 1 = Indicates the message object is a Remote Frame 0 = Indicates the message object is a Data Frame For Standard Frames, reads from this bit returns 0 For Standard Frames, writes to this bit should be 0

parameter.name: DLC
parameter.desc: Data Length Code This is the data length portion of the control field of the CAN frame. This indicates the number valid data bytes in Data Word 1 and Data Word 2 registers.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: DB0
parameter.desc: Data Byte 0 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has no data.

parameter.name: DB1
parameter.desc: Data Byte 1 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 1 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB2
parameter.desc: Data Byte 2 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 2 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB3
parameter.desc: Data Byte 3 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 3 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB0
parameter.desc: Data Byte 4 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 4 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB1
parameter.desc: Data Byte 5 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 5 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB2
parameter.desc: Data Byte 6 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 6 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB3
parameter.desc: Data Byte 7 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has 7 byte of data or fewer

parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: UAF4
parameter.desc: Use Acceptance Filter Number 4 Enables the use of acceptance filter pair 4. 1 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 4 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 4 are used for acceptance filtering. 0 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 4 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 4 are not used for acceptance filtering.

parameter.name: UAF3
parameter.desc: Use Acceptance Filter Number 3 Enables the use of acceptance filter pair 3. 1 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 3 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 3 are used for acceptance filtering. 0 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 3 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 3 are not used for acceptance filtering.

parameter.name: UAF2
parameter.desc: Use Acceptance Filter Number 2 Enables the use of acceptance filter pair 2. 1 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 2 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 2 are used for acceptance filtering. 0 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 2 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 2 are not used for acceptance filtering.

parameter.name: UAF1
parameter.desc: Use Acceptance Filter Number 1. Enables the use of acceptance filter pair 1. 1 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 1 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 1 are used for acceptance filtering. 0 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 1 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 1 are not used for acceptance filtering.

parameter.name: AMIDH
parameter.desc: Standard Message ID Mask These bits are used for masking the Identifier in a Standard Frame. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: AMSRR
parameter.desc: Substitute Remote Transmission Request Mask This bit is used for masking the RTR bit in a Standard Frame. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: AMIDE
parameter.desc: Identifier Extension Mask Used for masking the IDE bit in CAN frames. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier. If AMIDE = 1 and the AIIDE bit in the corresponding Acceptance ID register is 0, this mask is applicable to only Standard frames. If AMIDE = 1 and the AIIDE bit in the corresponding Acceptance ID register is 1, this mask is applicable to only extended frames. If AMIDE = 0 this mask is applicable to Standard frame.

parameter.name: AMIDL
parameter.desc: Extended Message ID Mask These bits are used for masking the Identifier in an Extended Frame. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: AMRTR
parameter.desc: Remote Transmission Request Mask. This bit is used for masking the RTR bit in an Extended Frame. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.desc: Substitute Remote Transmission Request Indicates the Remote Transmission Request bit for Standard frames

parameter.name: AIIDE
parameter.desc: Identifier Extension Differentiates between Standard and Extended frames

parameter.name: AIIDL
parameter.desc: Extended Message ID Mask Extended Identifier

parameter.name: AIRTR
parameter.desc: Remote Transmission Request Mask RTR bit for Extended frames.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved.

parameter.name: CEN
parameter.desc: Can Enable The Enable bit for the CAN controller. 1 = The CAN controller is in Loop Back, Sleep or Normal mode depending on the LBACK and SLEEP bits in the MSR. 0 = The CAN controller is in the Configuration mode. If the CEN bit is changed during core operation, it is recommended to reset the core so that operations start afresh.

parameter.name: SRST
parameter.desc: Reset The Software reset bit for the CAN controller. 1 = CAN controller is reset. If a 1 is written to this bit, all the CAN controller configuration registers (including the SRR) are reset. Reads to this bit always return a 0.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved.

parameter.name: SNOOP
parameter.desc: Snoop Mode Select The Snoop Mode Select bit. 1 = CAN controller is in Snoop mode. 0 = CAN controller is in Normal, Loop Back, Configuration, or Sleep mode. This bit can be written to only when CEN bit in SRR is 0.

parameter.name: LBACK
parameter.desc: Loop Back Mode Select The Loop Back Mode Select bit. 1 = CAN controller is in Loop Back mode. 0 = CAN controller is in Normal, Snoop, Configuration, or Sleep mode. This bit can be written to only when CEN bit in SRR is 0.

parameter.name: SLEEP
parameter.desc: Sleep Mode Select The Sleep Mode select bit. 1 = CAN controller is in Sleep mode. 0 = CAN controller is in Normal, Snoop, Configuration or Loop Back mode. This bit is cleared when the CAN controller wakes up from the Sleep mode.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: BRP
parameter.desc: Baud Rate Prescaler These bits indicate the prescaler value. The actual value ranges from 1 to 256.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: SJW
parameter.desc: Synchronization Jump Width Indicates the Synchronization Jump Width as specified in the CAN 2.0A and CAN 2.0B standard. The actual value is one more than the value written to the register.

parameter.name: TS2
parameter.desc: Time Segment 2 Indicates Phase Segment 2 as specified in the CAN 2.0A and CAN 2.0B standard. The actual value is one more than the value written to the register.

parameter.name: TS1
parameter.desc: Time Segment 1 Indicates the Sum of Propagation Segment and Phase Segment 1 as specified in the CAN 2.0A and CAN 2.0B standard. The actual value is one more than the value written to the register.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: REC
parameter.desc: Receive Error Counter Indicates the Value of the Receive Error Counter.

parameter.name: TEC
parameter.desc: Transmit Error Counter Indicates the Value of the Transmit Error Counter.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: ACKER
parameter.desc: ACK Error Indicates an acknowledgement error. 1 = Indicates an acknowledgement error has occurred. 0 = Indicates an acknowledgement error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it.

parameter.name: BERR
parameter.desc: Bit Error Indicates the received bit is not the same as the transmitted bit during bus communication. 1 = Indicates a bit error has occurred. 0 = Indicates a bit error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it.

parameter.name: STER
parameter.desc: Stuff Error Indicates an error if there is a stuffing violation. 1 = Indicates a stuff error has occurred. 0 = Indicates a stuff error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it.

parameter.name: FMER
parameter.desc: Form Error Indicates an error in one of the fixed form fields in the message frame. 1 = Indicates a form error has occurred. 0 = Indicates a form error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it.

parameter.name: CRCER
parameter.desc: CRC Error Indicates a CRC error has occurred. 1 = Indicates a CRC error has occurred. 0 = Indicates a CRC error has not occurred on the bus since the last write to this register. If this bit is set, writing a 1 clears it. In case of a CRC Error and a CRC delimiter corruption, only the FMER bit is set.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: SNOOP
parameter.desc: Snoop Mode Indicates the CAN controller is in Snoop Mode. 1 = Indicates the CAN controller is in Snoop Mode. 0 = Indicates the CAN controller is not in Snoop mode.

parameter.name: ACFBSY
parameter.desc: Acceptance Filter Busy This bit indicates that the Acceptance Filter Mask Registers and the Acceptance Filter ID Registers cannot be written to. 1 = Acceptance Filter Mask Registers and Acceptance Filter ID Registers cannot be written to. 0 = Acceptance Filter Mask Registers and the Acceptance Filter ID Registers can be written to. This bit exists only when the number of acceptance filters is not 0 This bit is set when a 0 is written to any of the valid UAF bits in the Acceptance Filter Register.

parameter.name: TXFLL
parameter.desc: Transmit FIFO Full Indicates that the TX FIFO is full. 1 = Indicates the TX FIFO is full. 0 = Indicates the TX FIFO is not full.

parameter.name: TXBFLL
parameter.desc: High Priority Transmit Buffer Full Indicates the High Priority Transmit Buffer is full. 1 = Indicates the High Priority Transmit Buffer is full. 0 = Indicates the High Priority Transmit Buffer is not full.

parameter.name: ESTAT
parameter.desc: Error Status Indicates the error status of the CAN controller. 00 = Indicates Configuration Mode (CONFIG = 1). Error State is undefined. 01 = Indicates Error Active State. 11 = Indicates Error Passive State. 10 = Indicates Bus Off State.

parameter.name: ERRWRN
parameter.desc: Error Warning Indicates that either the Transmit Error counter or the Receive Error counter has exceeded a value of 96. 1 = One or more error counters have a value greater than or equal to 96. 0 = Neither of the error counters has a value greater than or equal to 96.

parameter.name: BBSY
parameter.desc: Bus Busy Indicates the CAN bus status. 1 = Indicates that the CAN controller is either receiving a message or transmitting a message. 0 = Indicates that the CAN controller is either in Configuration mode or the bus is idle.

parameter.name: BIDLE
parameter.desc: Bus Idle Indicates the CAN bus status. 1 = Indicates no bus communication is taking place. 0 = Indicates the CAN controller is either in Configuration mode or the bus is busy.

parameter.name: NORMAL
parameter.desc: Normal Mode Indicates the CAN controller is in Normal Mode. 1 = Indicates the CAN controller is in Normal Mode. 0 = Indicates the CAN controller is not in Normal mode.

parameter.name: SLEEP
parameter.desc: Sleep Mode Indicates the CAN controller is in Sleep mode. 1 = Indicates the CAN controller is in Sleep mode. 0 = Indicates the CAN controller is not in Sleep mode.

parameter.name: LBACK
parameter.desc: Loop Back Mode Indicates the CAN controller is in Loop Back mode. 1 = Indicates the CAN controller is in Loop Back mode. 0 = Indicates the CAN controller is not in Loop Back mode.

parameter.name: CONFIG
parameter.desc: Configuration Mode Indicator Indicates the CAN controller is in Configuration mode. 1 = Indicates the CAN controller is in Configuration mode. 0 = Indicates the CAN controller is not in Configuration mode.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: TXFEMP
parameter.desc: Transmit FIFO EmptyInterrupt A 1 indicates that the Transmit FIFO is empty. The interrupt continues to assert as long as the TX FIFO is empty. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the ICR.

parameter.name: TXFWMEMP
parameter.desc: Transmit FIFO Watermark Empty Interrupt A 1 indicates that the TX FIFO is empty based on watermark programming. The interrupt continues to assert as long as the number of empty spaces in the TX FIFO is greater than TX FIFO empty watermark. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the Interrupt Clear Register.

parameter.name: RXFWMFLL
parameter.desc: Receive FIFO Watermark Full Interrupt A 1 indicates that the RX FIFO is full based on watermark programming. The interrupt continues to assert as long as the RX FIFO count is above RX FIFO Full watermark. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the Interrupt Clear Register.

parameter.name: WKUP
parameter.desc: Wake up Interrupt A 1 indicates that the CAN controller entered Normal mode from Sleep Mode. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: SLP
parameter.desc: Sleep Interrupt A 1 indicates that the CAN controller entered Sleep mode. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: BSOFF
parameter.desc: Bus Off Interrupt A 1 indicates that the CAN controller entered the Bus Off state. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: ERROR
parameter.desc: Error Interrupt A 1 indicates that an error occurred during message transmission or reception. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: RXNEMP
parameter.desc: Receive FIFO Not Empty Interrupt A 1 indicates that the Receive FIFO is not empty. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the ICR.

parameter.name: RXOFLW
parameter.desc: RX FIFO Overflow Interrupt A 1 indicates that a message has been lost. This condition occurs when a new message is being received and the Receive FIFO is Full. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: RXUFLW
parameter.desc: RX FIFO Underflow Interrupt A 1 indicates that a read operation was attempted on an empty RX FIFO. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the ICR.

parameter.name: RXOK
parameter.desc: New Message Received Interrupt A 1 indicates that a message was received successfully and stored into the RX FIFO. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: TXBFLL
parameter.desc: High Priority Transmit Buffer Full Interrupt A 1 indicates that the High Priority Transmit Buffer is full. The status of the bit is unaffected if write transactions occur on the High Priority Transmit Buffer when it is already full. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the ICR.

parameter.name: TXFLL
parameter.desc: Transmit FIFO Full Interrupt A 1 indicates that the TX FIFO is full. The status of the bit is unaffected if write transactions occur on the Transmit FIFO when it is already full. This bit can be cleared only by writing to the Interrupt Clear Register.

parameter.name: TXOK
parameter.desc: Transmission Successful Interrupt A 1 indicates that a message was transmitted successfully. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR. In Loop Back mode, both TXOK and RXOK bits are set. The RXOK bit is set before the TXOK bit.

parameter.name: ARBLST
parameter.desc: Arbitration Lost Interrupt A 1 indicates that arbitration was lost during message transmission. This bit can be cleared by writing to the ICR. This bit is also cleared when a 0 is written to the CEN bit in the SRR.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: ETXFEMP
parameter.desc: Enable TXFIFO Empty Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the TXFEMP bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if TXFEMP bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if TXFEMP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ETXFWMEMP
parameter.desc: Enable TXFIFO watermark Empty Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the TXFWMEMP bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if TXFWMEMP bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if TXFWMEMP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXFWMFLL
parameter.desc: Enable RXFIFO watermark Full Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXFLL bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if RXFWMFLL bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if RXFWMFLL bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: EWKUP
parameter.desc: Enable Wake up Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the WKUP bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if WKUP bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if WKUP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ESLP
parameter.desc: Enable Sleep Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the SLP bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if SLP bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if SLP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: EBSOFF
parameter.desc: Enable Bus OFF Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the BSOFF bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if BSOFF bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if BSOFF bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: EERROR
parameter.desc: Enable Error Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the ERROR bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if ERROR bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if ERROR bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXNEMP
parameter.desc: Enable Receive FIFO Not Empty Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXNEMP bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if RXNEMP bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if RXNEMP bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXOFLW
parameter.desc: Enable RX FIFO Overflow Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXOFLW bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if RXOFLW bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if RXOFLW bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXUFLW
parameter.desc: Enable RX FIFO Underflow Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXUFLW bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if RXUFLW bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if RXUFLW bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ERXOK
parameter.desc: Enable New Message Received Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the RXOK bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if RXOK bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if RXOK bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ETXBFLL
parameter.desc: Enable High Priority Transmit Buffer Full Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the TXBFLL bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if TXBFLL bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if TXBFLL bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ETXFLL
parameter.desc: Enable Transmit FIFO Full Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when TXFLL bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if TXFLL bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if TXFLL bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: ETXOK
parameter.desc: Enable Transmission Successful Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the TXOK bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if TXOK bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if TXOK bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: EARBLST
parameter.desc: Enable Arbitration Lost Interrupt Writes to this bit enable or disable interrupts when the ARBLST bit in the ISR is set. 1 = Enable interrupt generation if ARBLST bit in ISR is set. 0 = Disable interrupt generation if ARBLST bit in ISR is set.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: CTXFEMP
parameter.desc: Clear TXFIFO Empty Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the TXFEMP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CTXFWMEMP
parameter.desc: Clear TXFIFO Watermark Empty Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the TXFWMEMP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXFWMFLL
parameter.desc: Clear RXFIFO Watermark Full Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXFWMFLL bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CWKUP
parameter.desc: Clear Wake up Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the WKUP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CSLP
parameter.desc: Clear Sleep Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the SLP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CBSOFF
parameter.desc: Clear Bus Off Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the BSOFF bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CERROR
parameter.desc: Clear Error Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the ERROR bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXNEMP
parameter.desc: Clear Receive FIFO Not Empty Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXNEMP bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXOFLW
parameter.desc: Clear RX FIFO Overflow Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXOFLW bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXUFLW
parameter.desc: Clear RX FIFO Underflow Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXUFLW bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CRXOK
parameter.desc: Clear New Message Received Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the RXOK bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CTXBFLL
parameter.desc: Clear High Priority Transmit Buffer Full Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the TXBFLL bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CTXFLL
parameter.desc: Clear Transmit FIFO Full Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the TXFLL bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CTXOK
parameter.desc: Clear Arbitration Lost Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the ARBLST bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: CARBLST
parameter.desc: Clear Arbitration Lost Interrupt Writing a 1 to this bit clears the ARBLST bit in the ISR.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: CTS
parameter.desc: Clear Timestamp Internal free running counter is cleared to 0 when CTS=1. This bit only needs to be written once with a 1 to clear the counter. The bit will automatically return to 0.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: EW
parameter.desc: TXFIFO Empty watermark TXFIFO generates an EMPTY interrupt based on the value programmed in this field. The valid range is (1-63). Only bits 18-23 are writable. No protection is given for illegal programming in this field. This field can be written to only when CEN bit in SRR is 0.

parameter.name: FW
parameter.desc: RXFIFO Full watermark RXFIFO generates FULL interrupt based on the value programmed in this field. The valid range is (1-63). Only bits 26-31 are writable. No protection is given for illegal programming in this field. This field can be written to only when CEN bit in SRR is 0.

parameter.name: IDH
parameter.desc: Standard Message ID The Identifier portion for a Standard Frame is 11 bits. These bits indicate the Standard Frame ID. This field is valid for both Standard and Extended Frames.

parameter.name: SRRRTR
parameter.desc: Substitute Remote Transmission Request This bit differentiates between data frames and remote frames. Valid only for Standard Frames. For Extended frames this bit is 1. 1 = Indicates that the message frame is a Remote Frame. 0 = Indicates that the message frame is a Data Frame.

parameter.name: IDE
parameter.desc: Identifier Extension This bit differentiates between frames using the Standard Identifier and those using the Extended Identifier. Valid for both Standard and Extended Frames. 1 = Indicates the use of an Extended Message Identifier. 0= Indicates the use of a Standard Message Identifier.

parameter.name: IDL
parameter.desc: Extended Message ID This field indicates the Extended Identifier. Valid only for Extended Frames. For Standard Frames, reads from this field return 0s For Standard Frames, writes to this field should be 0s

parameter.name: RTR
parameter.desc: Remote Transmission Request This bit differentiates between data frames and remote frames. Valid only for Extended Frames. 1 = Indicates the message object is a Remote Frame 0 = Indicates the message object is a Data Frame For Standard Frames, reads from this bit returns 0 For Standard Frames, writes to this bit should be 0

parameter.name: DLC
parameter.desc: Data Length Code This is the data length portion of the control field of the CAN frame. This indicates the number valid data bytes in Data Word 1 and Data Word 2 registers.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: DB0
parameter.desc: Data Byte 0 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has no data.

parameter.name: DB1
parameter.desc: Data Byte 1 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 1 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB2
parameter.desc: Data Byte 2 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 2 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB3
parameter.desc: Data Byte 3 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 3 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB0
parameter.desc: Data Byte 4 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 4 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB1
parameter.desc: Data Byte 5 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 5 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB2
parameter.desc: Data Byte 6 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has only 6 byte of data or fewer

parameter.name: DB3
parameter.desc: Data Byte 7 Reads from this field return invalid data if the message has 7 byte of data or fewer

Valid for both Standard and Extended Frames. 1 = Indicates the use of an Extended Message Identifier. 0= Indicates the use of a Standard Message Identifier.

Valid only for Extended Frames. 1 = Indicates the message object is a Remote Frame 0 = Indicates the message object is a Data Frame For Standard Frames, reads from this bit returns 0 For Standard Frames, writes to this bit should be 0

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: UAF4
parameter.desc: Use Acceptance Filter Number 4 Enables the use of acceptance filter pair 4. 1 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 4 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 4 are used for acceptance filtering. 0 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 4 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 4 are not used for acceptance filtering.

parameter.name: UAF3
parameter.desc: Use Acceptance Filter Number 3 Enables the use of acceptance filter pair 3. 1 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 3 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 3 are used for acceptance filtering. 0 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 3 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 3 are not used for acceptance filtering.

parameter.name: UAF2
parameter.desc: Use Acceptance Filter Number 2 Enables the use of acceptance filter pair 2. 1 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 2 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 2 are used for acceptance filtering. 0 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 2 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 2 are not used for acceptance filtering.

parameter.name: UAF1
parameter.desc: Use Acceptance Filter Number 1. Enables the use of acceptance filter pair 1. 1 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 1 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 1 are used for acceptance filtering. 0 = Indicates Acceptance Filter Mask Register 1 and Acceptance Filter ID Register 1 are not used for acceptance filtering.

parameter.name: AMIDH
parameter.desc: Standard Message ID Mask These bits are used for masking the Identifier in a Standard Frame. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: AMSRR
parameter.desc: Substitute Remote Transmission Request Mask This bit is used for masking the RTR bit in a Standard Frame. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: AMIDE
parameter.desc: Identifier Extension Mask Used for masking the IDE bit in CAN frames. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier. If AMIDE = 1 and the AIIDE bit in the corresponding Acceptance ID register is 0, this mask is applicable to only Standard frames. If AMIDE = 1 and the AIIDE bit in the corresponding Acceptance ID register is 1, this mask is applicable to only extended frames. If AMIDE = 0 this mask is applicable to Standard frame.

parameter.name: AMIDL
parameter.desc: Extended Message ID Mask These bits are used for masking the Identifier in an Extended Frame. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: AMRTR
parameter.desc: Remote Transmission Request Mask. This bit is used for masking the RTR bit in an Extended Frame. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: AIIDH
parameter.desc: Standard Message ID Standard Identifier

parameter.name: AISRR
parameter.desc: Substitute Remote Transmission Request Indicates the Remote Transmission Request bit for Standard frames

parameter.name: AIIDE
parameter.desc: Identifier Extension Differentiates between Standard and Extended frames

parameter.name: AIIDL
parameter.desc: Extended Message ID Mask Extended Identifier

parameter.name: AIRTR
parameter.desc: Remote Transmission Request Mask RTR bit for Extended frames.

parameter.name: AMIDH
parameter.desc: Standard Message ID Mask These bits are used for masking the Identifier in a Standard Frame. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: AMSRR
parameter.desc: Substitute Remote Transmission Request Mask This bit is used for masking the RTR bit in a Standard Frame. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: AMIDE
parameter.desc: Identifier Extension Mask Used for masking the IDE bit in CAN frames. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier. If AMIDE = 1 and the AIIDE bit in the corresponding Acceptance ID register is 0, this mask is applicable to only Standard frames. If AMIDE = 1 and the AIIDE bit in the corresponding Acceptance ID register is 1, this mask is applicable to only extended frames. If AMIDE = 0 this mask is applicable to Standard frame.

parameter.name: AMIDL
parameter.desc: Extended Message ID Mask These bits are used for masking the Identifier in an Extended Frame. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: AMRTR
parameter.desc: Remote Transmission Request Mask. This bit is used for masking the RTR bit in an Extended Frame. 1= Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is used when comparing the incoming message identifier. 0 = Indicates the corresponding bit in Acceptance Mask ID Register is not used when comparing the incoming message identifier.

parameter.name: MinHoldTime
parameter.desc: The formatting scheme can easily become inefficient if fast switching occurs, so, where possible, this must be minimized. If a source has nothing to transmit, then another source is selected irrespective of the minimum number of cycles. Reset is 0x3. The CSTF holds for the minimum hold time and one additional cycle. The mFunnelum value that can be entered is 0xE and this equates to 15 cycles. 0xF is reserved.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The claim tag register is used for any interrogating tools to determine if the device is being programmed or has been programmed. Read: 1= Claim tag is implemented, 0 = Claim tag is not implemented Write: 1= Set claim tag bit, 0= No effect

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The claim tag register is used for any interrogating tools to determine if the device is being programmed or has been programmed. Read: Current value of claim tag. Write: 1= Clear claim tag bit, 0= No effect

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Write Access Code. Write behavior depends on PADDRDBG31 pin: - PADDRDBG31=0 (lower 2GB): After reset (via PRESETDBGn), Funnel is locked, i.e., writes to all other registers using lower 2GB addresses are ignored. To unlock, 0xC5ACCE55 must be written this register. After the required registers are written, to lock again, write a value other than 0xC5ACCE55 to this register. - PADDRDBG31=1 (upper 2GB): Funnel is unlocked when upper 2GB addresses are used to write to all the registers. However, write to this register is ignored using a upper 2GB address! Note: read from this register always returns 0, regardless of PADDRDBG31.

parameter.name: n8BIT
parameter.desc: Set to 0 since Funnel implements a 32-bit lock access register

parameter.name: STATUS
parameter.desc: Read behavior depends on PADDRDBG31 pin: - PADDRDBG31=0 (lower 2GB): When a lower 2GB address is used to read this register, this bit indicates whether Funnel is in locked state (1= locked, 0= unlocked). - PADDRDBG31=1 (upper 2GB): always returns 0.

parameter.name: IMP
parameter.desc: Read behavior depends on PADDRDBG31 pin: - PADDRDBG31=0 (lower 2GB): always returns 1, meaning lock mechanism are implemented. - PADDRDBG31=1 (upper 2GB): always returns 0, meaning lock mechanism is NOT implemented.

parameter.name: divisor_a
parameter.desc: Divisor for stage A clock divider. 0 - 3: Divides the input pclk frequency by divisor_a + 1.

parameter.name: divisor_b
parameter.desc: Divisor for stage B clock divider. 0 -31 : Divides the output frequency from divisor_a by divisor_b + 1.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: CLR_FIFO
parameter.desc: clear_fifo:This bit is implemented only if FIFO is implemented. 1 - initializes the FIFO to all zeros and clears the transfer size register. Automatically gets cleared on the next APB clock after being set.

parameter.name: SLVMON
parameter.desc: Slave monitor mode 1 - monitor mode. 0 - normal operation.

parameter.name: HOLD
parameter.desc: hold_bus 1 - when no more data is available for transmit or no more data can be received, hold the sclk line low until serviced by the host. 0 - allow the transfer to terminate as soon as all the data has been transmitted or received.

parameter.name: ACKEN
parameter.desc: ackn_enabled: This bit must always be set if FIFO is implemented. 1 - acknowledge enabled, ACK transmitted 0 - acknowledge disabled, NACK transmitted.

parameter.name: NEA
parameter.desc: Addressing mode: This bit is used in master mode only. 1 - normal (7-bit) address 0 - reserved

parameter.name: MS
parameter.desc: Overall interface mode: 1 - master 0 - slave

parameter.name: RW
parameter.desc: Direction of transfer: This bit is used in master mode only. 1 - master receiver 0 - master transmitter.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: BA
parameter.desc: Bus Active 1 - ongoing transfer on the I2C bus.

parameter.name: RXOVF
parameter.desc: Receiver Overflow 1 - when the receiver receives a byte of data before the previous byte has been read by the host.

parameter.name: TXDV
parameter.desc: Transmit Data Valid - SW should not use this to determine data completion, it is the RAW value on the interface. Please use COMP in the ISR. 1 - still a byte of data to be transmitted by the interface.

parameter.name: RXDV
parameter.desc: Receiver Data Valid 1 -valid, new data to be read from the interface.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: RXRW
parameter.desc: RX read_write 1 - mode of the transmission received from a master.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ADD
parameter.desc: Address 0 - 1024: Normal addressing mode uses add[6:0]. Extended addressing mode uses add[9:0].

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reads the last received byte of data.

parameter.name: DATA
parameter.desc: data 0 -255: When written to, the data register sets data to transmit. When read from, the data register

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: ARB_LOST
parameter.desc: arbitration lost 1 = master loses bus ownership during a transfer due to ongoing arbitration

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: RX_UNF
parameter.desc: FIFO receive underflow 1 = host attempts to read from the I2C data register more times than the value of the transfer size register plus one

parameter.name: TX_OVF
parameter.desc: FIFO transmit overflow 1 = host attempts to write to the I2C data register more times than the FIFO depth

parameter.name: RX_OVF
parameter.desc: Receive overflow 1 = transfer is complete

parameter.name: SLV_RDY
parameter.desc: Monitored slave ready 1 = addressed slave returns ACK.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.desc: Transfer time out 1 = I2C sclk line is kept low for longer time

parameter.name: NACK
parameter.desc: Transfer not acknowledged 1 = slave responds with a NACK or master terminates the transfer before all data is supplied

parameter.name: DATA
parameter.desc: More data 1 = Data being sent or received

parameter.name: COMP
parameter.desc: Transfer complete 1 = transfer is complete

parameter.name: Transfer_Size
parameter.desc: Transfer Size 0-255: Master transmitter mode, Master receiver mode, Slave transmitter mode, Slave receiver mode.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: Pause
parameter.desc: pause interval 0 - 7: pause interval

parameter.name: TO
parameter.desc: Time Out 127 - 32 : value of time out register

parameter.desc: Transmit Data Valid - SW should not use this to determine data completion, it is the RAW value on the interface. Please use COMP in the ISR. 1 - still a byte of data to be transmitted by the interface.

parameter.name: RXDV
parameter.desc: Receiver Data Valid 1 -valid, new data to be read from the interface.

parameter.name: RX_UNF
parameter.desc: FIFO receive underflow 1 = host attempts to read from the I2C data register more times than the value of the transfer size register plus one

parameter.name: TX_OVF
parameter.desc: FIFO transmit overflow 1 = host attempts to write to the I2C data register more times than the FIFO depth

parameter.name: RX_OVF
parameter.desc: Receive overflow 1 = transfer is complete

parameter.name: SLV_RDY
parameter.desc: Monitored slave ready 1 = addressed slave returns ACK.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.desc: Transfer time out 1 = I2C sclk line is kept low for longer time

parameter.name: NACK
parameter.desc: Transfer not acknowledged 1 = slave responds with a NACK or master terminates the transfer before all data is supplied

parameter.name: DATA

parameter.name: COMP
parameter.desc: Transfer complete 1 = transfer is complete

parameter.name: Transfer_Size

parameter.name: l2_enable
parameter.desc: 0 = L2 Cache is disabled. This is the default value. 1 = L2 Cache is enabled.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, reserved

parameter.name: early_bresp_en
parameter.desc: Early BRESP enable 0 = Early BRESP disabled. This is the default. 1 = Early BRESP enabled.

parameter.name: instr_prefetch_en
parameter.desc: Instruction prefetch enable 0 = Instruction prefetching disabled. This is the default. 1 = Instruction prefetching enabled.

parameter.name: data_prefetch_en
parameter.desc: Data prefetch enable 0 = Data prefetching disabled. This is the default. 1 = Data prefetching enabled.

parameter.name: nonsec_inte_access_ctrl
parameter.desc: Non-secure interrupt access control 0 = Interrupt Clear, 0x220, and Interrupt Mask, 0x214, can only be modified or read with secure accesses. This is the default. 1 = Interrupt Clear, 0x220, and Interrupt Mask, 0x214, can be modified or read with secure or non-secure accesses.

parameter.name: nonsec_lockdown_en
parameter.desc: Non-secure lockdown enable 0 = Lockdown registers cannot be modified using non-secure accesses. This is the default. 1 = Non-secure accesses can write to the lockdown registers.

parameter.name: cache_replace_policy
parameter.desc: Cache replacement policy 0 = pseudo-random replacement using lfsr. 1 = round-robin replacement. This is the default.

parameter.name: force_write_alloc
parameter.desc: Force write allocate b00 = Use AWCACHE attributes for WA. This is the default. b01 = Force no allocate, set WA bit always 0. b10 = Override AWCACHE attributes, set WA bit always 1, all cacheable write misses become write allocated. b11 = Internally mapped to 00. See Cache operation on page 2-11 for more information.

parameter.name: shared_attr_override_en
parameter.desc: Shared attribute override enable 0 = Treats shared accesses as specified in Shareable attribute on page 2-15. This is the default. 1 = Shared attribute internally ignored.

parameter.name: parity_en
parameter.desc: Parity enable 0 = Disabled. This is the default. 1 = Enabled

parameter.name: event_mon_bus_en
parameter.desc: Event monitor bus enable 0 = Disabled. This is the default. 1 = Enabled

parameter.name: way_size
parameter.desc: Way-size b000 = Reserved, internally mapped to 16KB. b001 = 16KB. b010 = 32KB. b011 = 64KB. b100 = 128KB. b101 = 256KB. b110 = 512KB. b111 = Reserved, internally mapped to 512 KB.

parameter.name: associativity
parameter.desc: Associativity 0 = 8-way. 1 = 16-way.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: reserved, reserved

parameter.name: shared_attr_inva_en
parameter.desc: Shared Attribute Invalidate Enable 0 = Shared invalidate behavior disabled. This is the default. 1 = Shared invalidate behavior enabled, if Shared Attribute Override Enable bit not set. See Shareable attribute on page 2-15.

parameter.name: ex_cache_config
parameter.desc: Exclusive cache configuration 0 = Disabled. This is the default. 1 = Enabled,

parameter.name: store_buff_dev_lim_en
parameter.desc: Store buffer device limitation Enable 0 = Store buffer device limitation disabled. Device writes can take all slots in store buffer. This is the default. 1= Store buffer device limitation enabled. Device writes cannot take all slots in store buffer when connected to the Cortex-A9 MPCore processor. There is always one available slot to service Normal Memory

parameter.name: high_pr_so_dev_rd_en
parameter.desc: High Priority for SO and Dev Reads Enable 0 = Strongly Ordered and Device reads have lower priority than cacheable accesses when arbitrated in the L2CC (L2C-310) master ports. This is the default. 1 = Strongly Ordered and Device reads get the highest priority when arbitrated in the L2CC (L2C-310) master ports.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: reserved, reserved

parameter.name: full_line_zero_enable
parameter.desc: Full Line of Zero Enable 0 = Full line of write zero behavior disabled. This is the default. 1 = Full line of write zero behavior Enabled.
