parameter.name: lock_down_by_line_enable
parameter.desc: 0 = Lockdown by line disabled. This is the default. 1 = Lockdown by line enabled.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: unlock_all_lines_by_way_operation
parameter.desc: For all bits: 0 = Unlock all lines disabled. This is the default. 1 = Unlock all lines operation in progress for the corresponding way.

parameter.name: addr_filtering_start
parameter.desc: Address filtering start address.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: addr_filtering_enable
parameter.desc: 0 = Address filtering disabled. 1 = Address filtering enabled

parameter.name: addr_filtering_end
parameter.desc: Address filtering end address.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: SPNIDEN
parameter.desc: Reads value of SPNIDEN input.

parameter.name: DWB
parameter.desc: DWB: Disable write-back, force WT 0 = Enable write-back behavior. This is the default. 1 = Force write-through behavior

parameter.name: DCL
parameter.desc: DCL: Disable cache linefill 0 = Enable cache linefills. This is the default. 1 = Disable cache linefills.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: double_linefill_en
parameter.desc: Double linefill enable: You can set the following options for this register bit: 0 The L2CC always issues 4x64-bit read bursts to L3 on reads that miss in the L2 cache. This is the default. 1 The L2CC issues 8x64-bit read bursts to L3 on reads that miss in the L2 cache.

parameter.name: inst_pref_en
parameter.desc: Instruction prefetch enable: You can set the following options for this register bit: 0 Instruction prefetching disabled. This is the default. 1 Instruction prefetching enabled

parameter.name: data_pref_en
parameter.desc: Data prefetch enable: You can set the following options for this register bit: 0 Data prefetching disabled. This is the default. 1 Data prefetching enabled.

parameter.name: double_linefill_on_wrapread_en
parameter.desc: Double linefill on WRAP read disable: You can set the following options for this register bit: 0 Double linefill on WRAP read enabled. This is the default. 1 Double linefill on WRAP read disabled

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: pref_drop_en
parameter.desc: Prefetch drop enable: You can set the following options for this register bit: 0 The L2CC does not discard prefetch reads issued to L3. This is the default. 1 The L2CC discards prefetch reads issued to L3 when there is a resource conflict with explicit reads.

parameter.name: incr_double_linefill_en
parameter.desc: Incr double Linefill enable: You can set the following options for this register bit: 0 The L2CC does not issue INCR 8x64-bit read bursts to L3 on reads that miss in the L2 cache. This is the default. 1 The L2CC can issue INCR 8x64-bit read bursts to L3 on reads that miss in the L2 cache.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: not_same_id_on_excl_seq_en
parameter.desc: Not same ID on exclusive sequence enable: You can set the following options for this register bit: 0 Read and write portions of a non-cacheable exclusive sequence have the same AXI ID when issued to L3. This is the default. 1 Read and write portions of a non-cacheable exclusive sequence do not have the same AXI ID when issued to L3.

parameter.name: reserved_3
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: prefetch_offset
parameter.desc: Default = b00000.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: dynamic_clk_gating_en
parameter.desc: Dynamic clock gating enable. 1 = Enabled. 0 = Masked. This is the default.

parameter.name: standby_mode_en
parameter.desc: Standby mode enable. 1 = Enabled. 0 = Masked. This is the default

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Returns 0 when read

parameter.name: OddParityEn
parameter.desc: Enable RAM Odd Parity Generation. One control bit per data byte (OddParity[0] controls Data[7:0] e.t.c) 0 - Even Parity generated 1 - Odd Parity generated

parameter.name: LockFailErrIrqEn
parameter.desc: Enable interrupt when an AXI LOCK ("locked access") command is detected.

parameter.name: MultipleParityErrIrqEn
parameter.desc: Same as SingleParityErrIrqEn, but enables IRQ on multiple parity errors detected. 0 - IRQ is not generated when parity error detected and ParityCheckDis=0 1 - IRQ is generated when parity error detected and ParityCheckDis=0.

parameter.name: SingleParityErrIrqEn
parameter.desc: Enable interrupt when a single parity error is detected. Note that even if this field is 0, the OCM_IRQ_STS register will still log the error if ParityCheckDis=0. This allows software the option of polling if an error occurred. 0 - IRQ is not generated when parity error detected and ParityCheckDis=0 1 - IRQ is generated when parity error detected and ParityCheckDis=0.

parameter.name: RdRespParityErrEn
parameter.desc: Enable AXI read 'SLVERR' response for parity error detection. 0 - Error will not be sent on AXI read channel when parity error detected 1 - Error will be sent on AXI read channel when parity error detected and ParityCheckDis=0

parameter.name: ParityCheckDis
parameter.desc: Disable RAM Parity Checking. No checking or logging of status will occur when 1. 0 - RAM Parity checking is enabled 1 - RAM Parity checking is disabled

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Return 0 when read

parameter.name: ParityErrAddress
parameter.desc: When a parity Error occurs, the access address associated with the error is logged here. The first error address will be held if multiple parity errors occur. Need an explicit write of all '1's' to reset/clear this field.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Return 0 when read

parameter.name: LockFailErr
parameter.desc: When set (1), indicates that an AXI LOCK has been attempted (not supported by OCM). This is a sticky bit. Once set it can only be cleared by explicitly writing a 1 to this field. This field drives the interrupt pin. (Associated irq enable bit must be set)

parameter.name: MultipleParityErr
parameter.desc: Status of OCM multiple parity error. This is a sticky bit. Once set it can only be cleared by explicitly writing a 1 to this field. This field drives the interrupt pin. (Associated irq enable bit must be set) 0 - Multiple OCM parity Errors have not occurred 1 - Multiple OCM parity Errors have occurred

parameter.name: SingleParityErr
parameter.desc: Status of OCM single parity error. This is a sticky bit. Once set it can only be cleared by explicitly writing a 1 to this field. This field drives the interrupt pin (Associated irq enable bit must be set) 0 - Single OCM parity Error has not occurred 1 - Single OCM parity Error has occurred

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Return 0 when read

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Read/Write reserved register

parameter.name: DisableRom
parameter.desc: When set (1), disables the ROM CEN signal. This is useful when the 2:1 clock ratio is used and the ROM clk exceeds its specifications

parameter.name: ScuWrPriorityLo
parameter.desc: When set (1), changes the priority of the SCU write port to LOW from Medium

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: LOCK
parameter.desc: Secure configuration lock: 0 = unlocked, Secure writes to Secure configuration registers are enabled 1 = locked, all writes to Secure configuration registers are disabled and cannot be enabled until power-on reset is asserted.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: LOCK_KEY
parameter.desc: When write data contains the lock key value of 0x767B, the write protection mode is enabled. All registers defined in SLCR are write protected until unlocked again through the SLCR_UNLOCK register. A read of this register always returns zero.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: UNLOCK_KEY
parameter.desc: When write data contains the unlock key value of 0xDF0D, the write protection mode is disabled. All registers defined in SLCR are writeable until locked again through the SLCR_LOCK register. A read of this register always returns zero.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: LOCK_STATUS
reserved_2
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: PLL_FDIV
parameter.desc: Provides the feedback divisor for the PLL. NOTE: Before changing this value the PLL must first be bypassed and then put into powerdown or reset state.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: PLL_BYPASS_FORCE
parameter.desc: Overides control of the PLL bypass function within the clock controller to force into bypass state. 0 - PLL not forced to be bypassed (may still be bypassed through bootstrap pin). 1 - PLL forced to be bypassed.

parameter.name: PLL_BYPASS_QUAL
parameter.desc: Qualifies the PLL bootstrap signal sampled from boot_mode[3] in the MIO. By default the bootstrap will directly control all three PLL bypass muxes within the clock controller. 0 - PLL bypass mux in clock controller is only controlled by PLL_BYPASS_FORCE bit. 1 - PLL bypass mux in clock controller is controlled by sampled boot_mode[3] provided PLL_BYPASS_FORCE is not set.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: PLL_PWRDWN
parameter.desc: Drives the PWRDWN input of the PLL: 0 - PLL powered up; 1 - PLL powered down.

parameter.name: PLL_RESET
parameter.desc: Drives the RESET input of the PLL. 0 - PLL out of reset; 1 - PLL held in reset. Remember that after reset, the user should program the PLLs and ensure that the serviced bit below is asserted before using.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.desc: Provides the feedback divisor for the PLL. NOTE: Before changing this value the PLL must first be bypassed and then put into powerdown or reset state.

parameter.name: PLL_BYPASS_QUAL
parameter.desc: Qualifies the PLL bootstrap signal sampled from boot_mode[3] in the MIO. By default the bootstrap will directly control all three PLL bypass muxes within the clock controller. 0 - PLL bypass mux in clock controller is only controlled by PLL_BYPASS_FORCE bit. 1 - PLL bypass mux in clock controller is controlled by sampled boot_mode[3] provided PLL_BYPASS_FORCE is not set.

parameter.name: PLL_PWRDWN
parameter.desc: Drives the PWRDWN input of the PLL. 0 - PLL powered up. 1 - PLL powered down

parameter.name: PLL_RESET
parameter.desc: Drives the RESET input of the PLL. 0 - PLL out of reset. 1 - PLL held in reset. Remember that after reset, the user should program the PLLs and ensure that the serviced bit below is asserted before using.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: IO_PLL_STABLE
parameter.desc: IO PLL clock stable status. 0 - IO PLL out of lock and not bypassed. 1 - IO PLL in lock or bypassed. Note: Reset condition is actually 0, but will always be 1 by the time this register can be read.

parameter.name: DDR_PLL_STABLE
parameter.desc: DDR PLL clock stable status. 0 - DDR PLL out of lock and not bypassed. 1 - DDR PLL in lock or bypassed. Note: Reset condition is actually 0, but will always be 1 by the time this register can be read.

parameter.name: ARM_PLL_STABLE
parameter.desc: ARM PLL clock stable status. 0 - ARM PLL out of lock and not in bypass. 1 - ARM PLL in lock or bypassed. Note: Reset condition is actually 0, but will always be 1 by the time this register can be read.

parameter.name: IO_PLL_LOCK
parameter.desc: IO PLL lock status. 0 - IO PLL out of lock. 1 - IO PLL in lock. Note: Reset condition is actually 0, but will always be 1 by the time this register can be read if PLL's are being used.

parameter.name: DDR_PLL_LOCK
parameter.desc: DDR PLL lock status. 0 - DDR PLL out of lock. 1 - DDR PLL in lock. Note: Reset condition is actually 0, but will always be 1 by the time this register can be read if PLL's are being used.

parameter.name: ARM_PLL_LOCK
parameter.desc: ARM PLL lock status. 0 - ARM PLL out of lock. 1 - ARM PLL in lock. Note: Reset condition is actually 0, but will always be 1 by the time this register can be read if PLL's are being used.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: LOCK_CNT
parameter.desc: Drives the LOCK_CNT[9:0] input of the PLL to set the number of clock cycles the PLL needs to have clkref and clkfb aligned withth a certain window before syaing locked.

parameter.name: PLL_CP
parameter.desc: Drives the PLL_CP[3:0] input of the PLL to set the PLL charge pump control

parameter.name: PLL_RES
parameter.desc: Drives the PLL_RES[3:0] input of the PLL to set the PLL loop filter resistor control

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: SRCSEL
parameter.desc: Selects the source used to generate the clock. 0x - Source for generated clock is IO PLL. 10 - Source for generated clock is ARM PLL. 11 - Source for generated clock is DDR PLL.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: CLKACT1
parameter.desc: UART 1 reference clock active. 0 - Clock is disabled. 1 - Clock is enabled.

parameter.name: CLKACT0
parameter.desc: UART 0 reference clock active. 0 - Clock is disabled. 1 - Clock is enabled.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: CAN1_REF_SEL
parameter.desc: CAN1 Reference Clock selection. 0 - From internal PLL. 1 - From MIO based on the next field

parameter.name: CAN1_MUX
parameter.desc: CAN1 mux selection for MIO. Setting this to zero will select MIO[0] as the clock source. Only values 0-53 are valid.

parameter.name: CAN0_MUX
parameter.desc: CAN0 mux selection for MIO. Setting this to zero will select MIO[0] as the clock source. Only values 0-53 are valid.

parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.desc: Selects the source used to generate the clock. 1xx - Source for generated clock FMIO trace clock. 00x - Source for generated clock is IO PLL. 010 - Source for generated clock is ARM PLL. 011 - Source for generated clock is DDR PLL

parameter.name: reserved

parameter.name: CPU_1XCLKACT
parameter.desc: Debug CPU 1x Clock active. 0 - Clocks are disabled. 1 - Clocks are enabled

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: SYNC
parameter.desc: Indicates whether fpga_stop input from the fabric should be considered synchronous or asynchronous to generated FPGA clock output. 0 - fpga_stop is asynchronous to FPGA clock. 1 - fpga_stop is synchronous to FPGA clock.

parameter.name: EDGE
parameter.desc: Selects between edge stop or level stop modes of operation for the clock throttle logic. 0 - debug level stop mode. 1 - debug edge stop mode.

parameter.name: CNT_RST
parameter.desc: Resets clock throttle counter when in halt state. 0 - No effect. 1 - Causes counter to be reset once HALT state is entered.

parameter.name: CPU_START
parameter.desc: Start or restart count on detection of 0 to 1 transition in the value of this bit. A read will always return the written value. 0 - No effect. 1 - Start count or restart count if previous value was 0.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: DLY_CNT
parameter.desc: Delay count value. Specifies the minimum number of output clock pulses before entering HALT state due to fpga_stop assertion.

parameter.name: LAST_CNT
parameter.desc: Last count value. Specifies the total number of clocks output in debug mode by the clock throttle logic.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: RUNNING
parameter.desc: Current running status of FPGA clock output. 0 - Clock is stopped or in normal mode (OK to change config). 1 - Clock is runnnig in debug mode (Keep config static).

parameter.name: CURR_VAL
parameter.desc: Current clock throttle counter value, which indicates the number of clock pulses output so far (only accurate when halted).

parameter.name: reserved_3
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.desc: Synchronous mode control for the CPU - DDR path 0 - asynchronous mode 1 - CPU and DDR at 1 to 1 clock ratio

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: TRIM_EN
parameter.desc: Use the trim value in this register, if set

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.desc: Bandgap trim value

parameter.desc: PLL test

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: PRE_DIVISOR
parameter.desc: Divisor value. The input frequency of Zync is between 30-60MHz and the input to the PLL is between 30-60MHz, there is no reason to change this number from the default value of one during normal operation.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: CLK_621_TRUE
parameter.desc: Enable the 6:2:1 mode. 1 for 6:3:2:1. 0 for 4:2:2:1.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: CLOCK_SEL
parameter.desc: Clock Select. 00=APU PLL clock (default). 01=DDR PLL clock. 10= IO PLL clock. 11= reserved

parameter.name: TRIGGER_EN
parameter.desc: This enables all the triggers.

parameter.name: CNT_LOAD
parameter.desc: Load the count value into the counter.

parameter.name: TRIGGER_SEL
parameter.desc: Trigger Select. 00 SLCR (default). 01 Fabric (Not implemented). 10 Address match (AXIM) (not implemented)

parameter.name: START
parameter.desc: Picture debug start, if set.

parameter.name: COUNT_UPPER
parameter.desc: Upper 32-bit count value.

parameter.name: COUNT_LOWER
parameter.desc: Lower 32-bit count value.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: SOFT_RST
parameter.desc: PSS software reset. On assertion of this reset, the entire design will be reset except for the clock generator. This bit is self clearing in that the reset generated will result in the SLCR being reset. 0 - No reset. 1 - PSS software reset initiated.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: DDR_RST
parameter.desc: DDR software reset. On assertion of this reset, the DDR subsystem will be reset. 0 - No reset. 1 - DDR subsystem held in reset.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: DMAC_RST
parameter.desc: DMAC software reset. On assertion of this reset DMAC will be reset. 0 - DMAC not in reset. DMAC TrustZone register is read only. 1 - DMAC held in reset. DMAC TrustZone register is now programmable.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: USB1_ULPI_RST
parameter.desc: USB 1 ULPI software reset. On assertion of this reset, the ULPI clock portion of the USB 1 subsystem will be reset. 0 - No reset. 1 - ULPI clock portion of USB 1 subsytem held in reset.

parameter.name: USB0_ULPI_RST
parameter.desc: USB 0 ULPI software reset. On assertion of this reset, the ULPI clock portion of the USB 0 subsystem will be reset. 0 - No reset. 1 - ULPI clock portion of USB 0 subsytem held in reset.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.desc: FPGA ACP port soft reset. 0 - No reset. 1 - ACP AXI interface reset output asserted.

parameter.name: FPGA_AXDS3_RST
parameter.desc: AXDS3AXI interface soft reset. On assertion of this reset, the AXDS3AXI interface reset output will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - AXDS3AXI interface reset output asserted.

parameter.name: FPGA_AXDS2_RST
parameter.desc: AXDS2 AXI interface soft reset. On assertion of this reset, the AXDS2 AXI interface reset output will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - AXDS2 AXI interface reset output asserted.

parameter.name: FPGA_AXDS1_RST
parameter.desc: AXDS1 AXI interface soft reset. On assertion of this reset, the AXDS1 AXI interface reset output will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - AXDS1 AXI interface reset output asserted.

parameter.name: FPGA_AXDS0_RST
parameter.desc: AXDS0 AXI interface soft reset. On assertion of this reset, the AXDS0 AXI interface reset output will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - AXDS0 AXI interface reset output asserted.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: FSSW1_FPGA_RST
parameter.desc: General purpose FPGA slave interface 1 soft reset. On assertion of this reset, the FPGA slave interface 1 reset will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - FPGA slave interface 1 reset is asserted.

parameter.name: FSSW0_FPGA_RST
parameter.desc: General purpose FPGA slave interface 0 soft reset. On assertion of this reset, the FPGA slave interface 0 reset will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - FPGA slave interface 0 reset is asserted.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: FPGA_FMSW1_RST
parameter.desc: General purpose FPGA master interface 1 soft reset. On assertion of this reset, the FPGA master interface 1 reset will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - FPGA master interface 1 reset is asserted.

parameter.name: FPGA_FMSW0_RST
parameter.desc: General purpose FPGA master interface 0 soft reset. On assertion of this reset, the FPGA master interface 0 reset will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - FPGA master interface 0 reset is asserted.

parameter.name: FPGA_DMA3_RST
parameter.desc: FPGA DMA 3 peripheral request soft reset. On assertion of this reset, the FPGA DMA 3 peripheral request reset output will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - FPGA DMA 3 peripheral request reset output asserted.

parameter.name: FPGA_DMA2_RST
parameter.desc: FPGA DMA 2 peripheral request soft reset. On assertion of this reset, the FPGA DMA 2 peripheral request reset output will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - FPGA DMA 2 peripheral request reset output asserted.

parameter.name: FPGA_DMA1_RST
parameter.desc: FPGA DMA 1 peripheral request soft reset. On assertion of this reset, the FPGA DMA 1 peripheral request reset output will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - FPGA DMA 1 peripheral request reset output asserted.

parameter.name: FPGA_DMA0_RST
parameter.desc: FPGA DMA 0 peripheral request soft reset. On assertion of this reset, the FPGA DMA 0 peripheral request reset output will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - FPGA DMA 0 peripheral request reset output asserted.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: FPGA3_OUT_RST
parameter.desc: FPGA3software reset. On assertion of this reset, the FPGA 3 top level reset output will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - FPGA 3 top level reset output asserted.

parameter.name: FPGA2_OUT_RST
parameter.desc: FPGA2 software reset. On assertion of this reset, the FPGA 2 top level reset output will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - FPGA 2 top level reset output asserted.

parameter.name: FPGA1_OUT_RST
parameter.desc: FPGA1 software reset. On assertion of this reset, the FPGA 1 top level reset output will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - FPGA 1 top level reset output asserted.

parameter.name: FPGA0_OUT_RST
parameter.desc: FPGA0 software reset. On assertion of this reset, the FPGA 0 top level reset output will be asserted. 0 - No reset. 1 - FPGA 0 top level reset output asserted.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: PERI_RST
parameter.desc: CPU peripheral soft reset.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: A9_CLKSTOP1
parameter.desc: Clock stop if 1 for core 1

parameter.name: A9_CLKSTOP0
parameter.desc: Clock stop if 1 for core 0

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: A9_RST1
parameter.desc: 0 - No reset. 1 - reset A9 core 1.

parameter.name: A9_RST0
parameter.desc: 0 - No reset. 1 - reset A9 core 0.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: CTRL1
parameter.desc: When the APU watchdog timer 1 goes off, the SLCR can control whether the whole system is reboot or just the ARM core who's WDT went off will be reset. 0 - reset Pele; 1 - reset ARM core

parameter.name: CTRL0
reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: POR
parameter.desc: Last reset was due to POR (power on reset), if set.

parameter.name: SRST_B
parameter.desc: Last reset was due to SRST_B (soft reset), if set.

parameter.name: DBG_RST
parameter.desc: Last reset was due to debug system reset, if set.

parameter.name: SLC_RST
parameter.desc: Last reset was due to SLC soft reset, if set.

parameter.name: AWDT1_RST
parameter.desc: Last reset was due to APU watchdog timer 1, if set.

parameter.name: AWDT0_RST
parameter.desc: Last reset was due to APU watchdog timer 0, if set.

parameter.name: SWDT_RST
parameter.desc: Last reset was due to system watchdog timeout, if set (see watchdog status for more details).

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: CLEAR
parameter.desc: Clears reset reason source within the reset controller. 0 - No effect. 1 - Clears reset reason source. A read of this register always returns zero.

parameter.name: REBOOT_STATE
parameter.desc: General 32-bit R/W field to allow software to store information that persists through all resets except power-on reset.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: PLL_BYPASS
parameter.desc: Sampled bootstrap to indicate whether PLLs should be bypassed by default after deglicthed power on reset has completed. 0 - All PLL outputs are by default routed to clock distribution. 1 - All PLL outputs are bypassed and reference clock input will feed clock distribution

parameter.name: BOOT_MODE
parameter.desc: Sampled bootstrap to indicate current boot mode. Interpreted by software: x000 - PSS boots from QSPI x001 - PSS boots from NAND x010 - PSS boots from NOR x011 - PSS boots from FPGA, Xilinx internal mode 0100 - PSS boots from JTAG on FPGA side 0111 - DFT mode, special mode to enable FPGA immediately with security shut down. The reset value depends on what the mode pins are tied to at immediately after reset.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: CFGSDISABLE
parameter.desc: Disables write access to some system control processor registers, and some GIC registers. Set only.

parameter.name: CP15SDISABLE
parameter.desc: Disable write access to some system control processor (CP15) registers, in each processor. Set only. Once set, individual core reset cannot reset this value.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: SEL
parameter.desc: Watchdog timer clock source selection. 0 - cpu_1xclk. 1 - wdt_clk_in from FPGA.

parameter.desc: TrustZone status for 64MB section n at n*64MB. 0 = Secure, reset value. 1 = Non-secure.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero

parameter.name: DMAC_NS
parameter.desc: TZ security. 0 = secure, DMAC operates in the secure state. 1 = non-secure, DMAC operates in the non-secure state.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero

parameter.name: DMA_IRQ_NS
parameter.desc: TZ security. 0 = secure, DMAC operates in the secure state. 1 = non-secure, DMAC interrupt/event bit is in the non-secure state.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero

parameter.name: DMAC_PERIPH_NS
parameter.desc: TZ security. 0 = secure, DMAC operates in the secure state. 1 = non-secure, reset value: DMAC peripheral i/f is in the non-secure state.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero

parameter.name: E1
parameter.desc: TrustZone status for Gigabit Ethernet MAC 1. 0 = Secure, reset value. 1 = Non-secure.

parameter.name: E0
parameter.desc: TrustZone status for Gigabit Ethernet MAC 0. 0 = Secure, reset value. 1 = Non-secure.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero

parameter.desc: TrustZone status for SDIO controller 1. 0 = Secure, reset value. 1 = Non-secure.

parameter.name: S0
parameter.desc: TrustZone status for SDIO controller 0. 0 = Secure, reset value. 1 = Non-secure.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero

parameter.name: U1
parameter.desc: TrustZone status for USB controller 1. 0 = Secure, reset value. 1 = Non-secure.

parameter.name: U0
parameter.desc: TrustZone status for USB controller 0. 0 = Secure, reset value. 1 = Non-secure.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero

parameter.name: M1
parameter.desc: Secure disable for FPGA AXI master port 1. 0 = master port can make Secure and Non-secure accesses, reset value. 1 = master port can only make Non-secure accesses.

parameter.name: M0
parameter.desc: Secure disable for FPGA AXI master port 0. 0 = master port can make Secure and Non-secure accesses, reset value. 1 = master port can only make Non-secure accesses.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero

parameter.name: P3
parameter.desc: Secure disable for FPGA AFI AXI port 3. 0 = port can make Secure and Non-secure accesses, reset value. 1 = port can only make Non-secure accesses.

parameter.name: P2
parameter.desc: Secure disable for FPGA AFI AXI port 2. 0 = port can make Secure and Non-secure accesses, reset value. 1 = port can only make Non-secure accesses.

parameter.name: P1
parameter.desc: Secure disable for FPGA AFI AXI port 1. 0 = port can make Secure and Non-secure accesses, reset value. 1 = port can only make Non-secure accesses.

parameter.name: P0
parameter.desc: Secure disable for FPGA AFI AXI port 0. 0 = port can make Secure and Non-secure accesses, reset value. 1 = port can only make Non-secure accesses.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: SRST_B_TRI_B
parameter.desc: Controls direction of top level SRST_B pad.. When an output, the SRST_B pin is fed by the UART0 TX for firmware debug messages. 0 - SRST_B pad is an input for soft reset signal. 1 - SRST_B pad is an output dirven by UART0 TX.

parameter.name: IDCODE
parameter.desc: PSS IDCODE value, defined as follows: IDCODE[0] - Reserved = 1. IDCODE[11:1] - Manufacturer ID = 000 0100 1001. IDCODE[16:12] - Device from FPGA gasket = idcode_devtype[4:0]. IDCODE[20:17] - Subfamily from FPGA gasket = 1001. IDCODE[27:21] - Family = 001 1011. IDCODE[31:28] - Revision from FPGA gasket = idcode_version[3:0]

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: S3_ARURGENT
parameter.desc: Identifies DDR's AXI port S3 read prioritisation. Same as below.

parameter.name: S2_ARURGENT
parameter.desc: Identifies DDR's AXI port S2 read prioritisation. Same as below.

parameter.name: S1_ARURGENT
parameter.desc: Identifies DDR's AXI port S1 read prioritisation. Same as below.

parameter.name: S0_ARURGENT
parameter.desc: Identifies DDR's AXI port S0 read prioritisation: 0 - DDR's AXI port S0 read not requesting urgent prioritization. 1 - DDR's AXI port S0 read is requesting urgent prioritization.

parameter.name: S3_AWURGENT
parameter.desc: Identifies DDR's AXI port S3write prioritisation. Same as below.

parameter.name: S2_AWURGENT
parameter.desc: Identifies DDR's AXI port S2 write prioritisation. Same as below.

parameter.name: S1_AWURGENT
parameter.desc: Identifies DDR's AXI port S1 write prioritisation. Same as below.

parameter.name: S0_AWURGENT
parameter.desc: Identifies DDR's AXI port S0 write prioritisation: 0 - DDR's AXI port S0 write not requesting urgent prioritization. 1 - DDR's AXI port S0 write is requesting urgent prioritization.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: START_CAL_DLL
parameter.desc: This register creates a pulse which is first synchronised into the ddr_clk domain and then directly drives the co_gs_dll_calib input into the DDR controller. This signal is a command that indicates to the controller to issue a dll_calib to the DRAM. This signal should pulse for 1 ddrc_core_clk clock cycle to request a dll_calib to be issued. This is only required if the DDR controller register reg_ddrc_dis_dll_calib is 1. If reg_ddrc_dis_dll_calib is 0, the controller will automatically issue DLL Calibs. 0 - Do nothing. 1 - Start DLL calibration command. A read of this register always returns zero.

parameter.name: START_CAL_SHORT
parameter.desc: This register creates a pulse which is first synchronised into the ddr_clk domain and then directly drives the co_gs_zq_calib_short input into the DDR controller. This is required to pulse for 1 clock to issue ZQ Calibration Short Command to the DDR. There should be a minimum of 512 clks gap between 2 ZQ Calib Short commands from the core. If DDR controller register reg_ddrc_dis_auto_zq=0, asserting co_gs_zq_calib_short is not required, as this will be done automatically. If reg_ddrc_dis_auto_zq=1, then the core logic is required to assert co_gs_zq_calib_short periodically to update DDR3 ZQ calibration. 0 - Do nothing. 1 - Start ZQ calibration short command. A read of this register always returns zero.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: START_REF
parameter.desc: This register creates a pulse which is first synchronised into the ddr_clk domain and then directly drives the co_gs_rank_refresh input into the DDR controller. This register must be used with the Virage DRAM controller register bit reg_ddrc_dis_auto_refresh. This signal is a command that indicates to the controller to issue a refresh to the DRAM. One bit per rank. This signal should pulse for 1 ddrc_core_clk clock cycle to request a refresh to be issued. 0 - Do nothing. 1 - Start refresh. A read of this register always returns zero.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: CMD_Q_NEMPTY
parameter.desc: DDR controller command store fill status. 0 - indicates DDRC command store is empty. 1 - indicates there are commands pending in DDRC command store. This register is a continuous monitor of the ddrc_co_q_not_empty output from the DDR controller, which is first synchronised from ddr_clk into amba1x_clk.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: S3_ARQOS_MODE
parameter.desc: Selects between the AXI port s3_arqos[3], fabric signal or static register to drive the DDRC urgent bit as follows: 2'b00 - The DDRC s3_arurgent bit is driven from the 'S3_ARURGENT' field of the DDR_URGENT_VAL register. 2'b01 - The DDRC s3_arurgent bit is driven from the s3_arqos bit. 2'b10 - The DDRC s3_arurgent bit is driven from the fabric ddr_arb[3] input. 2'b11 - Undefined

parameter.name: S2_ARQOS_MODE
parameter.desc: Selects between the AXI port s2_arqos[3], fabric signal or static register to drive the DDRC urgent bit as follows: 2'b00 - The DDRC s2_arurgent bit is driven from the 'S2_ARURGENT' field of the DDR_URGENT_VAL register. 2'b01 - The DDRC s2_arurgent bit is driven from the s2_arqos bit. 2'b10 - The DDRC s2_arurgent bit is driven from the fabric ddr_arb[2] input. 2'b11 - Undefined.

parameter.name: S1_ARQOS_MODE
parameter.desc: Selects between the AXI port s1_arqos[3], fabric signal or static register to drive the DDRC urgent bit as follows: 2'b00 - The DDRC s1_arurgent bit is driven from the 'S1_ARURGENT' field of the DDR_URGENT_VAL register. 2'b01 - The DDRC s1_arurgent bit is driven from the s1_arqos bit. 2'b10 - The DDRC s1_arurgent bit is driven from the fabric ddr_arb[1] input. 2'b11 - Undefined.

parameter.name: S0_ARQOS_MODE
parameter.desc: Selects between the fabric signal or static register to drive the DDRC urgent bit as follows: 2'b00 - The DDRC s0_arurgent bit is driven from the 'S0_ARURGENT' field of the DDR_URGENT_VAL register. 2'b01 -Undefined. 2'b10 - The DDRC s0_arurgent bit is driven from the fabric ddr_arb[0] input. 2'b11 - Undefined

parameter.name: S3_AWQOS_MODE
parameter.desc: Selects between the AXI port s3_awqos[3], fabric signal or static register to drive the DDRC urgent bit as follows: 2'b00 - The DDRC s3_awurgent bit is driven from the 'S3_AWURGENT' field of the DDR_URGENT_VAL register. 2'b01 - The DDRC s3_awurgent bit is driven from the s3_awqos bit. 2'b10 - The DDRC s3_awurgent bit is driven from the fabric ddr_arb[3] input. 2'b11 - Undefined

parameter.name: S2_AWQOS_MODE
parameter.desc: Selects between the AXI port s2_awqos[3], fabric signal or static register to drive the DDRC urgent bit as follows: 2'b00 - The DDRC s2_awurgent bit is driven from the 'S2_AWURGENT' field of the DDR_URGENT_VAL register. 2'b01 - The DDRC s2_awurgent bit is driven from the s2_awqos bit. 2'b10 - The DDRC s2_awurgent bit is driven from the fabric ddr_arb[2] input. 2'b11 - Undefined

parameter.name: S1_AWQOS_MODE
parameter.desc: Selects between the AXI port s1_awqos[3], fabric signal or static register to drive the DDRC urgent bit as follows: 2'b00 - The DDRC s1_awurgent bit is driven from the 'S1_AWURGENT' field of the DDR_URGENT_VAL register. 2'b01 - The DDRC s1_awurgent bit is driven from the s1_awqos bit. 2'b10 - The DDRC s1_awurgent bit is driven from the fabric ddr_arb[1] input. 2'b11 - Undefined

parameter.name: S0_AWQOS_MODE
parameter.desc: Selects between the fabric signal or static register to drive the DDRC urgent bit as follows: 2'b00 - The DDRC s0_awurgent bit is driven from the 'S0_AWURGENT' field of the DDR_URGENT_VAL register. 2'b01 -Undefined. 2'b10 - The DDRC s0_awurgent bit is driven from the fabric ddr_arb[0] input. 2'b11 - Undefined.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: DFI_CAL_ST
parameter.desc: This signal is intended to allow a calibration of the IOB's at a time when the DDR controller is in its calibration mode, i.e. during an idle period.

parameter.name: TRI_ENABLE
parameter.desc: Tri-state enable, active high.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: GEM1_IF_SELECT
parameter.desc: GEM 1 Interface selection. 0 = RGMII to/from MIO. 1 = GMII to/from FMIO. The setting for this register generates the gem0_rx_sel signals to the GEM core wrappers within the IOU.

parameter.name: GEM0_IF_SELECT
parameter.desc: GEM 0 Interface selection. 0 = RGMII to/from MIO. 1 = GMII to/from FMIO. The setting for this register generates the gem0_rx_sel signals to the GEM core wrappers within the IOU.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: I2C0_LOOP_I2C1
parameter.desc: I2C Loopback Control. 0 = Connect I2C inputs according to MIO mapping. 1 = Loop I2C 0 outputs to I2C 1 inputs, and I2C 1 outputs to I2C 0 inputs.

parameter.name: CAN0_LOOP_CAN1
parameter.desc: CAN Loopback Control. 0 = Connect CAN inputs according to MIO mapping. 1 = Loop CAN 0 TX to CAN 1 RX, and CAN 1 TX to CAN 0 RX.

parameter.name: UA0_LOOP_UA1
parameter.desc: UART Loopback Control. 0 = Connect UART inputs according to MIO mapping. 1 = Loop UART 0 outputs to UART 1 inputs, and UART 1 outputs to UART 0 inputs. RXD/TXD cross-connected. RTS/CTS cross-connected. DSR, DTR, DCD and RI not used.

parameter.name: SPI0_LOOP_SPI1
parameter.desc: SPI Loopback Control. 0 = Connect SPI inputs according to MIO mapping. 1 = Loop SPI 0 outputs to SPI 1 inputs, and SPI 1 outputs to SPI 0 inputs. The other SPI core will always appear on the LS Slave Select.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Not used, tie to zero for read back.

parameter.name: SDIO0_CD_SEL
parameter.desc: SDIO0 CD Select. 0-53 = Selects matching MIO input however bits 7/8 are not supported and should not be used as they will conflict with the VCFG inputs. 54-63 = Selects the FMIO source

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Not used, tie to zero for read back.

parameter.name: SDIO0_WP_SEL
parameter.desc: SDIO0 WP Select. 0-53 = Selects matching MIO input however bits 7/8 are not supported and should not be used as they will conflict with the VCFG inputs. 54-63 = Selects the FMIO source

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Not used, tie to zero for read back.

parameter.name: SDIO1_CD_SEL
parameter.desc: SDIO1 CD Select. 0-53 = Selects matching MIO input however bits 7/8 are not supported and should not be used as they will conflict with the VCFG inputs. 54-63 = Selects the FMIO source

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Not used, tie to zero for read back.

parameter.name: SDIO1_WP_SEL
parameter.desc: SDIO1 WP Select. 0-53 = Selects matching MIO input however bits 7/8 are not supported and should not be used as they will conflict with the VCFG inputs. 54-63 = Selects the FMIO source

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: USER_INP_ICT_EN_1
parameter.desc: Enable level shifters for PSS user inputs to FPGA in FPGA tile 1, drives slcr_fpga_if_ctrl1[1:0].

parameter.name: USER_INP_ICT_EN_0
parameter.desc: Enable level shifters for PSS user inputs to FPGA in FPGA tile 0, drives slcr_fpga_if_ctrl0[1:0].

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: SWAP
parameter.desc: When cleared (0), the RAM is located starting at address 32'h0004_0000. This is the reset state. When set (1), the RAM is 'swapped' with the ROM at the bottom of the OCM address map. The base address for the RAM will now be 32'h0000_0000.

parameter.name: RAM_HI
parameter.desc: Maps the RAM, in 64kByte chunks, to the high address space (1) or the low address space(0). Refer to the OCM spec. for more details. Note that the 'RAM_HI' bits are only valid when the 'SWAP' bit is set.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.desc: Use dynamic_dci_ts to control dci 0 - termination enabled 1 - use 'dynamic_dci_ts' control termination

parameter.desc: Use ibuf_disable_into control ibuf 0 -ibuf is always enabled 1 - use ibuf_disable_in_to control enable

parameter.name: DCR_TYPE
parameter.desc: DCI Update 00 - DCI Disabled 01 - DCI Drive (HSTL12_DCI) 10 - Reserved 11 - DCI Termination (SSTL15_T_DCI)

parameter.desc: Tri State Termination Enabled 0 - disabled 1 - enabled

parameter.name: DCI_UPDATE
parameter.desc: DCI Update Enabled 0 - disabled 1 - enabled

parameter.name: INP_TYPE
parameter.desc: Input buffer controls. 00 - Input off, reads 0. 01 - Vref based differential reciever for SSTL, HSTL. 10 - Differential input reciever. 11- LVCMOS reviever.

parameter.desc: Specifies DDR IOB input amp power mode. 0- low power mode. 1- high performance mode.

parameter.desc: Enables pull-up resistors 0 -no pull-up 1 - enable pull-up resistors

parameter.name: DRST_B_PULLUP_EN
parameter.desc: Enables pull-up resistors 0 -no pull-up 1 - enable pull-up resistors

parameter.name: REFIO_PULLUP_EN
parameter.desc: Enables VRP,VRN pull-up resistors 0 -no pull-up 1 - enable pull-up resistors

parameter.name: REFIO_TSEN
parameter.desc: Enables VRP,VRN as normal outputs 00 - VRP/VRN not used 11 - VRP/VRN used as normal IO

parameter.name: REFIO_EN
parameter.desc: Enables VRP,VRN 0 - VRP/VRN not used 1 - VRP/VRN used as refio

parameter.name: VREF_PULLUP_EN
parameter.desc: Enables VREF pull-up resistors X0 - Disable VREF pull-up for lower 16 bits X1 - Enable VREF pull-up for lower 16 bits 0X - Disable VREF pull-up for upper 16 bits 1X - Enable VREF pull-up for upper 16 bits

parameter.name: VREF_EXT_EN
parameter.desc: Enables External VREF input X0 - Disable External VREF for lower 16 bits X1 - Enable External VREF for lower 16 bits 0X - Disable External VREF for upper 16 bits 1X - Enable External VREF for upper 16 bits

parameter.name: VREF_SEL
parameter.desc: Specifies DDR IOB Vref generator output 0001 - VREF = 0.6V for LPDDR2 with 1.2V IO 0010 - VREF = 0.675V for LPDDR3 1.35 V IO 0100 - VREF = 0.75V for DDR3 with 1.5V IO 1000 - VREF = 0.90V for DDR2 with 1.8V IO

parameter.name: VREF_INT_EN
parameter.desc: Enables VREF internal generator

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.desc: DCI Status input Read Only

parameter.name: Modefail_gen_en
parameter.desc: ModeFail Generation Enable 1 = enable 0 = disable

parameter.name: Man_start_com
parameter.desc: Manual Start Command 1 = start transmission of data 0 = don't care

parameter.name: Man_start_en
parameter.desc: Manual Start Enable 1 = enables maual start 0 = auto mode

parameter.name: Manual_CS
parameter.desc: Manual CS 1 = manual CS mode 0 = auto mode

parameter.name: CS
parameter.desc: Peripheral chip select lines xxx0 - slave 0 selected xx01 - slave 1 selected x011 - slave 2 selected 0111 - slave 3 selected 1111 - No slave selected

parameter.name: PERI_SEL
parameter.desc: Peripheral select decode 1 = allow external 4-to-16 decode 0 = only 1 of 4 selects

parameter.name: REF_CLK
parameter.desc: Master reference clock select 1 = use ext_clk 0 = use SPI REFERENCE CLOCK

parameter.name: FIFO_WIDTH
parameter.desc: FIFO width 00 = 8bits 01 = 16bits 10 = 24bits 11 = 32bits

parameter.name: BAUD_RATE_DIV
parameter.desc: Master mode baud rate divisor 000 = not supported 001 = divide by 4 010 = divide by 8 011 = divide by 16 100 = divide by 32 101 = divide by 64 110 = divide by 128 111 = divide by 256

parameter.name: CLK_PH
parameter.desc: Clock phase 1 = the SPI clock is inactive outside the word 0 = the SPI clock is active outside the word

parameter.name: CLK_POL
parameter.desc: Clock polarity outside SPI word 1 = the SPI clock is quiescent high 0 = the SPI clock is quiescent low

parameter.name: MODE_SEL
parameter.desc: Mode select 1 = the SPI is in master mode 0 = the SPI is in slave mode

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow 1 = underflow is detected 0 = no underflow has been detected

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full 1 = FIFO is full 0 = FIFO is not full

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty 1 = FIFO has more than or equal to THRESHOLD entries 0 = FIFO has less than RX THRESHOLD entries

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full 1 = FIFO is full 0 = FIFO is not full

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full 1 = FIFO has less than THRESHOLD entries 0 = FIFO has more than or equal toTHRESHOLD entries

parameter.name: MODE_FAIL
parameter.desc: ModeFail interrupt 1 = a mode fault has occurred 0 = no mode fault has been detected

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt 1 = overflow occured 0 = no overflow occurred

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: MODE_FAIL
parameter.desc: ModeFail interrupt enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow enable 1 = disables the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full enable 1 = disables the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty enable 1 = disables the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.desc: TX FIFO full enable 1 = disables the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full enable 1 = disables the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.desc: ModeFail interrupt enable 1 = disables the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow enable 1 = interrupt is disabled 0 = interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full enable 1 = interrupt is disabled 0 = interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty

parameter.name: MODE_FAIL

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: SPI_EN
parameter.desc: SPI_Enable 1 = enable the SPI 0 = disable the SPI

parameter.name: d_nss
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles for the length that the master mode chip select outputs are de-asserted between words when cpha=0.

parameter.name: d_btwn
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between one chip select being de-activated and the activation of another

parameter.name: d_after
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between last bit of current word and the first bit of the next word.

parameter.name: d_int
parameter.desc: Added delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between setting n_ss_out low and first bit transfer.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_data
parameter.desc: Data to TX FIFO

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_data
parameter.desc: Data from TX FIFO

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: Slave_Idle_coun
parameter.desc: SPI in slave mode detects a start only when the external SPI master serial clock (sclk_in) is stable (quiescent state) for SPI REFERENCE CLOCK cycles specified by slave idle count register or when the SPI is deselected.

parameter.name: DEPTH_of_TX_FIFO
parameter.desc: Defines the level at which the TX FIFO not full interrupt is generated

parameter.name: DEPTH_of_RX_FIFO
parameter.desc: Defines the level at which the RX FIFO not empty interrupt is generated

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: module_ID
parameter.desc: Module ID number

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: Modefail_gen_en
parameter.desc: ModeFail Generation Enable 1 = enable 0 = disable

parameter.name: Man_start_com
parameter.desc: Manual Start Command 1 = start transmission of data 0 = don't care

parameter.name: Man_start_en
parameter.desc: Manual Start Enable 1 = enables maual start 0 = auto mode

parameter.name: Manual_CS
parameter.desc: Manual CS 1 = manual CS mode 0 = auto mode

parameter.name: CS
parameter.desc: Peripheral chip select lines xxx0 - slave 0 selected xx01 - slave 1 selected x011 - slave 2 selected 0111 - slave 3 selected 1111 - No slave selected

parameter.name: PERI_SEL
parameter.desc: Peripheral select decode 1 = allow external 4-to-16 decode 0 = only 1 of 4 selects

parameter.name: REF_CLK
parameter.desc: Master reference clock select 1 = use ext_clk 0 = use SPI REFERENCE CLOCK

parameter.name: FIFO_WIDTH
parameter.desc: FIFO width 00 = 8bits 01 = 16bits 10 = 24bits 11 = 32bits

parameter.name: BAUD_RATE_DIV
parameter.desc: Master mode baud rate divisor 000 = not supported 001 = divide by 4 010 = divide by 8 011 = divide by 16 100 = divide by 32 101 = divide by 64 110 = divide by 128 111 = divide by 256

parameter.name: CLK_PH
parameter.desc: Clock phase 1 = the SPI clock is inactive outside the word 0 = the SPI clock is active outside the word

parameter.name: CLK_POL
parameter.desc: Clock polarity outside SPI word 1 = the SPI clock is quiescent high 0 = the SPI clock is quiescent low

parameter.name: MODE_SEL
parameter.desc: Mode select 1 = the SPI is in master mode 0 = the SPI is in slave mode

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_underflow
parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow 1 = underflow is detected 0 = no underflow has been detected

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: RX FIFO full 1 = FIFO is full 0 = FIFO is not full

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_not_empty
parameter.desc: RX FIFO not empty 1 = FIFO has more than or equal to THRESHOLD entries 0 = FIFO has less than RX THRESHOLD entries

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO full 1 = FIFO is full 0 = FIFO is not full

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_not_full
parameter.desc: TX FIFO not full 1 = FIFO has less than THRESHOLD entries 0 = FIFO has more than or equal toTHRESHOLD entries

parameter.name: MODE_FAIL
parameter.desc: ModeFail interrupt 1 = a mode fault has occurred 0 = no mode fault has been detected

parameter.name: RX_OVERFLOW
parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt 1 = overflow occured 0 = no overflow occurred

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.desc: TX FIFO underflow enable 1 = enable the interrupt 0 = no effect

parameter.desc: ModeFail interrupt enable 1 = interrupt is disabled 0 = interrupt is enabled

parameter.desc: Receive Overflow interrupt enable 1 = interrupt is disabled 0 = interrupt is enabled

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: SPI_EN
parameter.desc: SPI_Enable 1 = enable the SPI 0 = disable the SPI

parameter.name: d_nss
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles for the length that the master mode chip select outputs are de-asserted between words when cpha=0.

parameter.name: d_btwn
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between one chip select being de-activated and the activation of another

parameter.name: d_after
parameter.desc: Delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between last bit of current word and the first bit of the next word.

parameter.name: d_int
parameter.desc: Added delay in SPI REFERENCE CLOCK or ext_clk cycles between setting n_ss_out low and first bit transfer.

parameter.name: TX_FIFO_data
parameter.desc: Data to TX FIFO

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_data
parameter.desc: Data from TX FIFO

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: Slave_Idle_coun
parameter.desc: SPI in slave mode detects a start only when the external SPI master serial clock (sclk_in) is stable (quiescent state) for SPI REFERENCE CLOCK cycles specified by slave idle count register or when the SPI is deselected.

parameter.name: DEPTH_of_TX_FIFO
parameter.desc: Defines the level at which the TX FIFO not full interrupt is generated

parameter.name: DEPTH_of_RX_FIFO
parameter.desc: Defines the level at which the RX FIFO not empty interrupt is generated

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read as zero, ignored on write.

parameter.name: module_ID
parameter.desc: Module ID number

parameter.name: ZKEY
parameter.desc: Zero access key - writes to the zero mode register are only valid if this field is set to 0xABC; this field is write only.

parameter.name: EXTLN
parameter.desc: External signal length - selects the number of pclk cycles during which the external signal is held active after it is invoked: 000 = 2 001 = 4 010 = 8 011 = 16 100 = 32 101 = 64 110 = 128 111 = 256

parameter.name: IRQLN
parameter.desc: Interrupt request length - selects the number of pclk cycles during which an interrupt request is held active after it is invoked: 00 = 4 01 = 8 10 = 16 11 = 32

parameter.name: RSTLN
parameter.desc: Reset length - selects the number of clock cycles (pclk) during which the internal system reset is held active after it is invoked: 000 = 2 001 = 4 010 = 8 011 = 16 100 = 32 101 = 64 110 = 128 111 = 256 Note: The minimum number of cycles required for an AMBA reset is two.

parameter.name: EXTEN
parameter.desc: External signal enable - if set, the watchdog will issue an external request when the counter reaches zero, if WDEN = 1.

parameter.name: IRQEN
parameter.desc: Interrupt request enable - if set, the watchdog will issue an interrupt request when the counter reaches zero, if WDEN = 1.

parameter.name: RSTEN
parameter.desc: Reset enable - if set, the watchdog will issue an internal reset when the counter reaches zero, if WDEN = 1.

parameter.name: WDEN
parameter.desc: Watchdog enable - if set, the watchdog is enabled and can generate any signals that are enabled.

parameter.name: CKEY
parameter.desc: Counter access key - writes to the control register are only valid if this field is set to 0x248; this field is write only.

parameter.name: CRV
parameter.desc: Counter restart value - the counter is restarted with the value 0xNNNFFF, where NNN is the value of this field.

parameter.name: CLKSEL
parameter.desc: Counter clock prescale - selects the prescaler division ratio: 00 = pclk divided by 8 01 = pclk divided by 64 10 = pclk divided by 256 11 = pclk divided by 4096 Note: If a restart signal is received the prescaler should be reset.

parameter.name: RSTKEY
parameter.desc: Restart key - the watchdog is restarted if this field is set to the value 0x1999

parameter.name: WDZ
parameter.desc: set when the watchdog reaches zero count

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: DNS
parameter.desc: Provides the security status of the DMA manager thread: 0 = DMA manager operates in the Secure state 1 = DMA manager operates in the Non-secure state. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: Wakeup_event
parameter.desc: When the DMA manager thread executes a DMAWFE instruction, it waits for the following event to occur: b00000 = event[0] b00001 = event[1] b00010 = event[2] . . . b11111 = event[31]. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: DMA_status
parameter.desc: The operating state of the DMA manager: b0000 = Stopped b0001 = Executing b0010 = Cache miss b0011 = Updating PC b0100 = Waiting for event b0101-b1110 = reserved b1111 = Faulting. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: pc_mgr
parameter.desc: Program counter for the DMA manager thread This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: event_irq_select
parameter.desc: Program the appropriate bit to control how the DMAC responds when it executes DMASEV: Bit [N] = 0 If the DMAC executes DMASEV for the event-interrupt resource N then the DMAC signals event N to all of the threads. Set bit [N] to 0 if your system design does not use irq[N] to signal an interrupt request. Bit [N] = 1 If the DMAC executes DMASEV for the event-interrupt resource N then the DMAC sets irq[N] HIGH. Set bit [N] to 1 if your system design requires irq[N] to signal an interrupt request. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: srw: During secure access, it is read write. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsrw: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read write.

parameter.name: DMASEV_active
parameter.desc: Returns the status of the event-interrupt resources: Bit [N] = 0 Event N is inactive or irq[N] is LOW. Bit [N] = 1 Event N is active or irq[N] is HIGH. Note When the DMAC executes a DMASEV N instruction to send event N, the INTEN Register controls whether the DMAC: signals an interrupt using the appropriate irq sends the event to all of the threads. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: irq_status
parameter.desc: Provides the status of the interrupts that are active in the DMAC: Bit [N] = 0 Interrupt N is inactive and therefore irq[N] is LOW. Bit [N] = 1 Interrupt N is active and therefore irq[N] is HIGH. Note You must use the INTCLR Register to set bit [N] to 0, see Interrupt Clear Register. Note Bit [N] is 0 if the INTEN Register programs DMASEV to signal an event This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: irq_clr
parameter.desc: Controls the clearing of the irq outputs: Bit [N] = 0 The status of irq[N] does not change. Bit [N] = 1 The DMAC sets irq[N] LOW if the INTEN Register programs the DMAC to signal an interrupt. Otherwise, the status of irq[N] does not change. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: swo: During secure access, it is write only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnswo: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is write only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: fs_mgr
parameter.desc: Provides the fault status of the DMA manager. Read as: 0 = the DMA manager thread is not in the Faulting state 1 = the DMA manager thread is in the Faulting state. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: fault_status
parameter.desc: Each bit provides the fault status of the corresponding channel. Read as: Bit [N] = 0 No fault is present on DMA channel N. Bit [N] = 1 DMA channel N is in the Faulting or Faulting completing state. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: dbg_instr
parameter.desc: If the DMA manager aborts, this bit indicates whether the erroneous instruction was read from the system memory or from the debug interface: 0 = instruction that generated an abort was read from system memory 1 = instruction that generated an abort was read from the debug interface. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: instr_fetch_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the RRESP bus, after the DMA manager performs an instruction fetch: 0 = OKAY response 1 = EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: mgr_evnt_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA manager was attempting to execute DMAWFE or DMASEV with inappropriate security permissions: 0 = the DMA manager has appropriate security to execute DMAWFE or DMASEV 1 = a DMA manager thread in the Non-secure state attempted to execute either: DMAWFE to wait for a secure event H18DMASEV to create a secure event or secure interrupt. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dmago_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA manager was attempting to execute DMAGO with inappropriate security permissions: 0 = the DMA manager has appropriate security to execute DMAGO 1 = a DMA manager thread in the Non-secure state attempted to execute DMAGO to create a DMA channel operating in the Secure state. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_3
parameter.desc: read undefined

parameter.name: operand_invalid
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA manager was attempting to execute an instruction operand that was not valid for the configuration of the DMAC: 0 = valid operand 1 = invalid operand. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: undef_instr
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA manager was attempting to execute an undefined instruction: 0 = defined instruction 1 = undefined instruction. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: lockup_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA channel has locked-up because of resource starvation: 0 = DMA channel has adequate resources 1 = DMA channel has locked-up because of insufficient resources. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dbg_instr
parameter.desc: If the DMA channel aborts, this bit indicates whether the erroneous instruction was read from the system memory or from the debug interface: 0 = instruction that generated an abort was read from system memory 1 = instruction that generated an abort was read from the debug interface. This fault is an imprecise abort but the bit is only valid when a precise abort occurs. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: read undefined This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: data_read_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the RRESP bus, after the DMA channel thread performs a data read: 0 = OKAY response 1 = EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: data_write_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the BRESP bus, after the DMA channel thread performs a data write: 0 = OKAY response 1 = EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: instr_fetch_err
parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the RRESP bus, after the DMA channel thread performs an instruction fetch: 0 = OKAY response 1 = EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: read undefined This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: st_data_unavailable
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the MFIFO did not contain the data to enable the DMAC to perform the DMAST: 0 = MFIFO contains all the data to enable the DMAST to complete 1 = previous DMALDs have not put enough data in the MFIFO to enable the DMAST to complete. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: mfifo_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the MFIFO prevented the DMA channel thread from executing DMALD or DMAST. Depending on the instruction: DMALD 0 = MFIFO contains sufficient space 1 = MFIFO is too small to hold the data that DMALD requires. DMAST 0 = MFIFO contains sufficient data 1 = MFIFO is too small to store the data to enable DMAST to complete. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: read undefined This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: ch_rdwr_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether a DMA channel thread, in the Non-secure state, attempts to program the CCRn Register to perform a secure read or secure write: 0 = a DMA channel thread in the Non-secure state is not violating the security permissions 1 = a DMA channel thread in the Non-secure state attempted to perform a secure read or secure write. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: ch_periph_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether a DMA channel thread, in the Non-secure state, attempts to execute DMAWFP, DMALDP, DMASTP, or DMAFLUSHP with inappropriate security permissions: 0 = a DMA channel thread in the Non-secure state is not violating the security permissions 1 = a DMA channel thread in the Non-secure state attempted to execute either: DMAWFP to wait for a secure peripheral DMALDP or DMASTP to notify a secure peripheral DMAFLUSHP to flush a secure peripheral. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: ch_evnt_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA channel thread attempts to execute DMAWFE or DMASEV with inappropriate security permissions: 0 = a DMA channel thread in the Non-secure state is not violating the security permissions 1 = a DMA channel thread in the Non-secure state attempted to execute either: DMAWFE to wait for a secure event DMASEV to create a secure event or secure interrupt. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: reserved_3
parameter.desc: read undefined This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: operand_invalid
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA channel thread was attempting to execute an instruction operand that was not valid for the configuration of the DMAC: 0 = valid operand 1 = invalid operand. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: undef_instr
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA channel thread was attempting to execute an undefined instruction: 0 = defined instruction 1 = undefined instruction. This fault is a precise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: lockup_err
parameter.desc: Indicates whether the DMA channel has locked-up because of resource starvation: 0 = DMA channel has adequate resources 1 = DMA channel has locked-up because of insufficient resources. This fault is an imprecise abort. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.name: dbg_instr
parameter.desc: If the DMA channel aborts, this bit indicates whether the erroneous instruction was read from the system memory or from the debug interface: 0 = instruction that generated an abort was read from system memory 1 = instruction that generated an abort was read from the debug interface. This fault is an imprecise abort but the bit is only valid when a precise abort occurs. This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.desc: read undefined This bit-field has the following special access attributes: sro: During secure access, it is read only. nssraz: During non-secure access, if thread is secure, it is read as zero. nsnsro: During non-secure access, if thread is non-secure, it is read only.

parameter.desc: Indicates the AXI response that the DMAC receives on the RRESP bus, after the DMA channel thread performs a data read: 0 = OKAY response 1 = EXOKAY, SLVERR, or DECERR response. This fault is an imprecise abort.
