parameter.name: DATA_0
parameter.desc: Data values read from or written to the corresponding GPIO pins Each bit controls the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank. Note: Bit[6], bit[7] default value = 0

parameter.name: DATA_1
parameter.desc: Data values read from or written to the corresponding GPIO pins Each bit controls the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: DATA_2
parameter.desc: Data values read from or written to the corresponding GPIO pins Each bit controls the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: DATA_3
parameter.desc: Data values read from or written to the corresponding GPIO pins Each bit controls the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: DATA_0_RO
parameter.desc: GPIO pin values, independent of the read, write, and direction settings. Each bit provides a pin value within the 32-bit bank Note :Bit[6], bit[7] default value = 0

parameter.name: DATA_1_RO
parameter.desc: GPIO pin values, independent of the read, write, and direction settings. Each bit provides a pin value within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: DATA_2_RO
parameter.desc: GPIO pin values, independent of the read, write, and direction settings. Each bit provides a pin value within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: DATA_3_RO
parameter.desc: GPIO pin values, independent of the read, write, and direction settings. Each bit provides a pin value within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: BYPASS_MODE_0
parameter.desc: Bypass configuration for bank 0 0 = software controlled mode 1 = bypass mode Each bit configures the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: DIRECTION_0
parameter.desc: Direction mode for bank 0 0 = input 1 = output Each bit configures the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: OP_ENABLE_0
parameter.desc: Output enables for bank 0 0 = disabled 1 = enabled Each bit configures the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: INT_MASK_0
parameter.desc: Interrupt mask for bank 0 0 = interrupt source enabled 1 = interrupt source masked Each bit reports the status for the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: INT_ENABLE_0
parameter.desc: Interrupt enable for bank 0 0 = no change 1 = clear interrupt mask Each bit configures the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: INT_DISABLE_0
parameter.desc: Interrupt disable for bank 0 0 = no change 1 = set interrupt mask Each bit configures the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: INT_STATUS_0
parameter.desc: Interrupt status for bank 0 Upon read: 0 = no interrupt 1 = interrupt event has occurred Upon write: 0 = no action 1 = clear interrupt status bit Each bit configures the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: INT_TYPE_0
parameter.desc: Interrupt type for bank 0 0 = level-sensitive 1 = edge-sensitive Each bit configures the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: INT_POL_0
parameter.desc: Interrupt polarity for bank 0 0 = active low or falling edge 1 = active high or rising edge Each bit configures the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: INT_ON_ANY_0
parameter.desc: Interrupt edge triggering mode for bank 0 0 = trigger on single edge, using configured interrupt polarity 1 = trigger on both edges This value is ignored if corresponding interrupt source is configured to be level-sensitive Each bit configures the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: BYPASS_MODE_1
parameter.desc: Bypass configuration for bank 1 0 = software controlled mode 1 = bypass mode Each bit configures the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: DIRECTION_1

parameter.name: INT_DISABLE_1
parameter.desc: Interrupt disable for bank 1 0 = no change 1 = set interrupt mask Each bit configures the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: INT_STATUS_1
parameter.desc: Interrupt status for bank 1 Upon read: 0 = no interrupt 1 = interrupt event has occurred Upon write: 0 = no action 1 = clear interrupt status bit Each bit configures the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.desc: Interrupt edge triggering mode for bank 1 0 = trigger on single edge, using configured interrupt polarity 1 = trigger on both edges This value is ignored if corresponding interrupt source is configured to be level-sensitive Each bit configures the corresponding pin within the 32-bit bank

parameter.name: FORCE_RST
parameter.desc: Force PS in to secure reset

parameter.name: PCFG_PROG_B
parameter.desc: Program Signal used to reset FPGA. It is used to drive pcfg_program signal to FPGA. It acts as PROG_b signal in FPGA fabric.

parameter.name: PCFG_POR_CNT_4K
parameter.desc: This is to indicate to the FPGA fabric what timer to use 0 - use 64K timer 1 - use 4K timer

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: PCAP_PR
parameter.desc: This signal is used to enable Internal Partial Re-Configuration from PCAP. Default internal Partial Reconfiguration Path is through ICAP. In order to use PCAP or ICAP Partial Reconfiguration, FPGA configuration memory bit ICAP_EN bit must be set through FPGA bitstream 0 - ICAP as Internal FPGA Partial Reconfiguration Path 1 - PCAP as Internal FPGA Partial Reconfiguration Path This bit will be forced to 0 if APB unlock (0x034) is not done correctly

parameter.name: PCAP_MODE
parameter.desc: Enable PCAP interface and disable all FPGA external programming interface

parameter.name: QUARTER_PCAP_RATE_EN
parameter.desc: This bit is used to force only one data is send data to FPGA every 4 PCAP clock cycles by toggling chip select output every 4 clock cycles. This is required when AES engine in FPGA is enabled for bitstream decryption. But it should also work in normal mode with quarter throughput although it is not recommended method to reduce throughput

parameter.name: MULTIBOOT_EN
parameter.desc: This bit enables multi-boot out of reset. This is power on reset register 0 - Boot from default boot image base address 1 - Boot from multi-boot offset address

parameter.name: JTAG_CHAIN_DIS
parameter.desc: This bit is used to disable JTAG Scan chain to protect JTAG access to FPGA Fabric

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: USER_MODE
parameter.desc: Indicates which mode the CPU is running 0 - CPU is running in ROM Mode 1 - CPU is running in User Mode

parameter.name: RD_ISS_IS_1
parameter.desc: AXI read issuing capability is 1, if set, else the issuing capability is determined by bit 3 of the Config Register at offset 0x008

parameter.name: WR_ISS_IS_1
parameter.desc: AXI write issuing capability is 1, if set, else the issuing capability is determined by bit 2 of Config Register at offset 0x008

parameter.name: PCFG_AES_FUSE
parameter.desc: (Lockable, see 0x004, bit 4) This is to indicate to the FGPA fabric the source of the AES key. 0 - BBRAM 1 - eFuse

parameter.name: PCFG_AES_EN
parameter.desc: (Lockable, see 0x004, bit 3) Enable AES engine within FPGA Configuration Logic. The three bits are combined to form a single bit to enable the 'DEC' bit in FPGA configuration logic. The three bits need to be either all 0's or 1's, any inconsistency will lead to security reset. 0 - Disable AES engine 1- Enable AES engine These bits will be forced to 0 if unlock (0x034) is not done correctly.

parameter.name: SEU_EN
parameter.desc: (Lockable, see 0x004, bit 2) This is read/write control register with locking capability. This is set only on power on reset. 0 - Ignore SEU signal from FPGA. 1 - Reset PS when SEU is on

parameter.name: SEC_EN
parameter.desc: (Lockable, see 0x004, bit 1) This bit is used to indicate whether PS is secured. Secure Boot ROM code will set this bit and locked before it passes control to user code. In that sense, this is Read Only bit from user stand point of view. 0 - PS is non-secured 1 - PS is secured

parameter.name: SPNIDEN
parameter.desc: (Lockable, see 0x004, bit 0) Secure/priviledged Non-Invasive Debug Enable 0 - Disable 1 - Enable

parameter.name: SPIDEN
parameter.desc: (Lockable, see 0x004, bit 0) Secure/privileged Invasive Debug Enable 0 - Disable 1 - Enable

parameter.name: NIDEN
parameter.desc: (Lockable, see 0x004, bit 0) Non-Invasive Debug Enable 0 - Disable 1 - Enable

parameter.name: DBGEN
parameter.desc: (Lockable, see 0x004, bit 0) Invasive Debug Enable 0 - Disable 1 - Enable

parameter.name: DAP_EN
parameter.desc: (Lockable, see 0x004, bit 0) This is software control to signals to put ARM DAP AP into dummy bypass mode. It should be default at bypass mode when system is out of reset. Software could change its value until DBG_LOCK bit is on. 111 - Enable ARM DAP Others - ARM DAP will be bypassed

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: AES_FUSE_LOCK
parameter.desc: This register bit is used to lock PCFG_AES_FUSE. It requires power on reset to restore back to default 0. 0 - Open 1 - Lock

parameter.name: AES_EN_LOCK
parameter.desc: This register is used to lock PCFG_AES_EN update. It requires power on reset to restore back to default 0. 0 - Open 1 - Lock

parameter.name: SEU_LOCK
parameter.desc: This register is used to lock SEU_En update. It requires power on reset to restore back to default 0. 0 - Open 1 - Lock

parameter.name: SEC_LOCK
parameter.desc: This bit locks SEC_EN, USER_MODE. This bit is software set only. It requires power on reset to restore back to default 0. 0 - Open 1 - Locked

parameter.name: DBG_LOCK
parameter.desc: This bit locks security configuration bits include: DAP_En, DBGEN, DBGEN, NIDEN, SPNIEN. This bit is software set only. It requires power on reset to restore back to default 0. 0 - Open 1 - Locked

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: RFIFO_TH
parameter.desc: These two bits define Rx FIFO level that sets interrupt flag 00 - One fourth full for read 01 - Half full for read 10 - Three fourth full for read 11 - Full for read(User could use this signal to trigger interrupt when read FIFO overflow)

parameter.name: WFIFO_TH
parameter.desc: These two bits define Tx FIFO level that sets interrupt flag 00 - One fourth empty for write 01 - Half empty for write 10 - Three fourth empty for write 11 - empty for write

parameter.name: RCLK_EDGE
parameter.desc: Read data active clock edge 0 - falling edge 1 - rising edge

parameter.name: WCLK_EDGE
parameter.desc: Write data active clock edge 0 - falling edge 1 - rising edge

parameter.name: DISABLE_SRC_INC
parameter.desc: Disable automatic DMA AXI source address increment, if set, to allow AXI read from a keyhole address

parameter.name: DISABLE_DST_INC
parameter.desc: Disable automatic DMA AXI destination address increment, if set, to allow AXI read from a keyhole address

parameter.name: RD_ISSUE
parameter.desc: AXI read issuing capability 0 - 4 1 - 8

parameter.name: WR_ISSUE
parameter.desc: AXI write issuing capability 0 - 2 1 - 4

parameter.name: RDLEN
parameter.desc: AXI read burst length 0 - burst-of-8 1 - burst-of-16

parameter.name: WRLEN
parameter.desc: AXI write burst length 0 - burst-of-8 1 - burst-of-16

parameter.name: PSS_GTS_USR_B_INT
parameter.desc: Tri-state IO during HIZ, both edges

parameter.name: PSS_FST_CFG_B_INT
parameter.desc: First configuration done, both edges

parameter.name: PSS_GPWRDWN_B_INT
parameter.desc: Global power down, both edges

parameter.name: PSS_GTS_CFG_B_INT
parameter.desc: Tri-state IO during configuration, both edges

parameter.name: PSS_CFG_RESET_B_INT
parameter.desc: Config reset, both edges

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: AXI_WTO_INT
parameter.desc: AXI write address, data or response time out (> 6144 cpu_1x clock cycles)

parameter.name: AXI_WERR_INT
parameter.desc: AXI write response error

parameter.name: AXI_RTO_INT
parameter.desc: AXI read address or response time out (> 2048 cpu_1x clock cylces)

parameter.name: AXI_RERR_INT
parameter.desc: AXI read response error

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: RX_FIFO_OV_INT
parameter.desc: This bit is used to indicate that RX FIFO overflows. Incoming read data from PCAP will be dropped. This bit is cleared by writing a 1 to reg 0x080 bit 1.

parameter.name: WR_FIFO_LVL_INT
parameter.desc: Tx FIFO level < threshold, see reg 0x008

parameter.name: RD_FIFO_LVL_INT
parameter.desc: Rx FIFO level >= threshold, see reg 0x008

parameter.name: DMA_CMD_ERR_INT
parameter.desc: Illegal DMA command (see description in 3.1.2)

parameter.name: DMA_Q_OV_INT
parameter.desc: DMA command queue overflows

parameter.name: DMA_DONE_INT
parameter.desc: This bit is used to indicate a DMA command is done. The bit is set either as soon as DMA is done ( PCAP may yet to finish) or both DMA and PCAP are done (see Section 3.1.2 for more details)

parameter.name: D_P_DONE_INT

This count is cleared by writing a 1 to either bit location.

parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.desc: This bit drives the XADC reset signal

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: FLUSH
parameter.desc: Write to this bit location to flush the command and data FIFOs, this is a write only bit (for debugging)

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: IC_standby_enable
parameter.desc: When set, this stops the Interrupt Controller clock when no interrupts are pending, and no CPU is performing a read/write request.

parameter.name: SCU_standby_enable
parameter.desc: When set, SCU CLK is turned off when all processors are in WFI mode, there is no pending request on the ACP (if implemented), and there is no remaining activity in the SCU. When SCU CLK is off, ARREADYS, AWREADYS and WREADYS on the ACP are forced LOW. The clock is turned on when any processor leaves WFI mode, or if there is a new request on the ACP.

parameter.name: Force_all_Device_to_port0_enable
parameter.desc: When set, all requests from the ACP or processors with AxCACHE = NonCacheable Bufferable are forced to be issued on the AXI Master port M0.

parameter.name: SCU_Speculative_linefills_enable
parameter.desc: When set, coherent linefill requests are sent speculatively to the L2C-310 in parallel with the tag look-up. If the tag look-up misses, the confirmed linefill is sent to the L2C-310 and gets RDATA earlier because the data request was already initiated by the speculative request. This feature works only if the L2C-310 is present in the design.

parameter.name: SCU_RAMs_Parity_enable
parameter.desc: 1 = Parity on. 0 = Parity off. This is the default setting. This bit is always zero if support for parity is not implemented.

parameter.name: Address_filtering_enable
parameter.desc: 1 = Addressing filtering on. 0 = Addressing filtering off. The default value is the value of FILTEREN sampled when nSCURESET is deasserted. This bit is always zero if the SCU is implemented in the single master port configuration.

parameter.name: SCU_enable
parameter.desc: 1 = SCU enable. 0 = SCU disable. This is the default setting

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero (SBZ)

parameter.name: Tag_RAM_sizes
parameter.desc: Bits [15:14] indicate Cortex-A9 processor CPU3 tag RAM size if present. Bits [13:12] indicate Cortex-A9 processor CPU2 tag RAM size if present. Bits [11:10] indicate Cortex-A9 processor CPU1 tag RAM size if present. Bits [9:8] indicate Cortex-A9 processor CPU0 tag RAM size. The encoding is as follows: b11 = reserved b10 = 64KB cache, 256 indexes per tag RAM b01 = 32KB cache, 128 indexes per tag RAM b00 = 16KB cache, 64 indexes per tag RAM.

parameter.name: CPUs_SMP
parameter.desc: Shows the Cortex-A9 processors that are in Symmetric Multi-processing (SMP) or Asymmetric Multi-processing (AMP) mode. 0 = this Cortex-A9 processor is in AMP mode not taking part in coherency or not present. 1 = this Cortex-A9 processor is in SMP mode taking part in coherency. Bit 7 is for CPU3 Bit 6 is for CPU2 Bit 5 is for CPU1 Bit 4 is for CPU0.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero (SBZ)

parameter.name: CPU_number
parameter.desc: Number of CPUs present in the Cortex-A9 MPCore processor b11 = four Cortex-A9 processors, CPU0, CPU1, CPU2, and CPU3 b10 = three Cortex-A9 processors, CPU0, CPU1, and CPU2 b01 = two Cortex-A9 processors, CPU0 and CPU1 b00 = one Cortex-A9 processor, CPU0.

parameter.name: reserved_3
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero (SBZ)

parameter.name: CPU3_status
parameter.desc: Power status of the Cortex-A9 processor: b00: Normal mode. b01: Reserved. b10: the Cortex-A9 processor is about to enter (or is in) dormant mode. No coherency request is sent to the Cortex-A9 processor. b11: the Cortex-A9 processor is about to enter (or is in) powered-off mode, or is nonpresent. No coherency request is sent to the Cortex-A9 processor.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero (SBZ)

parameter.name: CPU2_status
parameter.desc: Power status of the Cortex-A9 processor

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero (SBZ)

parameter.name: CPU1_status
parameter.desc: Power status of the Cortex-A9 processor

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Should Be Zero (SBZ)

parameter.name: CPU0_status
parameter.desc: Power status of the Cortex-A9 processor

parameter.name: NA
parameter.desc: NA

parameter.name: CPU3_ways
parameter.desc: Specifies the ways that must be invalidated for CPU3. Writing to these bits has no effect if the Cortex-A9 MPCore processor has fewer than four processors.

parameter.name: CPU2_ways
parameter.desc: Specifies the ways that must be invalidated for CPU2. Writing to these bits has no effect if the Cortex-A9 MPCore processor has fewer than three processors

parameter.name: CPU1_ways
parameter.desc: Specifies the ways that must be invalidated for CPU1. Writing to these bits has no effect if the Cortex-A9 MPCore processor has fewer than two processors.

parameter.name: CPU0_ways

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: SBPR
parameter.desc: Controls wheterh the CPU interface uses the Secure or Non-secure Binary Point Register for preemption. 0: use the Secure Binary Point Register for Secure interrupts, and use the Non-secure Binary Point Register for Non-secure interrupts. 1: use the Secure Binary Point Register for both Secure and Non-secure interrupts.

parameter.name: FIQEn
parameter.desc: Controls whether the GIC signals Secure interrupts to a target processor using the FIQ or the IRQ signal. 0: using IRQ, 1: using FIQ. The GIC always signals Non-secure interrrupts using IRQ.

parameter.name: AckCtl
parameter.desc: Controls whether a Secure read of the ICCIAR, when the highest priority pending interrupt is Non-ssecure, causes the CPU interface to acknowledge the interrupt.

parameter.name: EnableNS
parameter.desc: An alias of the Enable bit in the Non-secure ICCICR. This alias bit means Secure software can enable the aisngalling of Non-secure nterrupts.

parameter.name: EnableS
parameter.desc: Global enable for the signalling of Secure interrupts by the CPU itnerfaces to the connected processors.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: Priority
parameter.desc: The priority mask level for the CPU interface. If the priority of an interrupt is higher than the value indicated by this field, the interface signals the interrupt to the processor.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: Binary_point
parameter.desc: The value of this field controls thow the 8-bit interrupt priority field is split into a group priority field, used to determine interrupt preemptioin, and a subpriority field.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: CPUID
parameter.desc: Identifies the processor that requested the interrupt. Returens the number of the CPU interface that made the request.

parameter.name: ACKINTID
parameter.desc: The interrupt ID. This read acts as an acknowledge for the interrupt.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: CPUID
parameter.desc: On completion of the processing of an SGI, this field contains the CPUID value from the corresponding ICCIAR access.

parameter.name: EOIINTID
parameter.desc: The ACKINTID value from the corresponding ICCIAR access.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: Priority
parameter.desc: The priority value of the highest priority intrerrupt that is active on the CPU itnerface.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: CPUID
parameter.desc: If the PENDINTID field returns the ID of an SGI, this field contatins the CPUID value for that interrupt. The identifies the processor that generated the itnerrupt.

parameter.name: PENDINTID
parameter.desc: The interrupt ID of the highest priority pending interrupt.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: reserved

parameter.name: Binary_point
parameter.desc: Provides an alias of the Non-secure ICCBPR.

parameter.name: Part_number
parameter.desc: Identifies the peripheral

parameter.name: Architecture_version
parameter.desc: Identifies the architecture version

parameter.name: Revision_number
parameter.desc: Returns the revision number of the Interrupt Controller. The implementer defines the format of this field.

parameter.name: Implementer
parameter.desc: Returns the JEP106 code of the company that implemented the Cortex-A9 processor interface RTL. It uses the following construct: [11:8] the JEP106 continuation code of the implementer [7] 0 [6:0] the JEP106 code [6:0] of the implementer

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: There are two timer counter registers. They are the lower 32-bit timer counter at offset 0x00 and the upper 32-bit timer counter at offset 0x04. You must access these registers with 32-bit accesses. You cannot use STRD/LDRD. To modify the register proceed as follows: 1. Clear the timer enable bit in the Global Timer Control Register 2. Write the lower 32-bit timer counter register 3. Write the upper 32-bit timer counter register 4. Set the timer enable bit. To get the value from the Global Timer Counter register proceed as follows: 1. Read the upper 32-bit timer counter register 2. Read the lower 32-bit timer counter register 3. Read the upper 32-bit timer counter register again. If the value is different to the 32-bit upper value read previously, go back to step 2. Otherwise the 64-bit timer counter value is correct.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: There are two timer counter registers. They are the lower 32-bit timer counter at offset 0x00 and the upper 32-bit timer counter at offset 0x04. You must access these registers with 32-bit accesses. You cannot use STRD/LDRD. To modify the register proceed as follows: 1. Clear the timer enable bit in the Global Timer Control Register 2. Write the lower 32-bit timer counter register 3. Write the upper 32-bit timer counter register 4. Set the timer enable bit. To get the value from the Global Timer Counter register proceed as follows: 1. Read the upper 32-bit timer counter register 2. Read the lower 32-bit timer counter register 3. Read the upper 32-bit timer counter register again. If the value is different to the 32-bit upper value read previously, go back to step 2. Otherwise the 64-bit timer counter value is correct.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: Prescaler
parameter.desc: The prescaler modifies the clock period for the decrementing event for the Counter Register. See Calculating timer intervals on page 4-2 for the equation

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: This bit is banked per Cortex-A9 processor. 1'b0: single shot mode. When the counter reaches the comparator value, sets the event flag. It is the responsibility of software to update the comparator value to get further events. 1'b1: auto increment mode. Each time the counter reaches the comparator value, the comparator register is incremented with the auto-increment register, so that further events can be set periodically without any software updates.

parameter.name: IRQ_Enable
parameter.desc: This bit is banked per Cortex-A9 processor. If set, the interrupt ID 27 is set as pending in the Interrupt Distributor when the event flag is set in the Timer Status Register.

parameter.name: Comp_Enablea
parameter.desc: This bit is banked per Cortex-A9 processor. If set, it allows the comparison between the 64-bit Timer Counter and the related 64-bit Comparator Register.

parameter.name: Timer_Enable
parameter.desc: Timer enable 1'b0 = Timer is disabled and the counter does not increment. All registers can still be read and written 1'b1 = Timer is enabled and the counter increments normally

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: UNK/SBZP

parameter.name: Event_flag
parameter.desc: This is a banked register for all Cortex-A9 processors present. The event flag is a sticky bit that is automatically set when the Counter Register reaches the Comparator Register value. If the timer interrupt is enabled, Interrupt ID 27 is set as pending in the Interrupt Distributor after the event flag is set. The event flag is cleared when written to 1. Figure 4-7 shows the Global Timer Interrupt Status Register bit assignment.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: There are two 32-bit registers, the lower 32-bit comparator value register at offset 0x10 and the upper 32-bit comparator value register at offset 0x14. You must access these registers with 32-bit accesses. You cannot use STRD/LDRD. There is a Comparator Value Register for each Cortex-A9 processor. To ensure that updates to this register do not set the Interrupt Status Register proceed as follows: 1. Clear the Comp Enable bit in the Timer Control Register. 2. Write the lower 32-bit Comparator Value Register. 3. Write the upper 32-bit Comparator Value Register. 4. Set the Comp Enable bit and, if necessary, the IRQ enable bit.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: There are two 32-bit registers, the lower 32-bit comparator value register at offset 0x10 and the upper 32-bit comparator value register at offset 0x14. You must access these registers with 32-bit accesses. You cannot use STRD/LDRD. There is a Comparator Value Register for each Cortex-A9 processor. To ensure that updates to this register do not set the Interrupt Status Register proceed as follows: 1. Clear the Comp Enable bit in the Timer Control Register. 2. Write the lower 32-bit Comparator Value Register. 3. Write the upper 32-bit Comparator Value Register. 4. Set the Comp Enable bit and, if necessary, the IRQ enable bit.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Auto-increment Register This 32-bit register gives the increment value of the Comparator Register when the Auto-increment bit is set in the Timer Control Register. Each Cortex-A9 processor present has its own Auto-increment Register If the comp enable and auto-increment bits are set when the global counter reaches the Comparator Register value, the comparator is incremented by the auto-increment value, so that a new event can be set periodically. The global timer is not affected and goes on incrementing

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The Timer Load Register contains the value copied to the Timer Counter Register when it decrements down to zero with auto reload mode enabled. Writing to the Timer Load Register means that you also write to the Timer Counter Register.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The Timer Counter Register is a decrementing counter. The Timer Counter Register decrements if the timer is enabled using the timer enable bit in the Timer Control Register. If a Cortex-A9 processor timer is in debug state, the counter only decrements when the Cortex-A9 processor returns to non debug state. When the Timer Counter Register reaches zero and auto reload mode is enabled, it reloads the value in the Timer Load Register and then decrements from that value. If auto reload mode is not enabled, the Timer Counter Register decrements down to zero and stops. When the Timer Counter Register reaches zero, the timer interrupt status event flag is set and the interrupt ID 29 is set as pending in the Interrupt Distributor, if interrupt generation is enabled in the Timer Control Register. Writing to the Timer Counter Register or Timer Load Register forces the Timer Counter Register to decrement from the newly written value.

parameter.name: SBZP
parameter.desc: UNK/SBZP.

parameter.name: Prescaler
parameter.desc: The prescaler modifies the clock period for the decrementing event for the Counter Register. See Calculating timer intervals on page 4-2 for the equation.\'5c

parameter.name: UNK_SBZP
parameter.desc: UNK/SBZP.

parameter.name: IRQ_Enable
parameter.desc: If set, the interrupt ID 29 is set as pending in the Interrupt Distributor when the event flag is set in the Timer Status Register.

parameter.name: Auto_reload
parameter.desc: 1'b0 = Single shot mode. Counter decrements down to zero, sets the event flag and stops. 1'b1 = Auto-reload mode. Each time the Counter Register reaches zero, it is reloaded with the value contained in the Timer Load Register.

parameter.name: Timer_Enable
parameter.desc: Timer enable 1'b0 = Timer is disabled and the counter does not decrement. All registers can still be read and written 1'b1 = Timer is enabled and the counter decrements normally

parameter.name: UNK_SBZP
parameter.desc: UNK/SBZP

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: This is a banked register for all Cortex-A9 processors present. The event flag is a sticky bit that is automatically set when the Counter Register reaches zero. If the timer interrupt is enabled, Interrupt ID 29 is set as pending in the Interrupt Distributor after the event flag is set. The event flag is cleared when written to 1.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Watchdog Load Register The Watchdog Load Register contains the value copied to the Watchdog Counter Register when it decrements down to zero with auto reload mode enabled, in Timer mode. Writing to the Watchdog Load Register means that you also write to the Watchdog Counter Register

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Watchdog Counter Register The Watchdog Counter Register is a down counter. It decrements if the Watchdog is enabled using the Watchdog enable bit in the Watchdog Control Register. If the Cortex-A9 processor associated with the Watchdog is in debug state, the counter does not decrement until the Cortex-A9 processor returns to non debug state. When the Watchdog Counter Register reaches zero and auto reload mode is enabled, and in timer mode, it reloads the value in the Watchdog Load Register and then decrements from that value. If auto reload mode is not enabled or the watchdog is not in timer mode, the Watchdog Counter Register decrements down to zero and stops. When in watchdog mode the only way to update the Watchdog Counter Register is to write to the Watchdog Load Register. When in timer mode the Watchdog Counter Register is write accessible. The behavior of the watchdog when the Watchdog Counter Register reaches zero depends on its current mode: Timer mode When the Watchdog Counter Register reaches zero, the watchdog interrupt status event flag is set and the interrupt ID 30 is set as pending in the Interrupt Distributor, if interrupt generation is enabled in the Watchdog Control Register. Watchdog mode If a software failure prevents the Watchdog Counter Register from being refreshed, the Watchdog Counter Register reaches zero, the Watchdog reset status flag is set and the associated WDRESETREQ reset request output pin is asserted. The external reset source is then responsible for resetting all or part of the Cortex-A9 MPCore design.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved.

parameter.name: Prescaler
parameter.desc: The prescaler modifies the clock period for the decrementing event for the Counter Register.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Reserved.

parameter.name: Watchdog_mode
parameter.desc: 1'b0 = Timer mode, default Writing a zero to this bit has no effect. You must use the Watchdog Disable Register to put the watchdog into timer mode. See Watchdog Disable Register on page 4-9. 1'b1 = Watchdog mode.

parameter.name: IT_Enable
parameter.desc: If set, the interrupt ID 30 is set as pending in the Interrupt Distributor when the event flag is set in the watchdog Status Register. In watchdog mode this bit is ignored

parameter.name: Auto_reload
parameter.desc: 1'b0 = Single shot mode. Counter decrements down to zero, sets the event flag and stops. 1'b1 = Auto-reload mode. Each time the Counter Register reaches zero, it is reloaded with the value contained in the Load Register and then continues decrementing.

parameter.name: Watchdog_Enable
parameter.desc: Global watchdog enable 1'b0 = Watchdog is disabled and the counter does not decrement. All registers can still be read and /or written 1'b1 = Watchdog is enabled and the counter decrements normally.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: Event_flag
parameter.desc: The event flag is a sticky bit that is automatically set when the Counter Register reaches zero in timer mode. If the watchdog interrupt is enabled, Interrupt ID 30 is set as pending in the Interrupt Distributor after the event flag is set. The event flag is cleared when written with a value of 1. Trying to write a zero to the event flag or a one when it is not set has no effect.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: Reset_flag
parameter.desc: The reset flag is a sticky bit that is automatically set when the Counter Register reaches zero and a reset request is sent accordingly. (In watchdog mode) The reset flag is cleared when written with a value of 1. Trying to write a zero to the reset flag or a one when it is not set has no effect. This flag is not reset by normal Cortex-A9 processor resets but has its own reset line, nWDRESET. nWDRESET must not be asserted when the Cortex-A9 processor reset assertion is the result of a watchdog reset request with WDRESETREQ. This distinction enables software to differentiate between a normal boot sequence, reset flag is zero, and one caused by a previous watchdog time-out, reset flag set to one.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Watchdog Disable Register Use the Watchdog Disable Register to switch from watchdog to timer mode. The software must write 0x12345678 then 0x87654321 successively to the Watchdog Disable Register so that the watchdog mode bit in the Watchdog Control Register is set to zero. If one of the values written to the Watchdog Disable Register is incorrect or if any other write occurs in between the two word writes, the watchdog remains in its current state. To reactivate the Watchdog, the software must write 1 to the watchdog mode bit of the Watchdog Control Register.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: Enable_Non_secure
parameter.desc: 0 = disables all Non-secure interrupts control bits in the distributor from changing state because of any external stimulus change that occurs on the corresponding SPI or PPI signals 1 = enables the distributor to update register locations for Non-secure interrupts FOR: ICDDCR_for_Non_secure_mode 31,1 --> Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: Enable_secure
parameter.desc: 0 = disables all Secure interrupt control bits in the distributor from changing state because of any external stimulus change that occurs on the corresponding SPI or PPI signals. 1 = enables the distributor to update register locations for Secure interrupts. FOR: ICDDCR_for_Non_secure_mode 0 --> Enable_Non_secure --> 0 = disables all Non-secure interrupts control bits in the distributor from changing state because of any external stimulus change that occurs on the corresponding SPI or PPI signals 1 = enables the distributor to update register locations for Non-secure interrupts

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero.

parameter.name: LSPI
parameter.desc: Returns the number of Lockable Shared Peripheral Interrupts (LSPIs) that the controller contains. The encoding is: b11111 = 31 LSPIs, which are the interrupts of IDs 32-62. When CFGSDISABLE is HIGH then the interrupt controller prevents writes to any register locations that control the operating state of an LSPI.

parameter.name: SecurityExtn
parameter.desc: Returns the number of security domains that the controller contains: 1 = the controller contains two security domains. This bit always returns the value one.

parameter.name: SBZ
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: CPU_Number
parameter.desc: The encoding is: b000 the Cortex-A9 MPCore configuration contains one Cortex-A9 processor. b001 the Cortex-A9 MPCore configuration contains two Cortex-A9 processors. b010 the Cortex-A9 MPCore configuration contains three Cortex-A9 processors. b011 the Cortex-A9 MPCore configuration contains four Cortex-A9 processors. b1xx: Unused values.

parameter.name: IT_Lines_Number
parameter.desc: The encoding is: b00000 = the distributor provides 32 interruptsa, no external interrupt lines. b00001 = the distributor provides 64 interrupts, 32 external interrupt lines. b00010 = the distributor provides 96 interrupts, 64 external interrupt lines. b00011 = the distributor provide 128 interrupts, 96 external interrupt lines. b00100 = the distributor provides 160 interrupts, 128 external interrupt lines. b00101 = the distributor provides 192 interrupts, 160 external interrupt lines. b00110 = the distributor provides 224 interrupts, 192 external interrupt lines. b00111 = the distributor provides 256 interrupts, 224 external interrupt lines. All other values not used.

parameter.name: Implementation_Version
parameter.desc: Gives implementation version number

parameter.name: Revision_Number
parameter.desc: Return the revision number of the controller

parameter.name: Implementer
parameter.desc: Implementer Number

parameter.name: Security_Status
parameter.desc: The ICDISRn provide a Security status bit for each interupt supported by the GIC. Each bit controls the security status of the corresponding interrupt. Acessible by Secure accesses only. The register addresses are RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses. ICDISR0 is banked for each connected processor.

parameter.name: Security_Status
parameter.desc: The ICDISRn provide a Security status bit for each interupt supported by the GIC. Each bit controls the security status of the corresponding interrupt. Acessible by Secure accesses only. The register addresses are RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses. ICDISR0 is banked for each connected processor.

parameter.name: Security_Status
parameter.desc: The ICDISRn provide a Security status bit for each interupt supported by the GIC. Each bit controls the security status of the corresponding interrupt. Acessible by Secure accesses only. The register addresses are RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses. ICDISR0 is banked for each connected processor.

parameter.name: Set
parameter.desc: The ICDISERs provide a Set-enable bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. Writing 1 to a Set-enable bit enables forwarding of the corresponding interrupt to the CPU interfaces. A register bit that corresponds to a Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure access. ICDISER0 is banked for each connected processor.

parameter.name: Set
parameter.desc: The ICDISERs provide a Set-enable bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. Writing 1 to a Set-enable bit enables forwarding of the corresponding interrupt to the CPU interfaces. A register bit that corresponds to a Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure access.

parameter.name: Set
parameter.desc: The ICDISERs provide a Set-enable bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. Writing 1 to a Set-enable bit enables forwarding of the corresponding interrupt to the CPU interfaces. A register bit that corresponds to a Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure access.

parameter.name: Clear
parameter.desc: The ICDICERs provide a Clear-enable bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. Writing 1 to a Clear-enable bit disables forwarding of the corresponding interrupt to the CPU interfaces. A register bit that corresponds to a Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses. ICDICER0 is banked for each connected processor.

parameter.name: Clear
parameter.desc: The ICDICERs provide a Clear-enable bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. Writing 1 to a Clear-enable bit disables forwarding of the corresponding interrupt to the CPU interfaces. A register bit that corresponds to a Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses.

parameter.name: Clear
parameter.desc: The ICDICERs provide a Clear-enable bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. Writing 1 to a Clear-enable bit disables forwarding of the corresponding interrupt to the CPU interfaces. A register bit that corresponds to a Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses.

parameter.name: Set
parameter.desc: The ICDISPRs provide a Set-pending bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. Writing 1 to a Set-pending bit sets the status of the corresponding peripheral interrupt to pending. A register bit that corresponds to a Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses. ICDISPR0 is banked for each connected processor.

parameter.name: Set
parameter.desc: The ICDISPRs provide a Set-pending bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. Writing 1 to a Set-pending bit sets the status of the corresponding peripheral interrupt to pending. A register bit that corresponds to a Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses. ICDISPR0 is banked for each connected processor.

parameter.desc: The ICDISPRs provide a Set-pending bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. Writing 1 to a Set-pending bit sets the status of the corresponding peripheral interrupt to pending. parameter.name: Clear
parameter.desc: The ICDICPRs provide a Clear-pending bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. Writing 1 to a Clear-pending bit clears the status of the corresponding peripheral interrupt to pending. A register bit that corresponds to a Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses. parameter.desc: The ICDICPRs provide a Clear-pending bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. parameter.desc: The ICDICPRs provide a Clear-pending bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. parameter.name: Active
parameter.desc: The ICDABRs provide an Active bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. The bit reads as one if the status of the interrupt is active or acitve and pending. Read the ICDSPR or ICDCPR to find the pending status of the interrupt. ICDABR0 is banked for each connected processor.

parameter.name: Active
parameter.desc: The ICDABRs provide an Active bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. The bit reads as one if the status of the interrupt is active or acitve and pending. Read the ICDSPR or ICDCPR to find the pending status of the interrupt. ICDABR0 is banked for each connected processor.

parameter.name: Active
parameter.desc: The ICDABRs provide an Active bit for each interrupt supported by the GIC. The bit reads as one if the status of the interrupt is active or acitve and pending. Read the ICDSPR or ICDCPR to find the pending status of the interrupt. ICDABR0 is banked for each connected processor.

parameter.name: Priority
parameter.desc: The ICDIPRs provide an 8-bit Priority field for each interrupt supported by the GIC. These registers are byte accessible. A register field that corresponds to a Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses. ICDIPR0 to ICDIPR7 are banekd for each connectred processor

parameter.name: Target
parameter.desc: The ICDIPTRs provide an 8-bit CPU targets field for each interrupt supported by the GIC. Theis field stroes the lists of processors that the interrupt is sent to if it is asserted. These registers are byte accessible. A register field that corresponds to a Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses. ICDIPTR0 to ICDIPTR7 are read-only, and each field returns a value corresponding only to the processor reading the register. Meaning of CPU tagets field bit values: 0bxxxxxxx1: CPU interface 0 0bxxxxxx1x: CPU interface 1

parameter.desc: The ICDIPTRs provide an 8-bit CPU targets field for each interrupt supported by the GIC. Theis field stroes the lists of processors that the interrupt is sent to if it is asserted. These registers are byte accessible. A register field that corresponds to a Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses. ICDIPTR0 to ICDIPTR7 are read-only, and each field returns a value corresponding only to the processor reading the register. Meaning of CPU tagets field bit values: 0bxxxxxxx1: CPU interface 0 0bxxxxxx1x: CPU interface 1

parameter.name: Target

These registers are byte accessible. A register field that corresponds to a Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses. ICDIPTR0 to ICDIPTR7 are read-only, and each field returns a value corresponding only to the processor reading the register. parameter.name: Config
parameter.desc: The ICDICFRs provide a 2-bit Int_config field for each interrupt supported by the GIC. A register field that corresponds to Secure interrupt is RAZ/WI to Non-secure accesses. ICDICFR0 is read-only. Meaning of each 2-bit Int_config: SGI: both bits are read-only; always 0b10 PPI: both bits are read-only; always 0b01 (active LOW level sensitive) for PPI[1], and [4]; always 0b11(rising-edge sensitive) for PPI[0], [2], and [3]. SPI: LSB is read-only, and is alwyas 1; 0b01=active HIGHT level sensitive; 0b11=rising-edge sensitive.

parameter.name: Config
parameter.desc: (ditto) ICDICFR1 is banked for each connected processor.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved. Writes are ignored, read data is always zero

parameter.name: ppi_status
parameter.desc: Returns the status of the PPI(4:0) inputs on the distributor: * PPI[4] is nIRQ * PPI[3] is the private watchdog * PPI[2] is the private timer * PPI[1] is nFIQ * PPI[0] is the global timer. PPI[1] and PPI[4] are active LOW PPI[0], PPI[2] and PPI[3] are active HIGH. Note These bits return the actual status of the PPI(4:0) signals. The ICDISPRn and ICDICPRn registers can also provide the PPI(4:0) status but because you can write to these registers then they might not contain the actual status of the PPI(4:0) signals.

parameter.name: SBZ
parameter.desc: SBZ

parameter.name: spi_status
parameter.desc: Returns the status of the IRQS[31:0] inputs on the distributor. These bits return the actual status of the IRQS signals. Note: The ICDISPRn and ICDICPRn registers can also provide the IRQS status but because you can write to these registers then they might not contain the actual status of the IRQS signals.

parameter.name: spi_status
parameter.desc: Returns the status of the IRQS[63:32] inputs on the distributor.

parameter.name: spi_status
parameter.desc: Returns the status of the IRQS[95:64] inputs on the distributor.

parameter.name: TargetListFilter
parameter.desc: 0b00: send the interrupt ot the CPU interfaces specified in the CPUTargetList field 0b01: send the interrupt to all CPU interfaces except the CPU itnerface that requested the interrupt 0b10: send the interrupt on ly to the CPU interface that requested the interrupt 0b11: reserved

parameter.name: CPUTargetList
parameter.desc: When TargetListFilter is 0b00, defines the CPU interfaces the Distributor must send the interrupt to. Each bit refers to the corresponding CPU interface.

parameter.name: SATT
parameter.desc: Determines the condition for sending the SGI specified in the SGIINTID field to a specified CPU interfaces: 0: only if the SGI is configured as Secure on that interface. 1: only if the SGI is configured as Non-secure on that interface.

parameter.name: SBZ
parameter.desc: SBZ

parameter.name: SGIINTID
parameter.desc: The Interrupt ID of the SGI to send to the specifed CPU itnerfaces.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Defines the depth, in words, of the trace RAM.

parameter.name: FtEmpty
parameter.desc: Formatter pipeline empty. All data stored to RAM.

parameter.name: AcqComp
parameter.desc: Acquisition complete. The acquisition complete flag indicates that capture has been completed when the formatter stops because of any of the methods defined in the Formatter and Flush Control Register, or TraceCaptEn = 0. This also results in FtStopped in the Formatter and Flush Status Register going HIGH.

parameter.name: Triggered
parameter.desc: The Triggered bit is set when a trigger has been observed. This does not indicate that a trigger has been embedded in the trace data by the formatter, but is determined by the programming of the Formatter and Flush Control Register.

parameter.name: Full
parameter.desc: RAM Full. The flag indicates when the RAM write pointer has wrapped around.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Data read from the ETB Trace RAM.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Sets the read pointer used to read entries from the Trace RAM over the APB interface.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Sets the write pointer used to write entries from the CoreSight bus into the Trace RAM

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The counter is used as follows: - Trace after The counter is set to a large value, slightly less than the number of entries in the RAM. - Trace before The counter is set to a small value. - Trace about The counter is set to half the depth of the Trace RAM. This register must not be written to when trace capture is enabled (FtStopped=0, TraceCaptEn=1). If a write is attempted, the register is not updated. A read access is permitted with trace capture enabled.

parameter.name: TraceCaptEn
parameter.desc: ETB Trace Capture Enable. 1 = enable trace capture 0 = disable trace capture. This is the master enable bit forcing FtStopped HIGH when TraceCaptEn is LOW. When capture is disabled, any remaining data in the ATB formatter is stored to RAM. When all data is stored the formatter outputs FtStopped. Capture is fully disabled, or complete, when FtStopped goes HIGH.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Data written to the ETB Trace RAM. When trace capture is disabled, the contents of this register are placed into the ETB Trace RAM when this register is written to. Writing to this register increments the RAM Write Pointer Register. If trace capture is enabled, and this register is accessed, then a read from this register outputs 0xFFFFFFFF. Reads of this register never increment the RAM Write Pointer Register. A constant stream of 1s being output corresponds to a synchronization output from the ETB. If a write access is attempted, the data is not written into Trace RAM.

parameter.name: FtStopped
parameter.desc: Formatter stopped. The formatter has received a stop request signal and all trace data and post-amble has been output. Any more trace data on the ATB interface is ignored and ATREADYS goes HIGH.

parameter.name: FlInProg
parameter.desc: Flush In Progress. This is an indication of the current state of AFVALIDS.

parameter.name: StopTrig
parameter.desc: Stop the formatter when a Trigger Event has been observed.

parameter.name: StopFl
parameter.desc: Stop the formatter when a flush has completed (return of AFREADYS). This forces the FIFO to drain off any part-completed packets. Setting this bit enables this function but this is clear on reset (disabled).

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: TrigFl
parameter.desc: Indicate a trigger on Flush completion (AFREADYS being returned).

parameter.name: TrigEvt
parameter.desc: Indicate a trigger on a Trigger Event.

parameter.name: TrigIn
parameter.desc: Indicate a trigger on TRIGIN being asserted.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: FOnMan
parameter.desc: Manually generate a flush of the system. Setting this bit causes a flush to be generated. This is cleared when the flush has been serviced. This bit is clear on reset.

parameter.name: FOnTrig
parameter.desc: Generate flush using Trigger event. Set this bit to cause a flush of data in the system when a Trigger Event occurs. This bit is clear on reset.

parameter.name: FOnFlIn
parameter.desc: Generate flush using the FLUSHIN interface. Set this bit to enable use of the FLUSHIN connection. This bit is clear on reset.

parameter.name: reserved_2
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: EnFCont
parameter.desc: Continuous Formatting. Continuous mode in the ETB corresponds to normal mode with the embedding of triggers. Can only be changed when FtStopped is HIGH. This bit is clear on reset.

parameter.name: EnFTC
parameter.desc: Enable Formatting. Do not embed Triggers into the formatted stream. Trace disable cycles and triggers are indicated by TRACECTL, where fitted. Can only be changed when FtStopped is HIGH. This bit is clear on reset.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Enable Integration Test registers.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The claim tag register is used for any interrogating tools to determine if the device is being programmed or has been programmed. Read: 1= Claim tag is implemented, 0 = Claim tag is not implemented Write: 1= Set claim tag bit, 0= No effect

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: The claim tag register is used for any interrogating tools to determine if the device is being programmed or has been programmed. Read: Current value of claim tag. Write: 1= Clear claim tag bit, 0= No effect

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Write Access Code. Write behavior depends on PADDRDBG31 pin: - PADDRDBG31=0 (lower 2GB): After reset (via PRESETDBGn), ETB is locked, i.e., writes to all other registers using lower 2GB addresses are ignored. To unlock, 0xC5ACCE55 must be written this register. After the required registers are written, to lock again, write a value other than 0xC5ACCE55 to this register. - PADDRDBG31=1 (upper 2GB): ETB is unlocked when upper 2GB addresses are used to write to all the registers. However, write to this register is ignored using a upper 2GB address! Note: read from this register always returns 0, regardless of PADDRDBG31.

parameter.name: n8BIT
parameter.desc: Set to 0 since ETB implements a 32-bit lock access register

parameter.name: STATUS
parameter.desc: Read behavior depends on PADDRDBG31 pin: - PADDRDBG31=0 (lower 2GB): When a lower 2GB address is used to read this register, this bit indicates whether ETB is in locked state (1= locked, 0= unlocked). - PADDRDBG31=1 (upper 2GB): always returns 0.

parameter.name: IMP
parameter.desc: Read behavior depends on PADDRDBG31 pin: - PADDRDBG31=0 (lower 2GB): always returns 1, meaning lock mechanism are implemented. - PADDRDBG31=1 (upper 2GB): always returns 0, meaning lock mechanism is NOT implemented.

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: Indicates functionality not implemented

parameter.name: SyncATCLK
parameter.desc: ETB RAM is synchronous to ATCLK

parameter.name: InputMux
parameter.desc: no input multiplexing

parameter.name: a
parameter.desc: A trace sink and specifically an ETB

parameter.desc: 4KB Count, set to 0

parameter.name: raw_ecc_int0

parameter.name: ecc_int1
parameter.desc: Status of the ECC interrupt on interface 1

parameter.name: ecc_int0

parameter.name: ecc_int0_en

parameter.desc: Current raw interrupt status for interface 1

parameter.name: raw_int_status0

parameter.name: int_status1
parameter.desc: Current interrupt status for interface 1

parameter.name: int_status0

parameter.name: int_en1
parameter.desc: Status of memory interface 1 interrupt enable

parameter.name: int_en0
parameter.desc: Status of memory interface 0 interrupt enable

parameter.name: state
parameter.desc: Operating state of the SMC: 0 = SMC is in the ready state 1 = SMC is in the low-power state.

parameter.name: exclusive_monitors
parameter.desc: Returns the number of exclusive access monitor resources that are implemented in the SMC. b00 = 0 monitors b01 = 1 monitor b10 = 2 monitors b11 = 4 monitors.

parameter.name: reserved_1
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: remap1
parameter.desc: Returns the value of the remap_1 input.

parameter.name: memory_width1
parameter.desc: Returns the maximum width of the SMC memory data bus for interface 1: b00 = 8 bits b01 = 16 bits b10 = 32 bits b11 = reserved.

parameter.name: memory_chips1
parameter.desc: Returns the number of different chip selects that the memory interface 1 supports: b00 = 1 chip b01 = 2 chips b10 = 3 chips b11 = 4 chips.

parameter.name: memory_type1
parameter.desc: Returns the memory interface 1 type: b00 = Configuration does not include this memory interface b01 = SRAM non-multiplexed b10 = NAND b11 = SRAM multiplexed. If b00, the remaining bit slices for memory interface 1 are always read as 0.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved

parameter.name: remap0
parameter.desc: Returns the value of the remap_0 input

parameter.name: memory_width0
parameter.desc: Returns the maximum width of the SMC memory data bus for interface 0: b00 = 8 bits b01 = 16 bits b10 = 32 bits b11 = reserved.

parameter.name: memory_chips0
parameter.desc: Returns the number of different chip selects that the memory interface 0 supports: b00 = 1 chip b01 = 2 chips b10 = 3 chips b11 = 4 chips.

parameter.name: memory_type0
parameter.desc: Returns the memory interface 0 type: b00 =reserved b01 = SRAM non-multiplexed b10 = NAND b11 = SRAM multiplexed.

parameter.name: ecc_int_enable1
parameter.desc: 0 = No effect 1 = ECC interrupt enable, memory interface 1.

parameter.name: ecc_int_enable0
parameter.desc: 0 = No effect 1 = ECC interrupt enable, memory interface 0.

parameter.name: reserved
parameter.desc: Reserved, write as zero.

parameter.name: low_power_req
parameter.desc: 0 = No effect 1 = Request the SMC to enter low-power state when it next becomes idle.

parameter.name: int_enable1
parameter.desc: 0 = No effect 1 = Interrupt enable, memory interface 1.

parameter.name: int_enable0
parameter.desc: 0 = No effect 1 = Interrupt enable, memory interface 0.

parameter.name: ecc_int_disable1
parameter.desc: 0 = No effect 1 = Disable ECC Interrupt on IF1.

parameter.name: ecc_int_disable0
parameter.desc: 0 = No effect 1 = Disable ECC Interrupt on IF0.

parameter.name: int_clr_1
parameter.desc: 0 = No effect 1 = Clear SMC Interrupt 1 as an alternative to an AXI read.

parameter.name: int_clr_0
parameter.desc: 0 = No effect 1 = Clear SMC Interrupt 0 (as an alternative to an AXI read).

parameter.name: low_power_exit
parameter.desc: 0 = No effect 1 = Request the SMC to exit low-power state.

parameter.name: int_disable1
parameter.desc: 0 = No effect 1 = Interrupt disable, memory interface 1.

parameter.name: int_disable0
parameter.desc: 0 = No effect 1 = Interrupt disable, memory interface 0.

parameter.name: chip_select
parameter.desc: Selects chip configuration register bank to update, and enables chip mode register access depending on cmd_type. The encoding is: b000-b011 = Chip selects 1-4 on interface 0 (NOR only has 2 CS so only b000/b001 are valid) b100-b111 = Chip selects 1-4 on interface 1 (NAND only has 1 CS so only b100 is valid)

parameter.name: cmd_type
parameter.desc: Selects the command type: b00 = UpdateRegs and AXI b01 = ModeReg b10 = UpdateRegs b11 = ModeReg and UpdateRegs.

parameter.name: set_cre
parameter.desc: Maps to the configuration register enable signal, cre, when a ModeReg command is issued. The encoding is: 0 = cre is LOW 1 = cre is HIGH when ModeReg write occurs.

parameter.name: addr
parameter.desc: When cmd_type = UpdateRegs and AXI then: [[*]] bits [15:0] are used to match wdata[15:0] [[*]] bits [19:16] are reserved. Write as zero. When cmd_type = ModeReg or ModeReg and UpdateRegs, these bits map to the external memory address bits [19:0]. When cmd_type = UpdateRegs, these bits are reserved. Write as zero.

parameter.name: Set_t6
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to either the: [[*]] we_time bit of the sram_cycles Register The permitted values are 0x0 and 0x1. [[*]] t_rr field of the nand_cycles Register.

parameter.name: Set_t5
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to either the: [[*]] t_tr field of the sram_cycles Register. [[*]] t_ar field of the nand_cycles Register.

parameter.name: Set_t4
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to either the: [[*]] t_pc field of the sram_cycles Register. [[*]] t_clr field of the nand_cycles Register.

parameter.name: Set_t3
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to the t_wp field in either the: [[*]] sram_cycles Register [[*]] nand_cycles Register.

parameter.name: Set_t2
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to either the: [[*]] t_ceoe field of the sram_cycles Register [[*]] t_rea field of the nand_cycles Register .

parameter.name: Set_t1
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to the t_wc field in either the: [[*]] sram_cycles Register [[*]] nand_cycles Register.

parameter.name: Set_t0
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to the t_rc field in either the: [[*]] sram_cycles Register [[*]] nand_cycles Register.

parameter.name: set_burst_align
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to the specific SRAM chip opmode Register burst_align field. When you configure the SMC to perform synchronous transfersa, these bits control if memory bursts are split on memory burst boundaries: b000 = bursts can cross any address boundary b001 = burst split on memory burst boundary, that is, 32 beats for continuous b010 = burst split on 64 beat boundary b011 = burst split on 128 beat boundary b100 = burst split on 256 beat boundary b101-b111 = reserved. For a NAND memory interface these bits are reserved, and written as zero.

parameter.name: set_bls
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to the specific SRAM chip opmode Register byte lane strobe (bls) bit. This bit affects the assertion of the byte-lane strobe outputs. 0 = bls timing equals chip select timing. This is the default setting. 1 = bls timing equals we_n timing. This setting is used for eight memories that have no bls_n inputs. In this case, the bls_n output of the SMC is connected to the we_n memory input. For a NAND memory interface this bit is reserved, and written as zero.

parameter.name: set_adv
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to the specific SRAM chip opmode Register address valid (adv) bit. The memory uses the address advance signal adv_n when set. For a NAND memory interface this bit is reserved, and written as zero.

parameter.name: set_baa
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to the specific SRAM chip opmode Register burst address advance (baa) bit. The memory uses the baa_n signal when set. For a NAND memory interface this bit is reserved, and written as zero.

parameter.name: set_wr_bl
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to the specific SRAM chip opmode Register wr_bl field. Encodes the memory burst length: b000 = 1 beat b001 = 4 beats b010 = 8 beats b011 = 16 beats b100 = 32 beats b101 = continuous b110-b111 = reserved. For a NAND memory interface these bits are reserved, and written as zero.

parameter.name: set_wr_sync
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to the specific SRAM chip opmode Register wr_sync bit. The memory writes are synchronous when set. For a NAND memory interface this bit is reserved, and written as zero

parameter.name: set_rd_bl
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to the specific SRAM chip opmode Register rd_bl field. Encodes the memory burst length: b000 = 1 beat b001 = 4 beats b010 = 8 beats b011 = 16 beats b100 = 32 beats b101 = continuous b110-b111 = reserved. For a NAND memory interface these bits are reserved, and written as zero.

parameter.name: set_rd_sync
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to the specific SRAM chip opmode Register rd_sync bit. Memory in sync mode when set. For a NAND memory interface this bit is reserved, and written as zero.

parameter.name: set_mw
parameter.desc: Contains the value to be written to the specific chip opmode Register memory width (mw) field. Encodes the memory data bus width: b00 = 8 bitsb b01 = 16 bitsb b10 = 32 bits b11 = reserved. You can program this to the configured width, or half that width.

parameter.name: period
parameter.desc: Sets the number of consecutive memory burstsa that are permitted, prior to the SMC deasserting chip select to enable the PSRAM to initiate a refresh cycle. The options are: b0000 = disables the insertion of idle cycles between consecutive bursts b0001 = an idle cycle occurs after each burst b0010 = an idle cycle occurs after 2 consecutive bursts b0011 = an idle cycle occurs after 3 consecutive bursts b0100 = an idle cycle occurs after 4 consecutive bursts . . . b1111 = an idle cycle occurs after 15 consecutive bursts.

parameter.name: period
parameter.desc: Sets the number of consecutive memory burstsa that are permitted, prior to the SMC deasserting chip select to enable the PSRAM to initiate a refresh cycle. The options are: b0000 = disables the insertion of idle cycles between consecutive bursts b0001 = an idle cycle occurs after each burst b0010 = an idle cycle occurs after 2 consecutive bursts b0011 = an idle cycle occurs after 3 consecutive bursts b0100 = an idle cycle occurs after 4 consecutive bursts . . . b1111 = an idle cycle occurs after 15 consecutive bursts.

parameter.name: we_time
parameter.desc: For asynchronous multiplexed transfers this bit controls when the SMC asserts we_n: 0 = SMC asserts we_n two mclk cycles after asserting cs_n. 1 = SMC asserts we_n and cs_n together.

parameter.name: t_tr
parameter.desc: Turnaround time for SRAM chip configurations.Minimum permitted value = 1.

parameter.name: t_pc
parameter.desc: Page cycle time for SRAM chip configurations.Minimum permitted value = 1.

parameter.name: t_wp
parameter.desc: we_n assertion delay.Minimum permitted value = 1.

parameter.name: t_ceoe
parameter.desc: oe_n assertion delay for SRAM chip configurations.Minimum permitted value = 1.

parameter.name: t_wc
parameter.desc: Write cycle time.Minimum permitted value = 2.

parameter.name: t_rc
parameter.desc: Read cycle time.Minimum permitted value = 2.

parameter.name: address_match
parameter.desc: Returns the value of this tie-off. This is the comparison value for address bits [31:24] to determine the chip that is selected.

parameter.name: address_mask
parameter.desc: Returns the value of this tie-off. This is the mask for address bits[31:24] to determine the chip that must be selected. A logic 1 indicates the bit is used for comparison.

parameter.name: burst_align
parameter.desc: When you configure the SMC to perform synchronous transfersa, these bits control if memory bursts are split on memory burst boundaries: b000 = bursts can cross any address boundary b001 = burst split on memory burst boundary, that is, 32 beats for continuous b010 = burst split on 64 beat boundary b011 = burst split on 128 beat boundary b100 = burst split on 256 beat boundary b101-b111 = reserved. For a NAND memory interface these bits are reserved.

parameter.name: bls
parameter.desc: This bit affects the assertion of the byte-lane strobe outputs: 0 = bls timing equals chip select timing. This is the default setting. 1 = bls timing equals we_n timing. This setting is used for 8-bit memories that have no bls inputs. In this case, the bls_n output of the SMC is connected to the we_n memory input. For a NAND memory interface this bit is reserved.

parameter.name: adv
parameter.desc: The memory uses the address advance signal, adv_n, when set. For a NAND memory interface this bit is reserved.

parameter.name: baa
parameter.desc: The memory uses the burst address advance signal, baa_n, when set. For a NAND memory interface this bit is reserved.

parameter.name: wr_bl
parameter.desc: Selects the memory burst length for writes: b000 = 1 beat b001 = 4 beats b010 = 8 beats b011 = 16 beats b100 = 32 beats b101 = continuous b110-b111 = reserved. For a NAND memory interface these bits are reserved.

parameter.name: wr_sync
parameter.desc: When set, the memory operates in write sync mode. For a NAND memory interface this bit is reserved.

parameter.name: rd_bl
parameter.desc: Selects the memory burst length for reads: b000 = 1 beat b001 = 4 beats b010 = 8 beats b011 = 16 beats b100 = 32 beats b101 = continuous b110-b111 = reserved. For a NAND memory interface these bits are reserved.

parameter.name: rd_sync
parameter.desc: When set, the memory operates in read sync mode. For a NAND memory interface this bit is reserved.

parameter.name: mw
parameter.desc: Selects the SMC memory data bus width: b00 = 8 bits b01 = 16 bits b10 = 32 bits b11 = reserved.

parameter.name: we_time
parameter.desc: For asynchronous multiplexed transfers this bit controls when the SMC asserts we_n: 0 = SMC asserts we_n two mclk cycles after asserting cs_n. 1 = SMC asserts we_n and cs_n together.

parameter.name: t_tr
parameter.desc: Turnaround time for SRAM chip configurations.Minimum permitted value = 1.

parameter.name: t_pc
parameter.desc: Page cycle time for SRAM chip configurations.Minimum permitted value = 1.

parameter.name: t_wp
parameter.desc: we_n assertion delay.Minimum permitted value = 1.

parameter.name: t_ceoe
parameter.desc: oe_n assertion delay for SRAM chip configurations.Minimum permitted value = 1.

parameter.name: t_wc
parameter.desc: Write cycle time.Minimum permitted value = 2.

parameter.name: t_rc
parameter.desc: Read cycle time.Minimum permitted value = 2.

parameter.desc: Returns the value of this tie-off. This is the comparison value for address bits [31:24] to determine the chip that is selected.

parameter.name: t_rr
parameter.desc: busy to re_n for NAND chip configurations.Minimum permitted value = 0.

parameter.name: t_ar
parameter.desc: ID read time for NAND chip configurations.Minimum permitted value = 0.

parameter.name: t_clr
parameter.desc: Status read time for NAND chip configurations.Minimum permitted value = 0.

parameter.name: t_wp
parameter.desc: we_n de-assertion delay.Minimum permitted value = 1.

parameter.name: t_rea
parameter.desc: re_n assertion delay for NAND chip configurations.Minimum permitted value = 1.

parameter.name: t_wc
parameter.desc: Write cycle time.Minimum permitted value = 2.

parameter.name: user_status
parameter.desc: This value returns the state of the user_status[7:0] inputs

parameter.name: user_config
parameter.desc: This value sets the state of the user_config[7:0] outputs

parameter.name: ecc_read
parameter.desc: Read flags for ECC blocks. Indicates whether the stored ECC value for each block has been read from memory 0 = not read 1 = read.

parameter.name: ecc_can_correct
parameter.desc: Correctable flag for each ECC block. Indicates if the detected error is correctable. 0 = not correctable 1 = correctable.

parameter.name: ecc_fail
parameter.desc: Pass/fail flag for each ECC block

parameter.name: ecc_value_valid
parameter.desc: Valid flag for each ECC block.

parameter.name: ecc_read_not_write
parameter.desc: 0 = write 1 = read.

parameter.name: ecc_last_status
parameter.desc: b00 = Completed successfully b01 = Unaligned Address, or out-of-range b10 = Data stop after incomplete block b11 = Data stopped but values not read/written because of ecc_jump value. Note The ecc_last_status bit is only updated at the completion of an ECC calculation.

parameter.name: ecc_status
parameter.desc: Describes the status of the ECC block 0 = idle 1 = busy.

parameter.name: raw_int_status
parameter.desc: The interrupts are: [5] Abort. [4] Extra block (if used). [3] Block 3. [2] Block 2. [1] Block 1. [0] Block 0. To clear the interrupt, you must write a 1 to the appropriate bit

parameter.name: ecc_extra_block_size
parameter.desc: The size of the extra block in memory after the last 512 block: b00 = 4 bytes b01 = 8 bytes b10 = 16 bytes b11 = 32 bytes. Note These bits are only present if you configure the SMC to use the ECC Extra Block Enable option

parameter.name: ecc_extra_block
parameter.desc: If configured, this enables a small block for extra information after the last 512 bytes block in the page. Note These bits are only present if the ECC Extra Block Enable option is configured.

parameter.name: ecc_int_abort
parameter.desc: Interrupt on ECC abort

parameter.name: ecc_int_pass
parameter.desc: Interrupt when a correct ECC value is read from memory.

parameter.name: ecc_ignore_add_eight
parameter.desc: This bit is used to indicate if A8 is output with the address, required to find the aligned start of blocks: 0 = A8 is output 1 = A8 is not output.

parameter.name: ecc_jump
parameter.desc: Indicates that the memory supports column change address commands: b00 = no jumping, reads and writes only occur at end of page b01 = jump using column change commands b10 = jump using full command b11 = reserved.

parameter.name: ecc_read_end
parameter.desc: Indicates when ECC values are read from memory: 0 = the ECC value for a block must be read immediately after the block. Data access must stop on a 512 byte boundary. 1 = ECC values for all blocks are read at the end of the page.

parameter.name: ecc_mode
parameter.desc: This specifies the mode of the ECC block: b00 = bypassed. b01 = ECC values are calculated and made available on the APB interface. But they are not read to or written from memory. b10 = ECC values and calculated and read/written to memory. For a read, the ECC value is checked and the result of the check is made available on the APB interface. b11 = reserved.

parameter.name: page_size
parameter.desc: The number of 512 byte blocks in a page: b00 = No 512 byte blocks. Reserved if an ecc_extra_block is not configured and enabled. b01 = One 512 byte block. b10 = Two 512 byte blocks. b11 = Four 512 byte blocks.

parameter.name: nand_rd_cmd_end_valid
parameter.desc: Use end command

parameter.name: nand_rd_cmd_end
parameter.desc: The NAND command used to initiate a write (0x30)

parameter.name: nand_rd_cmd
parameter.desc: The NAND command used to initiate a read (0x00)

parameter.name: nand_wr_cmd
parameter.desc: The NAND command used to initiate a write (0x80)

parameter.name: nand_rd_col_change_end_valid
parameter.desc: Use end command

parameter.name: nand_rd_col_change_end
parameter.desc: The NAND command used to initiate a write

parameter.name: nand_rd_col_change
parameter.desc: The NAND command used to initiate a read or Spare bits pointer command

parameter.name: nand_wr_col_change
parameter.desc: The NAND command used to initiate a write

parameter.desc: Address bits 31 to 0

parameter.name: ecc_addr
parameter.desc: Address bits 55 to 32

parameter.desc: Interrupt flag for this value

parameter.desc: Reserved, read undefined

parameter.name: int_test_en
parameter.desc: When set, outputs are driven from the integration test registers and tied-off, and inputs can change for integration testing

parameter.name: part_number_0
parameter.desc: These bits read back as 0x5x

parameter.name: designer_0
parameter.desc: These bits read back as 0x1

parameter.name: part_number_1
parameter.desc: These bits read back as 0x3

parameter.name: revision
parameter.desc: These bits read back as: [[*]] 0x1 for r1p0 [[*]] 0x2 for r1p1 [[*]] 0x3 for r1p2 [[*]] 0x4 for r2p0 [[*]] 0x5 for r2p1.

parameter.name: designer_1
parameter.desc: These bits read back as 0x4

parameter.name: integration_cfg
parameter.desc: When set, the integration test register map at address offset 0xE00 is present for reading and writing. If clear, the integration test registers have not been implemented

parameter.name: pcell_id_0
parameter.desc: These bits read back as 0x0D

parameter.name: pcell_id_1
parameter.desc: These bits read back as 0xF0

parameter.name: pcell_id_2
parameter.desc: These bits read back as 0x5

parameter.name: pcell_id_3
parameter.desc: These bits read back as 0xB1
